loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 60 years old woman who lives with her daughter in Senaki district. Liana works at local restaurant as a cook and is a very hardworking woman. Liana wants to start additional business along her activity in order to increase family income. 

The Start Up program, which is a join initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan. With the received credit Liana will purchase a stock of clothes from wholesalers and will resell in Senaki district. This will give her a chance to increase her income. Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes in order to increase her income

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 49 years old, married and has six children. To earn a living she engaged in a banana farm with the help of her husband. She aims to have a better income to provide all the needs of her children, like food, clothing and their education. To achieve this she borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana farm so that she can produce bananas of good quality for the market that will generate a greater income.

Perla's plan for the future is to buy a vehicle for the delivery of the bananas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Pamela Yadira

texts.es: Pamela está en su plena  Juventud, es madre soltera,esta en sus 21 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Pamela vive con su padres y con su hijo, Pamela se dedica desde hace 3 años atrás a la comercialización de ropa, comenta que se dedica a este negocio para obtener los recursos necesarios para alimentar y vestir a su hijo, Pamela solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo comprando mercadería en ropa. Pamela tiene sus sueños de sacar adelante a su hijo y sobre todo mejorar su negocio para que le queden más ingresos sobre todo en estos tiempos que su hijo va a ingresar a la escuela.
texts.en: Pamela is in the prime of her youth. A 21 year old single mother, she has a 4 year old son. Pamela lives with her parents and son. Pamela has been selling clothing for 3 years. She states that she works in order to have the necessary income to feed and dress her son. Pamela seeks a loan to buy clothing. Pamela dreams of her child being successful and above all improving her business so that she has more income and that her child attends school.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 39 years old and single, from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She started doing business since she finished high school, to assist her parents in making ends meet in their family. 

She is into a buy-and-sell business of various products for ten years already. Since the school year has started in the Philippines she is now into selling different kinds of backpacks, school bags and notebooks. Her Disney-themed bags and notebook are saleable. Elementary students want to replace their bags every now and then, and notebooks are regularly needed for the whole school year. 

Luzviminda's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day.  Being single is a challenge, which she has victoriously handled, and she has encouraged herself to do her best in life. She is thanking God and you for your good heart and the financial help that will be given her.

To help her continue her buy-and-sell business she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy more colorful designs of school bags and notebooks. She has to fulfill the increasing orders for her bags and the regular need for notebooks and other school supplies for the whole school year. 

Luzviminda aims to sustain and grow her businesses. She prays that God will continue to crown her efforts with success.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various designs of school bags, backpacks, notebooks, pad paper, and pencils for sale.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 42 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of 6 children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. 

Nasreen fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She wants to earn a good amount of income to pay her utility bills on time.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for his home to improve the conditions of life.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo con quien lleva varios años de casada. Vilma se dedica a la crianza y ventas de pollos en su lugar de residencia, es así como se gana la vida y gracias a esta actividad logra suplir todas las necesidades básicas del hogar. Vilma es una mujer visionaria que busca la forma de incrementar sus ingresos y obtener mejores ganancias por lo que su mayor deseo es construir una nueva galera que sea más amplia y aumentar la crianza de pollos, pero no cuenta con las condiciones económicas para la construcción es por ello que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI  para  invertir en: láminas, madera y clavos para ampliar su galera y aumentar la crianza de pollos para obtener mayores ingresos que le generen mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Vilma is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband with whom she has been married for many years. Vilma raises and sells chickens at her home. Through this work she earns a living and thanks to this work she is able to supply all the basic needs in her home. Vilma is a visionary woman seeking a way to increase her income and obtain greater profits. Therefore she wishes to build a new chicken coop that will be bigger and increase the number of chickens she raises. But she doesn't have the funds for the construction so she decided to seek a loan from FUSAI to buy laminate, wood, and nails to expand her galley and expand raising chickens in order to obtain greater income and greater profits.

loans.use: to buy laminate, wood, and nails to expand her chicken coop and expand raising chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe polish, tooth paste, metal bands, tooth brushes, chairs, glue, etc.

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.en: Zulaiho is a shy girl. She was born in the northwestern part of Tajikistan in 1995. She is living in a beautiful big town well known as one of the touristic places of interest. She dreams of obtaining a higher education. In 2011 she successfully entered the university in the department of physico-informatics. She wants to be a teacher. She is a third-year student and is one of the active students who studies with excellence. She appealed to IMON asking for financial support to pay her higher education costs. She awaits KIva lenders' compassion.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram and his family live in a rural home in Sinyerere village in Kenya. His wife and 2 children enjoy dairy and poultry farming for it provides them with a livelihood and a source of income. Joram became a farmer in 2005. Through the years, he has been able to make minimal progress because of lack of access to financial services. Most of the income he generates goes to basic family and household expenses. 

Joram is seeking a loan to start commercial poultry farming.  He intends to use this loan to buy traditional breeds of chicken that are adapted to local conditions. He wants to take advantage of the growing demand for poultry products in the market. 

Joram will use the income that he hopes to earn from poultry farming to look after his family’s well-being and their children’s education. He also wants to continue investing in poultry.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana has been involved in business activities since 2015. She started her business with her own working capital of USD 1,000. Diana has a kiosk in her house. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to use it to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as noodles, detergents, milk, biscuits, cooking oils, sugar, aqua, sauces, glue, slippers and other things to sell. 

She is happy, because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her business and she can get a good management, and her income can be increased. So she is very happy.

loans.use: to buy noodles, detergents, milk, biscuits, cooking oils, sugar, aqua, sauces, glue, slippers and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lumière Group

texts.fr: Makaba est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Lumière», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32 ans, mère  de 5 enfants dont 3 sont scolarises et 2 n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse de la braise dans un dépôt du centre commercial de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 10 sacs de braises. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Makaba is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Lumière:. She is a client of the microfinance institution Hekima, 32 years old, and the mother of five children, of whom three are in school, and two are not in school. 

Makaba has been a vendor of charcoal at a warehouse in the town’s commercial center for two years. She is going to stock up with 10 sacks of charcoal. Her wish is to purchase a parcel of land and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs. We want very much to indicate that one client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to stock up with 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a single woman and she has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman and 43 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Vilma has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Vilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: A 33 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée et avec ses quatre enfants elle vit dans le quartier de Baguida. Adjo vend des petits poissons frits et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Grace à son crédit antérieur, Adjo réalise une très bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu et nécessite ce nouveau crédit pour acheter des paniers de poissons afin de gagner plus de bénéfices pour promouvoir l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adjo, aged 33, is a married woman living in the Baguida district with her four children. She sells small fried fish and gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Thanks to her previous loan, she has very good profitability with her revenue-generating business. She has need of this new loan to purchase baskets of fish to earn more profit in order for her children to thrive.

loans.use: tp purchase 50 baskets of fish

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a fish vendor from the town of Alegria in Cebu. She is 59 years old. She works hard to earn a living for herself, since her children are already grown. She has been selling fresh fish for 20 years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish from fishermen. Gloria dreams of living in abundance when she's old, and so she is working for her business now. A loan will allow her to anticipate a better return of her investment.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Minata, membre représentatif est mariée. Elle est la responsable de ce groupe qui regroupe des femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Le groupe de Minata respecte ses engagements car les remboursements se font à la bonne date. Elle gère une boutique et en plus de cela, elle a un kiosque. La force de cette brave dame c'est son emplacement et la qualité de ses produits. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour d'une part acheter de la farine de blé,  du sucre, du lait pour sa boutique et d'autre part gérer son kiosque. après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de sa maison et aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en:
Minata, a representative member, is a married woman. She is the official of this group of determined women, who all work in commerce. Minata’s group respects its commitments, since the payments have been made on time. 

Minata manages a store, and in addition to this. she has a kiosk. Her location and the quality of her products are the basis of the strengths of this good and honest woman. She has need of this loan in part to purchase some wheat flour, sugar, and milk for her store but also to manage her kiosk. After her sales, she will have a profit enabling her to help cover household expenses and also to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, milk, and other products necessary for her store

loans.name: Cindy

texts.en:
Cindy is 34 years old. With four children in school, Cindy works very hard to provide for them.

Cindy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, beverages, and home care products.

Cindy has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future, Cindy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, beverages and home care products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 65 years old and a widow with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Lourdes has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 27 year-old married father of two children and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the limited work access of Palestinians in Lebanon, he started working as a taxi driver to cover his family's needs and expenses. 
Omar has a good reputation among his region and he is working hard to develop his business. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to exchange his car for a newer one, which will help him provide his customers with better service, comfortable seats, good air conditioner, etc...
Omar hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to exchange his car for a newer one to provide his customers with better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, rice bran and feed to sell

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales depuis 2012, Ayaba pour acheter plus de marchandises,sollicite un prêt à WAGES pour acheter des céréales. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et dans les villes de l'intérieur. Elle souhaite à l'avenir, réinjecter le profit supplémentaires dans l'activité et assurer la bonne éducation des enfants.
texts.en: A retailer of grains since 2012, Ayaba is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase more merchandise. She gets her supplies in Lomé and from inland towns. For the future, her wish is to reinvest the extra profits into her business and to ensure a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mère de famille, akouvi a pour mari un revendeur. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus de l’eau et des œufs à la maison. C’est en 2003 qu’elle a démarré l’activité et elle sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter un congélateur et des œufs. Avec les profits qu’elle va réaliser, elle veut ouvrir une boutique et prendre soin de la famille. Elle est âgée de 45ans.
texts.en: Akouvi is a mother with a family, and her husband is a retailer. She has a revenue-generating business involving water and eggs in her house. She started her business in 2003, and she is requesting a 3rd loan from WAGES to purchase a freezer and some eggs. With the profits she will make, she wants to open a shop and take care of her family. She is 45 years old.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow to meet her customers and family's demand for milk.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 30 años de edad, apasionada por las ventas y desde su apartamento funciona su almacén misceláneo en el que ofrece a transeúntes y vecinos del sector un amplio surtido de productos cosméticos, de aseo personal, papelería y útiles escolares, recipientes desechables y demás. Ella adquirió la suficiente experiencia para iniciar su negocio al haber trabajado como vendedora en una ferretería y otros negocios de misceláneas,  consideró que trabajar desde su casa le permitiría estar mucho más tiempo con sus hijos.  Sus buenas prácticas le han permitido manejar un buen surtido, buena organización y una excelente actitud frente a los clientes, factores determinantes para el éxito o el fracaso, por eso el buen servicio que ofrece es la bandera de su negocio y lo que le ha permitido obtener buenos resultados.  Su meta es que día a día su negocio siga creciendo y actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para obtener los recursos que necesita para adquirir una nueva vitrina e invertir en juguetería y ropa. Ana aspira a que las utilidades le permitan ampliar su negocio y generar los recursos suficientes para construir un segundo piso en su apartamento y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 30, is a woman who is enamored with sales and who from her apartment operates her miscellaneous store in which she offers to passersby and neighbors in the sector an ample assortment of cosmetic products; of personal hygiene products; stationary and school supplies; disposable receptacles; and more. 
She acquired sufficient experience to begin her business from having worked as a saleswoman in a hardware store and other miscellaneous businesses.  She thinks that to work from her house will allow her to spend much more time with her children.  Her good practices have permitted her to maintain a good assortment; good organization; and a good attitude with her customers, determining factors for success or failure.  For this reason, the good service she offers is the hallmark of her business and what has permitted her to get good results. 
Her goal is that day after day her business continue growing and now she is arranging her first Kiva credit through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in order to obtain the resources to acquire a new display case and to invest in toys and clothing.  She hopes that the useful items will allow her to expand her business, to generate sufficient resources to construct a second story on her apartment, and to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to acquire a new display case and to invest in toys and clothing.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 27 years old and married with two children. Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

Jennifer has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as food, soap, junk food, candies, coffee and other groceries. 

In the future Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 28 years old and has two children. She is married and her children are in school.

Regina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for six years.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mweresa

texts.en:
Mweresa is a farmer and salesperson from the Nyamira area of Kenya. He keeps livestock and practices crop farming for a living. On his 0.5 acre farm, he has 2 dairy cows, 8 heads of poultry, 3 goats, 25 trees, tea crops and a motorcycle that he uses to transport his produce to the market. 
Mweresa generates additional income from brokering cereal grains. He aggregates cereal products from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers at a higher price. 
Given that Mweresa can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock large volumes of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more cereal grains from local farmers, which he will later sell at a higher price, using his understanding of the market conditions and prices. 
Income from this investment will help Mweresa generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereal grains for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of USD 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of secondhand clothes in the market. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more secondhand clothes such as short sleeve and long sleeve shirts, turtleneck shirts and other clothes to sell. 

Elisa opened her business in 2012 with her working capital of USD 200. She is earning a good income every day because she is selling in the center of the market; so many people are interested with her secondhand clothes.  She is very happy with her business because it has become her activity, and with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to get a good management for her.

loans.use: to buy short sleeve and long sleeve shirts, turtleneck shirts and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is so thankful that he was granted a 12,000 PHP loan, which he used to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. Although their life is hard in the Philippines, he believes that with his perseverance and faith in God, life will get better for his family.

He is hopeful that he can access an 11,000 PHP to replace and buy a new battery and tire for his jeepney. It is important that his jeepney is always in a good running condition to ensure a safe and efficient service. He will be very grateful if he can again avail of your financial aid and is thanking God and you for your good heart. His earnings will surely cover their daily needs and fund his children's education.

Romeo's simple dream is to see all his children go to college and become professionals someday. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in little leaves, maria luisa, daisies, little cheeses, kerchiefs with nougat, etc. in order to stock her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy genge stock (fruits and vegetables).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a boat to improve his fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock and put up a shed for them.

loans.name: Anakaren Lucero

texts.es:
Anakaren Lucero tiene 25 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, que pertence a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú. Es este distrito la población se dedica mayormente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, Anakaren Lucero solicita préstamo para el mejoramiento de infrestructura de su corral y compra de más animales para crianza y venta, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; ella piensa poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona, con esto podrá generar mayores ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anakaren Lucero is 25-years old. She has two children and lives with her family in a rural area of Oyotún District, which is a part of Chiclayo Province and Lambayeque Region on Perú's northern coast. The people of the District make their livings largely in agriculture, raising animals and running shops.

Anakaren Lucero makes her living raising and selling small animals, such as ducks, chickens, roosters and pigs. She has more than five years of experience in this line of work. Her business is located at her place of residence. Anakaren Lucero is requesting the loan to make improvements to her corral's infrastructure and to purchase more animals to raise and sell. The investment will help her to increase the variety and productivity of her animals, which will have a large influence on her business. Anakaren Lucero plans to meet the diverse needs and desires of her area customers, which will generate a greater income and help her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her corral's infrastructure and to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains: millet, peanuts, corn, and beans to resell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Thanks to you lenders! Recently, Herminia was granted a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase inventory. With that amount, she bought more quantities of merchandise products associated with her direct selling business. Having been able to increase her sales, Herminia found a better source of income for the family. As a result, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, Herminia still needs a certain amount to help her maintain her business operations. She is requesting a loan worth 10,000 PHP that she will use to obtain additional product sales for selling like detergent soaps, powders, lotions, and other similar products. Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that waits for Herminia. This is why she is very hopeful that you will grant her request. 

She hopes that her family will always be in good condition. Someday, she sees herself as a successful businesswoman and that is why she's striving much to improve her inventory.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain additional products to sell like detergent soaps, powders, lotions, and other similar products.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is a business women. She started in business activities a few year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.00, and she didher best with it. She is very interested in doing business. She has a bigger store but she still is requesting the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management for her business. So she is taking a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in her store including  sugar, tea, sardines, candles, toothpaste, cigarettes, noodles, biscuits, eggs, aqua, salts and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea, sardines, candles, toothpaste, cigarettes, noodles, biscuits, eggs,aqua, salts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old, married and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetable in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marlyn has been farming vegetable for 7 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Paata

texts.en:
Paata is 41 years old. He lives with his wife in the small village Askana in Ozurgeti. The family is involved in agricultural activiries. In particular, they have 3 hectare agricultural land where they grow maize and nut trees. Paata is a very hardworking man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. Paata needs money to purchase a cow and has requested a loan. 
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase a cow. As the cow is purchased Paata and his wife will start producing dairy products. They will sell dairy products locally and will increase their daily income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 32 year-old pharmaceutic from the village of Kumisi in the Gardabani district. Her family includes her husband and parents-in-law. The family members have been engaged in cattle breeding for the last 5 years. Tea's husband sells the milk-products at the local market. Tea also gets 200 GEL per month from her activity. However, the family's income isn't enough to meet all their daily costs and they require financial support to make their agribusiness more profitable. Tea received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  
Tea will buy additional cattle and the family will produce more milk-products. That will increase the profit and make more productive the family's business activity. 
 The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased.  Regards to  Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To buy cattle to expand her dairy farming

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 49 year-old married mother of eight children. Fifteen years ago she started selling fruits and vegetables to help her husband in covering their children's needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among in her region.
Fatima is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise of summer fruits and vegetables, which will help her satisfy her customers' special requests.
Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise of summer fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Virginia Feliza

texts.es:
Virginia continúa con su negocio de tejido de mantas. El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de lana de Alpaca por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Actualmente ella se dedica a su segunda actividad que es la cría de ganado lechero para la venta de leche, “continúo tejiendo y en esta época del año me dedico a juntar ganado…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que las realiza paralelamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ganado. Su sueño es mejorar sus actividades, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para su engorde. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 22 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para engordar para mejorar su negocio de venta de leche.
texts.en:
Virginia continues with her blanket knitting business. She used the loan that she received to buy alpaca wool at wholesale, and she made her payments in a timely manner because she did not experience any problems.

Currently, she is working on her second business, raising dairy cattle in order to sell milk. She states, "I continue knitting, and at this time of the year, I work raising cattle." The advantage of her businesses is that she can manage them concurrently. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy cattle.

Her dream is to improve her businesses. She wishes to buy dairy cattle to fatten. This is her fourth loan sequence with the institution in the 22 years that she has been performing this work. It is for these reasons that Virginia is requesting a loan to buy dairy cattle to fatten in order to improve her milk sale business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle to fatten in order to improve her milk sale business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops in the farm to produce a better harvest so as to meet her family's needs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 52 years old, married to Konald and she supports 4 children. 

She has been a dairy farmer for the the last 25 years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

Florence has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She will purchase a dairy cow for milk production with the loan to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily, and meet both client and family needs.

She plans to use the increased profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural business.  

Her hope is to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlyn is 32 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Arlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business including a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

Arlyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is widowed with four children and has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of personal collection products to sell to her customers.  She has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell dried fish business.

She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of personal products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Temple Eliel Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLARISSE est responsable du groupe  TEMPLE ELIEL. Mariée elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 12 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 01 des enfants va à l’école et elle à 03 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des légumes et des pagnes depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique et veux mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. CLARISSE is the official of the group TEMPLE ELIEL. A married woman, she is the mother of three. The oldest is 12, and the youngest is 4. One of the children goes to school. She has three persons to support. 

Ms. CLARISSE has been selling vegetables and 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for seven years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, she wants to purchase 10 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. She wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to open a large shop, and she wants to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 10 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Veronica Maricela

texts.es: Maricela está casada, tiene 29 años de edad, sus  2 hijas gemelas son de 7 años y están estudiando, maricela vive en la casa de su suegra, el esposo de Maricela trabaja dando mantenimiento  computadoras, Maricela se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico que son útiles de cocina,  Maricela solicita el dinero del crédito para invertir en la comprar de útiles de cocina para venderlos de manera ambulante, ofreciendo a sus amigas, familiares y sus clientas. Lo que Maricela desea es mejorar su negocio, incrementarlo para seguir  con la comercialización de sus productos y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, sobre todo en los para el bienestar de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Maricela is married. She is 29-years old and has twin daughters who are 7-years old and go to school. Maricela lives in her mother-in-law's house. Her husband works providing computer maintenance.

Maricela makes her living selling plastic kitchenware. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of kitchenware to sell to friends, family members and her customers. Maricela wants to improve her business, to expand it so she can keep selling her products and help her husband with the household expenses. Above all, she wants to help with those things that will benefit her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old, married and supports a family of 5 children. 

He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for 1 year and earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Peter has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to offer better service and to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with a large rental estate.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to offer better service and to earn more income.

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang, 64, lives in a community of Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. He has seven children in total, three are single and live under the same roof, while the other four are married and live independently. He is a fisherman who can earn, on average, an income of USD 3.00 a day. Until now, he has been in this career for more than twenty years. 

Recently, his job has been running badly, because he does not have enough fishing materials and a boat machine to assist his fishing process. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy some fishing materials and a boat machine. This loan will make a great contribution to develop his career, as well as his living standard. He is thankful for the all lenders for their kindly financial support.

loans.use: to buy some fishing materials and a boat machine.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 43 years old and has four children.  She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Judith is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Judith requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 27 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 3 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rue

texts.en:
Rue is 49 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rue is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to pays laborers for farm land preparation.

Rue has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers for farm land preparation

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es: María  tiene 53 años de edad, su esposo es agricultor de pequeños huertos de papas y  otros productos. María tiene 2 hijos y 3 hijas. María  vive con su esposo y un hijo que aun es soltero y trabaja en la agricultura. María se dedica a la crianza y al comercio de ganado, por este motivo solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de   terneros  o vaconas  para seguir en el comercio de ganado en los diferentes mercados de animales, María comenta que de su negocio es que espera seguir trabajando y como lo ha venido haciendo desde hace 20 años atrás y de aquí es que saco adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 53-years old. Her husband is a farmer and has small patches of potatoes and other products. María has two sons and three daughters. She lives with her husband and one son, who is still single and works in agriculture.

María makes her living raising and selling cattle. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of calves or cows so she can keep selling livestock in the various animal markets. María says that she hopes her business allows her to continue working, as she has been doing for the last twenty years. It is how she was able to get her children ahead.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter and his family live in a rural home in western Kenya. He, his wife and two children enjoy dairy, poultry and tree farming. Farming is their livelihood and source of income. Peter started farming 15 years ago, and now he has one dairy cow, 15 head of poultry and 100 trees. He sells his farm produce at a local market near his farm. Most of the income he generates goes to household and business-related expenses.  

Peter is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cow. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials to get the project done. He projects the animal's health and welfare will be improved as a result of the loan investment. This will further lead to improved milk production and income. Your loan investment will help Peter and his family improve their livelihood and lead a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Kin's Group

texts.en: Kin is a 33 years old woman, living in Kampong Tom province. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and works on another farm for a fee. Kin has been involved in this business for fifteen years and it earns her about 20,600KHR per day to support her family’s living. Unfortunately, last year her crop did not grow well because of natural disaster that happened in her village. Now she does not have enough income to fulfill her family’s needs of having fresh water to survive their life. So she decided to take a loan via VisionFund to buy a water filter for home use. This is the first loan cycle for Kin with VisionFund. She hopes this loan will help her family to have better living conditions and health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for personal use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase undergarments, such as socks, pantyhose, and bras.

loans.name: Graciet

texts.en: Graciet is a business women. Every day she is gains a good incomes from her business because she is sells in the center of the market so many people come to buy in her kiosk, She is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including water, candies, shampoo, coffee, detergents, lighters, milk, biscuits and other items to sell. Graciet has been involved in business the last few years. She started with her own working capital of $ 1000.00. She is still happy to do business and with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to move her business to a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy water, candies, shampoo, coffee, detergents, lighters, milk, biscuits and other items to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 39 years old, married to Pauline and supports a family of 5 children. 

He has been operating a motorcycle transport business the last 3 years earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Richard has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to provide better service and to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle for better service and to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize for sale to clients to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and fertilizer for her farming activity so as to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es:
Silvia, es la jefa de su hogar, vive con dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad, sola ha tenido que luchar para sacar a sus hijos adelante. Su actividad económica es vender productos variados como ropa, bebidas enlatada, frutas entre otros, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre, ya tiene 13 años de estar vendiendo en un puesto ubicado en el mercado municipal, cuenta con mucha experiencia para atender a sus clientes y administrar las ganancias.
Ha solicitado un préstamo para fortalecer su negocio, comprara uvas, manzanas, lichas, guineos, piñas etc., así como también ropa interior, ofrecerá mercadería fresca y que sus clientes buscan en su negocio, espera atender mayor cantidad de clientes e incrementar sus ventas, el riesgo es que la fruta es perecedera.
Los proyectos de vida que Silvia tiene son comprar con ayuda de créditos su propia casa y darles a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para que se superen académicamente.
texts.en:
Silvia is the head of her household.  She lives with two children, who are 14- and 12-years old respectively.  Silvia has had to work hard, by herself, to get her children ahead.  Her business is selling various products, such as clothing, canned drinks, fruit and other items.  She learned the trade from her mother and has been selling her products from her sales tall in the municipal market for thirteen years.  She has a lot of experience waiting on her customers and managing her profits. 
Siliva has requested a loan to strengthen her business.  She will purchase grapes, apples, "lichas" (a local fruit), bananas, pineapples etc., as well as undergarments.  Her business will sell fresh goods and whatever else her customers may seek out.  Siliva hopes to tend to a greater number of customers and to increase her sales.  Her risk is that the fruit is perishable. 
Silivia's life projects are to purchase, with the help of a loan, her own home and to give her children the support they need to excel academically.

loans.use: to purchase grapes, apples, "lichas" (a local fruit), bananas, pineapples etc., and also undergarments.  Her business sells fresh goods and whatever else her customers may seek out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy materials and build a bathroom at their home to improve access to sanitation and water source.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is aged 49 years, married to Eucabeth and he supports four children.He has been a butcher for the last 12 years. The business earns him KES. 13,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a bull for slaughter for meat to sell to clients, and meet both client and family needs.


He plans to use the increased profit to repay the loan and expand his business.His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a bull for slaughter for meat to sell to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Laura Veraly

texts.es: Laura de 35 años de edad es madre soltera y reside en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 13 años de edad quien gracias al sacrificio de su madre se encuentra estudiando. Laura se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y venta de pollos en su casa de habitación y gracias a los buenos ingresos que obtiene puede suplir todas las necesidades del hogar. Laura desea incrementar sus ventas para poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos y  poder  así mejorar su condiciones de vida por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar pollos e incrementar las ventas de su negocio y de esta forma generar mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Laura is 35-years and a single mother.  She lives in her own home with her 13-year old son who, thanks to Laura's sacrifices, is going go school.  Laura has made her living for a number of years raising and selling chickens from her place of residence.  Thanks to the good income she earns, she is able to provide for all the household necessities.  Laura wants to increase her sales so she can earn a better income and be able to improve her quality of life.  She has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to purchase chickens and increase her business sales so that she can generate a greater income, which will allow her to improve her quality life.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and to increase her business sales so she can generate a larger profit to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Janet, quien con su credikiva pudo surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, así mismo hizo realidad su sueño de realizar mejoras locativas a la vivienda en la que reside, gracias a las utilidades obtenidas en el ejercicio de su actividad; por eso ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por el apoyo a los empresarios pequeños de Colombia”. En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará prendas de vestir que son productos de alta rotación y responderá a encargos de productos de sus clientes. Su credikiva nuevamente será todo un éxito gracias a su experiencia en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Janet, who with her Kiva loan could supply her business and increase sales. Also, she realized her dream of improving her home thanks to the profits obtained running her business. So she tells Kiva financiers "Thank you for supporting small business in Columbia."

She is currently applying for her second Kiva loan, with which she will purchase products with high turnover rate and respond to product orders from her customers. Her new Kiva loan will be a success due to her experience in this activity.

loans.use: to buy cold cuts, outerwear, undergarments, toiletries, and Christmas items.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, es una persona que tiene un hogar formado por su esposa y un hijo de 16 años de edad, ellos son personas dependientes y ha manifestado no contar con apoyo económico de sus parientes. Se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de mecánico en su propio taller de automóviles, aprendió a desarrollar está actividad con el apoyo de amistades, su negocio funciona hace 10 años y lo atiende a tiempo completo.
Invertirá en pastillas para frenos, amortiguadores, aceite, etc., contara con todo lo necesario para brindar un excelente servicio a sus clientes, al trabajar con créditos espera que su negocio crezca y que la rentabilidad del mismo sea mayor para que la calidad de vida familiar sea más confortable.
La visión de Pedro es utilizar el crédito de la mejor manera y cancelarlo con mucha puntualidad.
texts.en: Pedro is a person with a household formed by his wife and his 16 year old son. They are his dependents and they stated that they do not have economic support from their relatives. He works as a mechanic with his own auto repair shop. He learned to develop this activity with the help of friends. He has run this business for the past 10 years and he cares for it full time. He wants to invest in brake pads, shock absorbers, oil, etc. He will have everything needed to provide an excellent service to his clients. Working on credit, he hopes to grow his business and that the profitability would be greater so that his family's quality of life would improve. Pedro's vision is to use the loan the best way and to pay it off on time.

loans.use: ITo invest on brake pads, shock absorbers, oil, etc, to be able to have what is necessary to give an excellent service to his client.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad hospitalaria, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Él se dedica a la compra y venta de panca de maíz desde hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, con muy buenas referencias laborales y personales de parte de cliente y vecinos; ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de panca para ofrecerlo a los moradores aledaños y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, de esta manera podrá generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Robert is 46 years old; he lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a welcoming community whose inhabitants work in farming, trade, and ranching, located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast.  

He has been buying and selling dried maize leaves for a living for five years; his business is located in his home and he has very good work and professional references from his customers and neighbors.  He has requested this loan to buy a larger quantity of dried maize leaves to sell to the people who live in neighboring areas and thereby make his business grow; this will allow him to generate more income and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of dried maize leaves to sell to people who live in neighboring areas.

loans.name: Maria Madonia Natividad

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar los ingredientes que utilizara para la venta de pupusas que realiza desde hace mucho tiempo en su vivienda, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y el delicioso sabor de sus productos cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes. María vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de un varón de 26 años de edad y dos señoritas de 22 años de edad que son gemelas todas apoyan en la economía del hogar. María desea invertir en su negocio, ya que no logra cumplir con la demanda de productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, loroco, aceite, harina de arroz, etc. para su venta de pupusas.
texts.en: María, who is 50, is an entrepreneurial woman who gets up early every day to prepare the ingredients she uses to sell pupusas, which she has been making at home for a long time.  Thanks to her experience and her products' delicious taste she has a large number of customers.  María lives with her husband and their three children, a 26-year-old son and two 22-year-old young ladies who are twins, all of whom contribute to the household finances.  María wants to invest in her business as she has not been able to keep up with the demand for her products, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: corn, beans, cream cheese, pork rinds, loroco, oil, rice flour, etc. for her pupusa business.

loans.use: to invest in: corn, beans, cream cheese, pork rinds, loroco, oil, rice flour, etc. for her pupusa business

loans.name: Isai

texts.es:
Isaí, es panificador, vive en casa propia con su núcleo familiar que está formado por su esposa y dos hijos, sus hijos no tienen edad para asistir a la escuela y su esposa se dedica a labores domésticas, es propietario de una panadería, el oficio se lo enseñaron hace 10 años cuando inicio a trabajar como empleado en otro negocio, así pudo costear sus estudios y al cumplir 19 años de edad decidió fundar su negocio propio, el horario en que trabaja es de 4:00 am. a 7:00 am., y una segunda jornada de 2:00 pm. a 5:00 pm. 
Actualmente el techo de la galera en que guarda su equipo y realiza algunas actividades se encuentra agrietado, requiere de un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar el cambio de techo, de esta manera el equipo de trabajo estará resguardado y mantendrá la continuidad de su negocio, espera que la productividad de pan sea mayor y que sus clientes se mantengan satisfechos.
Sus propósitos son ampliar la panadería y cancelar las deudas.
texts.en:
Isaí is a baker and lives in his own home with his nuclear family, which is made up of his wife and two children; his children are not old enough to go to school and his wife is a homemaker.  He owns a bakery; he learned this trade ten years ago when he started work as an employee at another business, which is how he was able to pay for his education, and when he turned 19 he decided to start his own business.  His work schedule is from 4:00 am to 7:00 am and a second shift from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm.  

Currently the roof of the shed where he keeps his equipment and does certain tasks is cracked; he needs this loan to buy construction materials and to pay to have the roof redone.  This will protect his work equipment and keep his business going; he hopes that his bread production will increase and his customers will stay satisfied.  

His goals are to expand his bakery and repay his debts.

loans.use: tob uy construction materials and pay for his roof to be redone, which will protect his work equipment and keep his business going

loans.name: Dúo La Excelencia Group

texts.es: Dúo la Excelencia: Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Mayra de 35 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 5 años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos, ya que desea agrandar mas su negocio porque sus clientes han aumentado, en el primer credito le fue muy bien ya que pudo mejorar en gran manera su ventas, espera que le puedan seguir apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en:
One member of this group is Mayra, who is 35 years old. She has made a living selling cosmetics for the past 5 years. 

She is taking the opportunity to ask for this loan to buy cosmetics, now that she wants to grow her business, since her clientele has increased. She did really well with her first loan since she was able to greatly increase her sales. She hopes that you can continue to support her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: A sus 19 años José es un joven que  trabaja en la agricultura, comenta que vive en el campo y son sus padres quienes le enseñan la manera de cuidar sus cultivos, José se dedica desde hace 4  años atrás a la agricultura y comenta que en este tiempo ya va cogiendo experiencia en esta actividad, Jose solicita el dinero de crédito para comprar abono, fungicidas y pago de mano de obra para tener sus cultivos en buen estado, Jose tiene la esperanza de sembrar  cultivos mas amplios y seguir trabajando  en esta actividad y llegar a ser un gran  agricultor, para mejorar la calidad de vida junto a sus padres.
texts.en: At 19, José is a young man who works in farming; he tells us that he lives in the country and his parents were the ones who showed him how to take care of his crops.  José started working in farming 4 years ago and he tells us that during that time he has been accumulating experience in the business.  José is requesting the money from the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicides, and to pay for labor so his crops will be in good shape.  José hopes to plant larger crops and to keep working in this business and to become a great farmer so he can improve his quality of life along with that of his parents.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 06 hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el Caserío Mangaypa que pertenece al distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Lázaro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas: la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Lázaro espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lázaro is 45 years old and lives with his wife and his 6 children in his own rustic house in Caserío Mangaypa, in the Pomahuaca district, which is located in the Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in this district is calm; the inhabitants primarily make a living in agriculture, retail, and raising livestock.

Lázaro makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 15 years of experience, and with that very good personal and work references in the area. 

He will use the awarded loan for his agricultural labor: he will buy fertilizers to adequately maintain his coffee farm, as well as to pay to hire labor during the harvest season. With this, Lázaro hopes to offer better quality coffee to his customers, which would have a positive impact on his income level and in turn will improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to adequately maintain his coffee farm

loans.name: Jose Dionisio

texts.es:
José, con el préstamo anterior ha tenido oportunidad de mantenerse trabajando en la agricultura y ha tendido alimento para el ganado, las condiciones económicas han cambiado positivamente, su familia se mantiene y todos sus miembros se encuentran saludables. 
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar insecticidas, abono, plaguicidas y semilla mejorada de maíz y maicillo para sembrar en la nueva temporada, con ello podrá mantener el negocio con vida.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, José has had the opportunity to keep working in farming and he has had feed for his cattle; his financial situation has changed for the better; his family is taken care of and all of its members are healthy.  

He is requesting a new loan to buy insecticides, fertilizer, pest control, and improved corn and sorghum seed to plant during the coming season; this will allow him to keep his business going.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, pest control, and improved corn and sorghum seed to plant during the next season

loans.name: Air's Group

texts.en: Air is a rural villager who lives in Kampong Thom province. She is the mother of seven children. For more than five years, rice growing and paid labor have been the main sources of her family’s income. These activities earn Air 21,700 KHR per day. Due to having no fresh water for her farming life and lack of funds to meet her needs, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan from VisionFund to buy a water filter for her family’s needs. This is Air’s first loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She hopes this loan will help her to have better living conditions and good health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old and she supports 3 children.

She has been selling maize cereals in the market for the past 2 years and the business earns her 11,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stock of maize cereals to meet both client and family needs.

She plans to use her profits to repay the loan and expand her business.

Mary’s hope is to be financially stable and to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase maize cereals to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for adding soil nutrients to get a better harvest for family use and for sale to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to expand her farming activity.

loans.name: Tito Fernando

texts.es: Tito tiene 32 años de edad, Tito vive en el campo junto a sus padres, una hermana y una sobrina, Tito comenta que es el quiene les apoya ya que sus padres necesitan de su ayuda por motivo que tiene que salir la noche a cuidar el ganado para que no se les roben, Tito junto a su familia se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la venta de la leche. Tito también se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, Tito solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar una vaca para  ordeñarla  ya que  la venta de leche  es su principal fuente de ingresos, Tito tiene la aspiración de seguir en su negocio ya que es asi como trabaja y espera a futuro poder comprar un terreno para tener su ganado y que la ganaderia siga siendo un negocio familiar.
texts.en: Tito is 32 years old.  Tito lives in the country with his parents, a sister, and a niece.  Tito tells us that he is the one who supports them as his parents need his help, which is why he has to go out at night and watch the cattle so no one steals them.  Tito and his family raise cattle and sell milk for a living.  Tito also does farm field work.  Tito is requesting the money from the loan to buy a cow to milk as milk sales are his primary source of income.  Tito hopes to continue on with his business as he does this work in hopes of being able to buy land in the future where he can keep his cattle and keep ranching as the family business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Naheeda

texts.en:
Naheeda, 30 years old, is a very enthusiastic, married woman. Her brother (also shown in the photo) runs a general store to meet their household expenses. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Naheeda has accessed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her brother, who bought additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, biscuits, grains, etc. Naheeda is hopeful that her brother’s earnings will increase and their future will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, biscuits, grains, etc.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy is a 23-year-old woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Thom province. Nowadays, she grows rice as the main source of her family’s income and is a paid worker for an additional source of income for her to complement her family’s needs. She has been involved in this business (rice farmer) for several years, and she is able to earn income of about 22,500 KHR per day through these businesses.

Unfortunately, last year, her crop did not grow well because a natural disaster happened in her village, which caused a bad affect on her daily income. Moreover, they have no fresh water to survive her farming life, so she decided to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy a water filter for her family’s use. She hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as humble.

Paulina operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a viable place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more stock of cereals. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

Paulina's business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes to educate her children in the future.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and presently has two children in school.

Leony has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 11,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell.

Leony would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Yolanda dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristelia

texts.es:
María, es soltera y vive con su hija, con la responsabilidad que significa sacar una familia adelante hace 20 años instalo su propio negocio en su vivienda, el cual consiste en elaborar veladoras de todo los tamaños, inicio con pocos clientes y actualmente atiende a una cartera de clientes más grande, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Con el préstamo únicamente comprara cera, mechas y recipientes para vender el producto, tendrá la materia prima para elaborar las velas, espera ampliar el mercado y generar nuevas ganancias para resarcir la deuda.
María sueña con tener un negocio más grande, contar con más clientes satisfechos y compartir con su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
María is single and lives with her daughter.  When faced with the responsibility of taking care of a family 20 years ago, she started her own business at home, which consists of making candles in all different sizes.  She started out with few customers and she currently has a longer client list.  Her work schedule is from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. 

With this loan she will only buy wax, candles, and holders to sell her product.  She will have the raw material to make her candles; she hopes to expand her market and generate new income to repay her debt. 

María dreams of having a larger business, having more satisfied customers, and sharing a more dignified way of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy wax, matches, and holders to sell her product; she will have the raw material to make her candles

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a hardworking man who sells textiles. He is married with 4 children, living in Masindi, Uganda. He started his business to cater to his family's increasing needs. 

Fred wishes to educate his children and construct a dream house for them. However, he is challenged by inadequate capital to buy building materials.

He is in need of a loan to buy bricks, cement, and other materials for construction.

loans.use: to buy materials for construction.

loans.name: Jeana

texts.en:
Jeana hails from the town of Antequera, Bohol. She is a 33-year-old married woman with two dependents, ages 10 and 7, respectively. She engages in a food-vending business, preparing and selling snack foods such as donuts, banana cue, ice candy, and camote cue (a popular snack food in the Philippines made from camote, or sweet potato, that is coated with brown sugar and then fried to cook and to caramelize the sugar). Her husband earns a living as a carpenter.

Jeana has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her food-vending business, such as bananas, flour, sweet potatoes, edible oil, and sugar. With such ingredients available, she could continue to produce a variety of snack foods to sell, which would improve her income and enable her to meet her payment obligations. She could handle her finances and start to expand her business. 

Jeana hopes that her ongoing business will be productive so she can continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Kipkirui

texts.en:
Kipkirui is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be disciplined and determined. He operates an M-pesa business where he offers mobile-phone-based money transfer services. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to add M-pesa float. His business goal is to open more business branches within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float for his money-transfer business

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a posho mill where she grinds maize to produce maize flour for sale. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another maize miller. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another maize miller

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus, 58, is a father to six kids, and a faithful husband to Virgie, a vendor. Jesus supports his family through operating a small sari-sari store in the area. Together with his wife's income, they provide for the basic necessities of the family. 

Jesus dreams of improving the lives of his family members and expanding his business. However, he can't do this without enough money to start up. Thus, he is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 in order to purchase larger quantities of grocery items to display and sell in his store. More products will surely give him the opportunity to acquire greater sales and save for his dream house. 

Your helping hands can change Jesus's life today. 

Jesus meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantities of grocery items to display and sell in his store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, who is 56 years old, is currently managing a small barbecue business. Being in this kind of business has been quite difficult for her since she started her business three years ago. However, it didn't become a discouragement to her; instead she worked hard to prove the taste of her product to people. 

Now, Evelyn's inventory is gradually growing, and she needs enough capital to meet customer demand. She would like to obtain a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more raw ingredients for her barbecue business. The loan will serve as additional capital to expand the business, and she really hopes that you can help her with this. This means a lot to her, especially the increase in profit she expects to earn. It will enable her to provide her family with a better daily life and help with expenses and necessities.

One day in the future, Evelyn dreams of her business growing even more. She wants to give her family a successful life. She also prays that her family will grow their faith in God.

Evelyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
To be able to raise her five children, Marilou, who is 35 years old and from Pasay, Metro Manila, is very passionate and hardworking in operating her current business, a barber shop. With her expert skills in grooming and making people more attractive, customers pay more for her services, and she earns a living. The income she gains from her trade is just enough to support her entire household.

Marilou, who aspires to grow her business and be successful, wants to ask for loan assistance from you worth 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she will use to buy more beauty products and other materials for her shop.
