This will indeed be a great help for her and her family in covering their daily expenses and necessities. Your help can mean a lot now to Marilou. In advance, we want to thank you for your consideration and unwavering generosity. 

Marilou regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more beauty products and other materials needed for her shop.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
It’s not impossible to have a better living condition someday. This is Lorna’s wish. She is 61 years old, single, and has a legally adopted son. She runs a variety store in her community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She works hard and saves little by little in order to expand her business.    

The people in Lorna's community are quite familiar with each other. When her neighbors ask for credit for the goods they get, she cannot refuse them. Sometimes it depletes her capital.

As of now, she needs additional capital of PHP 10,000 for her business. She will use it to buy additional items for her inventory. She hopes to improve her profit so her son can continue his studies soon. Her son had no choice but to stop studying some years ago when they were really broke. Now she’s positive that she can regain some deficit through your generous support.

Lorna is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Salodada

texts.en:
Salodada, 58, is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Salodada has a business buying and selling recycled material in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more sacks of recycled material to sell.

Salodada has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of recycled material to sell.

loans.name: Marie Florentine

texts.fr:
Marie Florentine est une femme dynamique et travailleuse de 54 ans. Elle est mariée qui est un gargotier. Ils ont ensemble deux enfants qui sont actuellement déjà mariés.
Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche mais pour des raisons de santé, elle devait démissionner en 2000. Depuis lors, elle démarrait son petit commerce avec son petit économie, elle vend différents articles indispensables au quotidien, des articles décoratifs, des vêtements, en fait un peu de tout. 
Pour assurer un futur solide, elle et son mari travaillent encore dur en dépit de leurs âges. Ils ne voudraient pas dépendre de leurs enfants financièrement.
texts.en:
Marie Florentine is a hard-working, dynamic woman.  She is 54 years old and married to a restauranteur.  Together they have two children who are both already married.

Previously, Marie Florentine worked in a business in the duty-free zone but she had to leave this in 2000 for health reasons.  Since then, she has established her own small business selling various day-to-day items - clothing, decorative items, a bit of everything.

In order to build a solid future, Marie Florentine and her husband still work very hard despite their age.  They really don't want to be a financial burden on their children.

loans.use: to buy various sewing materials, decorations and other items.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.fr: Ivonne est une femme veuve âgée de 65 ans  et a quatre enfants à sa charge. Ivonne vit à Baguida pour entreprendre son activité. Ivonne vend de l’huile dans son quartier afin de trouver son revenu quotidien et aider sa famille. Ivonne s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché. Ivonne demande ce crédit pour acheter des bidons d’huile afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ivonne is 65 years old, widowed and responsible for 4 children.  She lives in Baguida where she also works selling oil in her neighbourhood.  Her income helps her to support her family.

Six times a month, she goes to the market to buy further supplies.  She has requested this loan to buy more oil so she can pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 5 drums of oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raffia and matting for her basket-making business.

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr: 38 ans, Kokoè est une femme mariée et avec ses cinq enfants, elle vit dans le quartier d’Adakpamé. Kokoè est une marchande de chaussures et de pains pour répondre aux attentes de ses clients et réaliser son gain quotidien. Kokoè s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans un marché local. Kokoè réalise une très bonne rentabilité dans son commerce et nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des chaussures et des pains afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokoè is a 38-year-old, married woman with five children.  She lives in the Adakpamé district and sells shoes and bread to her customers to earn her living.  Four times a month, she buys new supplies from the local market.

Although she makes a good living, Kokoè has requested this loan to buy more supplies, increase her earnings and pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy 16 dozen pairs of shoes and 80 loaves of bread.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: A 43 ans, Akouavi est une femme mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Akouavi vit dans le quartier d’Adamavo. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, Akouavi vend de la boisson dans sa boutique afin de gagner son revenu. Akouavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akouavi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de bois boissons afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouavi is 43 years old, married and mother to five children.  She lives in the Adamavo district.  In order to support her children, Akouavi sells drinks in her shop.  She buys new supplies twice a month from the market.

Akouavi will use her loan to buy wooden crates of drinks to increase her revenue and pay for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy 14 bottles of drinks for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene la edad de 48 años, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y actualmente vive con su esposa e hijos. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su finca, él se dedica hace varios años a la producción de café y actualmente está sembrando un poco más de plantas para aumentar su cosecha, el necesita comprar los abonos y plaguicidas necesarios para mantenerlo en  buenas condiciones por lo cual opto por el crédito. El espera mantener sus plantaciones en buenas condiciones tanta el que está cosechando como el nuevo y espera poder superar sus producciones anteriores y así mejorar su estabilidad económica para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Es el segundo préstamo que recibe de FUDECOSUR, nunca antes había trabajado con Bancos Estatales
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 48 years old, married, has three children and currently lives with his wife and children. With the loan he's going to buy supplies to help with his plantation. For several years he's worked in coffee production and currently is sowing more plants to increase his harvest. He needs to buy fertilizer and pesticides necessary for keeping his plants in good condition, which is why he has chosen this loan. 

He hopes to keep his crops in good condition, both the one he's harvesting as well as the new one and he hopes to surpass previous production and in this way provide a better future for his kids. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR, as he had never before worked with state banks.

loans.use: To help out his coffee crops.

loans.name: Betty Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela a sus 21 años de edad es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 1 año. Gabriela vive en una casa muy humilde por la que pagan arriendo junto a sus padres, hermanos y sus hijos. Gabriela tiene 3 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella comenta que por medio de las revistas puede ofrecer los productos y luego hace el pedido a la empresa que le provee y después los entrega a sus clientes. Gabriela solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, lo que Gabriela aspira es seguir en su negocio y mejorar sus ventas para tener mayor ganancia, y así lograr darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gabriela a sus 21 años de edad es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 1 año. Gabriela vive en una casa muy humilde por la que pagan arriendo junto a sus padres, hermanos y sus hijos. Gabriela tiene 3 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella comenta que por medio de las revistas puede ofrecer los productos y luego hace el pedido a la empresa que le provee y después los entrega a sus clientes. Gabriela solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, lo que Gabriela aspira es seguir en su negocio y mejorar sus ventas para tener mayor ganancia, y así lograr darles lo necesario a sus hijos.

At the age of 21 Gabriela is a single mom with a 3 year old son and a 1 year old daughter. Gabriela lives in a very modest home which she rents along with her parents, siblings and children. Gabriela has worked in cosmetics sales for 3 years, and states that she's able to sell the products through magazines and she then places the order with the distribution company, after which she delivers to the customer. 

Gabriela is applying for a loan to invest it in the purchase of cosmetics. The aspiration Gabriela has is to continue with her business and increase her sales so she can have bigger profits, and that way give her kids the necessities.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Sarvarbi

texts.ru: Сарварби 44 летняя женщина. Она жительница города Куляб. Сарварби замужем и у нее одна дочка. Мужу 44 года, а дочке 23 года. Муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов около 20 лет. Дочка занимается шитье  женской одежды. Дочке научила сама Сарварби. Сарварби тоже рукодельница. Она дома предоставляет услуги швеи 5 лет. Сарварби отлично справляется со своей работой. У нее мечта в будущем открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды. Сарварби обратилась за кредитом для купли тканей и материалов. Этот кредит поможет ей  не потерять источник дохода и позволить улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Sarvarbi is a 44-year-old woman. She is a resident of Kulob. Sarvarbi is married and has one daughter. Her husband is 44 years old, and her daughter is 23 years old. Sarvarbi's husband has been an expert house renovator for about 20 years. Her daughter sews women's clothing. Sarvarbi herself taught her daughter how to sew. 

Sarvarbi is also a seamstress, and has been offering seamstress services from her home for 5 years. Sarvarbi is doing very well in her work. She dreams of someday opening her own dressmaking shop to make traditional women's clothing. 

Sarvarbi has applied for a loan to buy fabric and sewing materials. This loan will help her to not lose this source of income, and will allow her to increase the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha es una mujer laboriosa de 25 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, ella es una mujer esforzada que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pasteles, además comercializa cosméticos desde hace 6 años, una de sus metas es hacer crecer el negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de pre mezcla, huevo, aceite, azúcar, colorante y papel aluminio.
texts.en: Martha is an industrious, 25 year old woman. She is married and mother to three children who are her greatest motivation. She is a hard working woman who works making and selling pastries. She has also sold cosmetics for 6 years. One of her goals is to make her business grow for which she is requesting the loan to buy pre-mix, eggs, oil, sugar, food coloring and aluminum foil.

loans.use: to buy pre-mix, eggs, oil, sugar, food coloring and aluminum foil.

loans.name: Amurdin

texts.ru: Амурдин 63 летний мужчина из района Хамадони. Он счастливый отец пятерых детей. Амурдин имеет свою мясную лавку. Этим бизнесом он кормит свою семью более 10 лет. Его сын с самого детства помогал отцу в работе. Теперь его сын вырос, и он может сам самостоятельно вести такой бизнес. Амурдин хочет помочь ему открыть свою мясную лавку. Амурдин на заемные деньги купит ему лавку, и всегда будет помогать советами. Он верит в успех своего сына и гордится им.
texts.en:
Amurdin is a 63-year-old man from the Hamadoni region. He is the happy father of 5 children. Amurdin has his own butcher's shop. With this business, he has fed his family for more than 10 years. 

Since childhood, Amurdin's son has helped his father at work. Now his son is grown, and he is able to independently run such a business. Amurdin wants to help him open his own butcher's shop. Amurdin wants to loan money to buy his son a shop, and will always help him with advice. He has faith in the success of his son, and is proud of him.

loans.use: to open a butcher's shop for his son.

loans.name: Luzdary

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) desde hace 6 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The youth who has her face pixelated for being 22 years old and living in a high risk area has worked cultivating basic grains (corn and beans) for 6 years. When her harvest is ready she stores it in the granaries shown in the picture to then sell in the various markets found near her home. 

The youth lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She is requesting a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc to continue with her work and thus obtain better economic returns.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es: Doña María es una mujer emprendedora, con muchos deseos de superación, tiene la edad de 56 años, acompañada quien ha sacado a sus hijos adelante, por lo que son mayores de edad e independientes, ella es propietaria de un comedor desde hace tres años en el que ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de almuerzos, El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pollo, carne, arroz, frijoles, espaguetis y plátanos es el octavo ciclo que solicita crédito en ADIM,  con los créditos anteriores logró mejorar el techo de su casa y aumentar la oferta de comida.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard working woman with a strong desire to excel. She is 56 years old, married and has moved forward with her children, who are now adults and independent. For three years she has been the owner of a restaurant in which she offers her customers a variety of lunches.

She requests the loan to buy chicken, beef, rice, beans, spaghetti and plantains. This is the eighth loan cycle she has requested from ADIM. With the previous loans she has managed to improve the roof of her home and to increase her selection of meals.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, rice, beans, spaghetti and plantains.

loans.name: Diego Andres

texts.es: Diego es un joven muy trabajador  de 22 años de edad, el vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos que trabajan al jornal de trabajos en el campo, Diego trabaja de chofer y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, Diego solicita el dinero del crédito para comprar terneros que los compra pequeños, los cría y luego los vende cuando ya están grandes obteniendo alguna ganancia, lo que Diego aspira es comprar más terneros,  mejorar su negocio para a formar un capital para a futuro comprar el carro en el que en la actualidad esta trabajando, para que sea su propio negocio de dar servicio de transporte.
texts.en:
Diego, 22, is a very hard-working young man who lives with his parents and siblings who work as day laborers in the countryside.  Diego works as a driver and also raises cattle.  He is requesting a loan to buy calves to raise and then sell for a good profit.

Diego wants to buy more calves to improve his business so in the future he can buy the vehicle he works with now.  He wants to use it for his own transportation business.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Deivi

texts.es:
Deivi tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente con la señora con un hijo a su cargo , vive en casa propia, domiciliado en el caserío Tingues, que pertenece al distrito de Nanchon, Provincia de San Miguel, Región Cajamarca, ubicada en la Sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña y tranquila, la población se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, ganaderia y comercio de animales menores.

Deivi se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria; hace 2 años, con buenas referencias laborales y personales, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar y otros gastos; esto le servirá para poder brindar mejores servicios, atender mejor a sus clientes, generar mayores ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deivi, 26, lives with his wife and son in their own house in the community of Tingues.  It is in the district of Nanchon, province of San Miguel in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Peru.  The community is small and peaceful and the locals work mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and trade of small animals.

Deivi has been working as a day laborer for two years and has good work and personal references.  He works from home and is requesting a loan for work capital to buy a fumigation pump and to pay other expenses.  This will allow him to provide better customer service and earn more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a fumigation pump and to pay other expenses.

loans.name: Cristian Andres

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven ecuatoriano que nació en la cuidad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, vive en una zona urbana del cantón Latacunga. Esta zona se caracteriza por un clima frio en donde la población se dedica a diferentes actividades comerciales, ya que está cerca de la Universidad. Cristian tiene21 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres realizó sus estudios hasta la Universidad, y actualmente labora como chofer profesional, invirtiendo 8 horas de trabajo, y así llevar los recursos económicos necesarios  para salir adelante y proyectarse a un futuro mejor.
Cristian solicita el crédito para emprender su negocio, el cual se trata de un centro de cómputo, para ofrecer sus servicios a los estudiantes y población en general en donde atenderá todos los días. Espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante y cambiar su estilo de vida. Cristian agradece a Fundación Alternativa y KIVA por hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Cristian is a young Ecuadorian who was born in the city of Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi.  He lives in an urban area of the Latacunga canton which is known for its cold climate and commercial activity among the locals, as it is near the university.

Cristian is 21 years old, single and lives with his mother.  Thanks to his parents' efforts he was able to get a university degree and now works as a professional driver eight hours a day to earn a living and support himself and strive for a better future.

The loan being requested by Cristian is to start a business, a computer center where he can offer services to students and the general public on a daily basis.  He hopes this investment will improve his income so he can change his lifestyle.  Cristian is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and KIVA for making his dream come true.

loans.use: To start a computer training center for students.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer laboriosa de 48 años, viuda y madre de un hijo por el que trabaja día a día para sacarlo adelante, ella se dedica a la hecha y venta de sopa desde hace cuatro años, es el segundo ciclo que solicita crédito en ADIM, con el crédito anterior logró comprar más pailas, mesas y sillas. Uno de sus proyectos es aumentar el negocio, solicita el crédito para la compra de mondongo, yuca, chombón, quequisque, ayote y chilote.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 48, is an industrious widow who works hard every day to support her son.  For four years she has been making and selling soup.  This is her second loan through ADIM.  She used the previous one to buy more pots and pans, tables and chairs.

One of her goals is to increase business, so she is requesting a loan to buy tripe, yucca, yams, squash and corn.

loans.use: To buy tripe, yucca, yams, sqash and corn.

loans.name: Pedro Arnoldo

texts.es: Pedro de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz desde hace 11 años, además trabaja como ayudante en un mini súper, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que es muy pedregoso y así poder tener más producción en el cultivo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Pedro, 32, lives in his own house with his family.  For 11 years he has worked in agriculture growing corn.  He also works as an assistant at a mini-supermarket.  He sells his produce at different markets near his home.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land shown in the photograph, which is full of rocks.  This will enable him to increase crop production and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. and to improve his land.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruit and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace 8 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, también vende pupusas, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 51, lives in a house of her own with her family.
She has had a small grocery shop at her house for eight years, where she also sells pupusas (a traditional dish made of a maize tortilla filled with cheese, meat, and beans).
She has many customers thanks to the affordable prices she offers and her amiability towards customers.
She asks for a loan in order to buy soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweetbread, etc.
Her goal is to increase her income to enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a roof.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana de 34 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, Roxana vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia. Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también elabora y vende pupusas, ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana, 34, is very hard-working and responsible. She is fully dedicated to her business. She lives at her family's house.
Roxana has been selling fruit and vegetables for eight years from a stall at the town market near her place of residence.
She also makes and sells pupusas (a traditional dish made of a maize tortilla filled with cheese, meat, and beans).
Roxana is asking for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetable wholesale, in order to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Doña Ana de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee un comedor ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada desde hace 8 años, posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos como: pollo, carne, verduras, frutas, refrescos, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Ana, 51 years old, lives in her own house with her family. For eight years she has owned a diner, located near her house in an area with many passers-by. She has many customers thanks to her good prices. With the earnings from her sales, she is able to move forward. She is requesting a loan to buy basic ingredients to prepare food such as: chicken, meat, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, among other things; and in this way to be able to continue with her work, because it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in vaccination, anesthetics, vitamins, deworming medications, etc. for her veterinary clinic.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, flour, cereals, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and her primary customers are locals. Mary's biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of flour, bread, salt, soap, cereals and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, bread, salt, soap, cereals and other items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
You can always see food vendors walking along the streets, staying in one popular spot or running from policemen threatening them with a fine. Maricel has been chasing the crowd to get higher sales. She is vending 'banana cue' which is a popular snack food in the Philippines. It's made from “saba”, a type of banana, deeply fried and coated with caramelized brown sugar, usually skewered on a bamboo stick and sold on the streets. Maricel also sells “camote” (sweet potato) cue, prepared in the same way as  the banana cue. Her husband, Elton, is also a food vendor. They sell separately in different areas to find more customers. 

Their combined income sustains their everyday needs but they can hardly afford their children’s college education. Rain or shine, they patiently work hard for the sake of their children. Now, Maricel plans to add more snacks like “pancit” (noodles) and sandwiches. She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients like noodles, bread, sandwich spread, banana, sweet potato, sugar and flour. Hopefully, she can earn greater profits to sustain all her family's needs and set aside some amount for the future. This may be one step forward in realizing her dream of having professional children.

Maricel is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, bread, sandwich spread, banana, sweet potato, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maria has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Maria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gigith

texts.en:
Running a “sari-sari” (variety) store is not as simple as people think. Gigith, 35, has to wake up very early in the morning and sleep late at night to meet the demands of customers who sometimes buy as early as 4:30am or as late as 10:30pm. It’s a good thing that her husband, Rodel, a driver, takes turns in looking after the store when he’s not on driving duty. Her family’s usual everyday needs are being supported by the income from her variety store. But it’s not enough to set aside some savings for her children’s education. Now that she’s determined to improve her business and increase her profits, she longs to obtain additional capital of PHP 12,000 that she will use to buy more dry goods and grocery items for sale in her variety store. She dreams of a successful life for her whole family and she shares this aspiration with her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods and grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a dried-fish vendor from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. Her husband, Aladin, is a salesman and they have children. 

The couple works diligently to secure the future of their children. But the rainy season makes it difficult for Jennifer to earn enough money from her business. The price of fish increases during this season, and she can hardly afford it. She needs additional capital of PHP 20,000 to enhance her buying power when fresh fish gets expensive.  

She can use this loan to buy volume quantity of fish in different varieties. She will dry and sell it afterwards. This loan will keep her business running even during rainy days. 

Eventually, her goal is to make her business prosper, gain stability in the midst of stiff competition, complete her children’s education, and enjoy better living conditions. 

Jennifer is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study their religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume quantity of fish in different varieties.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 36 years old, married to Agnes, and he supports four children.
 
He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers to enable him to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his farm. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers to enable him to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Las Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
Maria (la que se ubica en medio de las tres) es una mujer lleno de sueños y metas que día con día lucha para seguir prosperando, Maria gracias al crédito logro realizar la inversión en su negocio de venta de ropa  y afortunadamente le dejo muy buenas ganancias con la que pudo comprar una máquina de coser y ahora ella ya elabora también ropa típica y ya no solo las compra, esta superación tiene a María y el resto de su grupo muy contentos, pero ellos no son personas conformistas es por ello que con el afán de seguir prosperando solicitan un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar una nueva inversión en su negocio de venta de ropa típica comprando una variedad de cortes, fajas y güipiles.
Maria tiene las esperanzas de conseguir este nuevo crédito para seguir mejorando su negocio  y contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Maria (who is in the center of the three) is a woman full of dreams and goals and fights daily to be successful. 

Thanks to a loan, Maria was able to invest in her business of selling clothes, which, fortunately, is generating a good income for her, so she was able to buy a sewing machine. Now she can also manufacture traditional clothes and does not just buy them.

This improvement makes Maria and the rest of the group very happy. But they don't want to settle there. This is why, with the desire to further succeed, they are requesting another loan to invest once more into their business of selling traditional clothes by purchasing a variety of traditional skirts, woven belts, and blouses.

Maria expects to be able to use this loan to continuously improve her business and to be able to pay for a store where she can display her products better.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesus

texts.es: Mauricio tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 12, 6 y 1 año de edad. Él se dedica a la venta de gas propano y a la distribución de pan francés ambulante con lo cual lleva el sustento a su familia. Mauricio desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta y distribución de gas propano, actividad que realiza en su motocicleta y le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cilindros de gas para tener una mayor cantidad y cumplir la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 33 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife and his three children of 12, 6 and 1 year.

He is earning a living by selling propane gas and delivering baguettes. This is how he supports his family.

Mauricio has been selling and distributing propane gas for four years. He is doing this using his motorcycle and this allows him to support his family on a daily basis.

He is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in gas cylinders to have a greater amount and meet his customer's demand of products.

loans.use: to purchase gas cylinders to have a greater amount and meet his customer's demand of products.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn, 39, is a married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Renalyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Renalyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Renalyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en:
Filadelfa is a 66-year-old married woman with four grown dependents. 

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various merchandise like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, beverages, sugar, vinegar, condiments and other basic commodities. 

Filadelfa needs additional capital to finance her small business. She is asking for a loan to purchase stocks such as drinks and  groceries. With these she will maintain the content of her store. Thus, more customers will come and she will cater their needs. Her income will grow and she will be able to balance her finances. 

With this loan, she could now expand her business and manage it successfully. She hopes that her business will be more productive and sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase stocks such as drinks and  groceries.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 57 years old and married. Nenita works very hard to provide for her family.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. 

Nenita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is a hardworking and responsible parent. He is 38 years of age, married, and has one child.

Leonardo's business is buying and selling scrap materials. He uses his motorcycle in buying scrap materials. He has been doing this kind of business for 15 years. He also manages his hog-raising, rice-farming and motorcycle-transport businesses.

Leonardo would like to focus on his junk shop business. He wishes to buy more scrap materials such as empty bottles and metals for his junk shop business, but his capital is not enough.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. He hopes to obtain his requested loan amount to generate better income to sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy scrap such as empty bottles and metals for his junk shop business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 59 years old and married. She has five children. Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Anecita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is a 47-year-old woman from Tbilisi. She has a student son and gets income from her own private activity. 

Iamze was unable to start any stable job and she started baking cakes, which she makes on order. As it has become harder to earn a living over time, Iamze wants to expand her trading business and go to Turkey for purchasing stock of products at wholesale prices. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Iamze to get a loan of 1,000 USD and purchase stock of clothing and bed linens. Iamze thinks that the business will be profitable, as she already has a big list of loyal costumers and will easily sell products among them. 
 
With support of the Start Up program, Iamze will get an opportunity to be involved in another business and tackle her financial difficulties. She will be thankful to all the lenders for helping her maintain the business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothing and bed linens and start trading.

loans.name: Gul Tajunnisa

texts.en:
Gul Tajunnisa is a 36-year-old married woman. A few years ago, her husband (also shown in the photo) started a business to sell fruits in his locality. He makes a good amount of income to run his household activities. 

Gul Tajunnisa wants to provide continuous support for the growth of her husband's business. Currently, she has availed Murabaha of 20,000 PKR for her husband. It allowed him to purchase more sacks of fresh fruits, including oranges, apples, guavas and bananas, to consistently meet market demands. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of fresh fruits, including oranges, apples, guavas and bananas, to consistently meet market demands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new stock of animal feed to sell to clients and to meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products, supplies for the store and for traditional snacks so that she can use the income to pay for her university studies

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and 2 children, who are still attending school. She is a housewife and her husband is the main source of income for the family. He owns a mini-market in his town and at the same time, also works in the construction field. 

Due to the hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the last installment of her children’s school fees. 

Her purpose is to help them achieve higher educational levels.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for adding soil nutrients to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus produce to sell to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Bebelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Bebelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits to sell for her buy-and-sell fruits business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Bebelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 49-year-old working woman. She felt that she should work to improve their financial condition, so she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

She has taken out a Murabaha loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase good quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth in different colors to increase sales and earn substantial profits.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 49-year-old hardworking married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son. She is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living, which is why she started a business selling animals some years ago. She purchases small animals such as baby goats and calves, and after raising them a year or two, she sells them to the people of her locality. 

For the expansion of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha of 25,000 to purchase more baby goats and calves to increase her sales and also her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to increase her sales and also her earnings.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie works hard to support her family. Vergie is married and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional basket of dried fish to sell for her business.

Vergie has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional basket of dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a single man living with his parents. He’s an 18-year-old hard worker looking to support his family. He’s a painter who works with high professionalism. He has many years of experience in his recent job. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well-organized. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase painting tools to carry on his work in a proper way. 

In the near future, he looks to take on more projects, maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase painting tools

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Afshan is a 27-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband. She deals in the business of selling animals, with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to increase her earnings to better support the needs of the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is from Armavir town where he works as an auto repairer. In the yard of his house, Raymond performs auto repair work for different type of cars. Raymond also provides radiator cleaning work. 

Raymond lives with his mother, father, wife and two kids, 11 and 6 years old. 

This loan is for purchasing tools and materials needed for his working process.  

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Raymond hopes to receive your support and improve his working process.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for auto repair service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has five children. She, along with her husband (also shown in the picture), has been running a business of purchasing and selling animals. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. 

In order to expand her earnings, she has availed a Murabaha loan of PKR 25,000 to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business, and that will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats to sell to expand the business

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 52-year-old married mother of two. Ten years ago she started working in the laundry section in a hospital to help her husband in covering the expenses of her family. She is a hard worker and a sacrificing mother who deprives herself to satisfy her children's needs, for they are her priority.

Today, Souad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her house tenancy costs which will help stop her worries and provide her children with a comfortable life far from troubles.

Souad hopes to succeed more in her career to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her house tenancy costs to provide her children with a comfortable life.

loans.name: Ana Loraine

texts.en:
Ana Loraine is 20 years old and single. She is a college student who wants to finish her education and someday help improve her family’s living conditions.

Her parents had insufficient funds to sustain her education that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay her tuition fees and allowances at school. She will repay her loan in full with the help of her supportive parents.

She hopes to become successful in her career.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees and allowances at school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle for better business.

loans.name: Michael Gerardo

texts.es: Michael Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos,  los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que tenga una buena germinación y de fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayuden a mejorar las condiciones del suelo y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en trabajos de preparación del terreno y de labores que le ayuden a que el agua de lluvia no cause daños por la erosión, y también para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Michael Gerardo, is 18 years old, is single, and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his top priority.

With his loan he intends to purchase good-quality pre-germinated bean seeds, organic fertilizers to help improve the conditions of the soil, and other products to apply to the seeds, as well as ensuring good work is done by paying laborers for preparing land needing development, irrigating it so that the rainwater does not cause erosive damage, and also for the one-time application of products and planting assistance.

He seeks to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions that feature in this hardiness zone, and also to put in practice several years of experience in basic grains management. In addition to being able to buy the best quality products for his land in order to have a proper development and irrigation, he seeks a suitable harvest and to have significant near-future production.

With the income he hopes to obtain from the harvest, he wants to use it for his family's well-being and education, to fulfill some family goals, and to continue to invest more in the crops.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR provided him the loan with larger facilities and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es: Digna a sus 53 años de edad es una señora que ha luchado mucho trabajando en la ganadería, Digna tiene 2 hijos, Digna  junto a su esposo aprendieron la actividad de cuidado de ganado desde que eran empleados en una hacienda ganadera y comenta que era muy duro por motivo que cuidaban mucho ganado  y además les pagaban muy poco.   Desde hace 10 años atrás es que empezaron el cuidado de ganado propio. Digna solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca ya que con este negocio es  como va saliendo adelante con junto a su familia. Digna espera que su negocio siga siendo productivo y asi lograr a futuro tener una vejez digna junto a su esposo.
texts.en: At 53 years of age, Digna has dedicated a lot of effort to her work in livestock. She has 2 children. Digna and her husband learned how to take care of livestock when they were employed at a cattle ranch and she says that it was very hard work because there was a lot of livestock to take care of and the work also paid very little. 10 years ago they began raising their own livestock. Digna is requesting the loan to purchase a cow given that this business is her way to support her family. She hopes that her business will remain productive and she will be able to live a dignified old age with her husband in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Arely, no tiene los recursos necesarios para mejorar su negocio, tal motivo hace que se decida por un nuevo crédito para comprar una plancha industrial y gas propano para continuar elaborando tortillas para vender y así aportar con los gastos familiares.
El financiamiento anterior al servido mucho para mantener su fuente de ingresos con vida, está muy agradecida por haber recibido tal apoyo, pues así pueda darle a su familia lo más necesario para subsistir.
texts.en:
Arely does not have the resources needed to develop her business, which is why she has decided to request a new loan to buy an industrial griddle and propane gas so that she can continue to make tortillas to sell and thus help out with the family expenses.
Her previous loan helped her to maintain her source of income active. She is very grateful for having received this support, as it has enabled her to be able to give her family what it most needs for survival.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial griddle and propane gas so that she can continue to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Liliana

texts.es: Liliana es madre sotera, tiene 29 años de edad, su hija tiene 5 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Liliana se dedica  desde muy joven a la ganadería, ella creció en el campo y comenta que mediante el ordeño y la venta de la leche que se la obtiene de las vacas es como  obtiene sus ingresos económicos. Liliana solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca, la aspiración de Liliana es que de ser posible comprar más vacas para que su negocio sea muy rentable y de las ganancias pagar los estudios y demás necesidades de su hija.
texts.en:
Liliana, aged 29, is a single mother, and has a 5-year-old daughter who goes to school. Liliana has worked with livestock since she was very young, and grew up in the countryside. She says that she earns a living from selling cows, and from the milk that they produce. 

Liliana is requesting a loan to buy a cow. Her dream is to be able to buy more cows, so that her business will become more profitable, and she can earn enough to pay for her daughter's studies and other necessities.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 27-year-old married mother of two children who works as a social worker in a private school in her region since 2011.
She got her social guidance university degree and graduated to work in her domain, which she believes is very necessary in her region.

Today, and since her work is very far from her house and transportation is very hard in her region, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to register her car and pay necessary legal fees so that she can use it to facilitate her transportation to her work and back home.

Norma has a very good reputation in her region and she is working hard to develop her career in the future through acquiring higher degrees in her domain.

loans.use: register her car and pay legal fees to take her to work as a social worker at a private school thus using her university degree

loans.name: Manuel Isabel

texts.es: Don Manuel de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años la cual inicio con capital propio, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego venderla en los alrededores de la zona de donde el reside, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. Y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos
texts.en: Manuel, 67 years old, lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked growing basic grains of corn and beans for the past 20 years, which he began with his own capital. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries that are shown in the photo to later sell it in the areas near where he lives. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. and in this way be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Doña Ana de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hermano, ella se dedica al cultiva de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde hace 30 años, también vende ropa de manera ambulante, su esposo le ayuda en el cultivo y comercializa sus productos agrícolas en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, Doña Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono para sus cultivos, y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 56 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her brother. She has worked growing basic grains such as corn and beans for the past 30 years. She also sells clothing as a street vendor. Her husband helps her with the crops and sells the agricultural products in the different markets that are near their house. Ana is asking for a loan to purchase manure for her crops, and in this way be able to have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her crops.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es:
Rosa Miriam tiene 37 años de edad, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, cerdos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Rosa Miriam espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Miriam, aged 37, lives in a rural area in the district of Cayaltí, located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast. The people of this area mostly work in farming, livestock and trade. 

Rosa breeds and sells young animals such as ducks and pigs, among others, and works out of her own home. She has 7 years' experience in this business, and has excellent personal and work references in the area. She is requesting a loan to buy a larger number of animals, as well as balanced feed for them. Rosa Miriam hopes this will allow her to offer a better product to her customers, thereby increasing her earnings, and improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals, as well as balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for adding soil nutrients so as to get better harvest for family use and the surplus produce for sale to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter in order to feed his cows better and increase milk production

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar  is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Kousar ’s husband who is a wholesaler by profession. He purchases different types of goods like cosmetic and toys from the market and then sells them to various people of his community. He has been doing this business for many years to meet the family expenses. 

In order to increase sales; Kousar  has availed Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR for her husband to purchase wide range of cosmetics and toys including games, balls and dolls etc. Kousar  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a wide range of cosmetics and toys including games, balls and dolls etc.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 53-year-old married and illiterate mother of two children, who decided in 2011 to start baking special Saj bread and other tasty traditional Lebanese breakfast items. Manakish has to support her husband with special needs in covering their family's increasing living needs. 
Her husband can't work according to his medical situation.  Currently Zeinab is working hard to develop her business to increase her income and develop her family's living.

With fifteen years of experience, Zeinab proved to be a very talented person in her domain. Her mother provided her with the first vocational training since she had her own talents in this domain and passed them to her daughter.

Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with requested raw materials (flour, oils, and many others).

loans.use: To increase her business making special Saj bread (eaten at breakfast) with needed raw materials (flour, oils, and many others)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 10 años inicio con capital propio y comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area, has worked growing corn and beans for the past 10 years. He began with his own capital and sells his products in the areas near where he lives. The young man lives in his own house with his family. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, to continue with his work and be able to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, mangoes, watermelon, melon, etc. for her sales of clothing and frozen fruit products.

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anecita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buy and sell charcoal.  Anecita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  buy additional sacks of  ginger to sell for her buy and sell ginger business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank and toilet at their home to improve family access to water & sanitation

loans.name: Gela

texts.en: Gela is 27 years old. He lives with his parents in Ozurgeti district. His mother is a teacher at a local school and earns a monthly income. Gela opened a souvenir shop and needs to purchase additional inventory. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan. With the received credit Gela will purchase additional souvenirs for his newly-opened shop and will generate more income. Gela awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional souvenirs for his newly-opened shop

loans.name: Mujeres De Chuanoj Group

texts.en:
It is difficult and practically impossible for a Guatemalan indigenous woman to speak out and express herself. For many, this stems from the 30 year civil war that ended in 1996 and for others, it is because they grew up feeling not valued and had no self-esteem.  Friendship Bridge with its “Microcredit Plus” Program, combining small loans and education, is making a difference in the lives of over 22,000 indigenous women who are empowering themselves and learning to value themselves as well.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de Chuanoj” is composed of eleven ladies who live in rural “Aldea Chuanoj” in Guatemala. The people in this area speak the indigenous  Mayan native language of Kiche. The majority of women have traditional textile businesses and create ornate blouses called “huipiles”. Others buy and sell traditional woven tube skirts call “cortes”.

Yesica, a young 19 year old member of the group, was elected President, a role that she responsibly carries out with great care. She has a young 3 year old daughter. Yesica has her own textile business and buys and sells traditional “huipiles” and “cortes”  as well as belts or “fajas” and aprons or “delantales”. She is quite happy with her business and is pleased that her family helps her to distribute her textiles to various parts of the country. She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy adornments to decorate her “huipiles” and “delantles” that are worn in the community.

At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Friendship Bridge Facilitator shares relevant information through role playing, drawings and pictures with the ladies. They acquire valuable business tools learning about budgeting, accounting and marketing. 

Thank you, KIVA investors, for taking the time to learn about Yesica and her friends in the “Mujeres de Chuanoj” Trust Bank. With their loans and education, they are poised to step into a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community! We are cheering them on to success!

loans.use: To buy adornments to decorate her traditional  “huipiles” and “delantles” that are worn in the community.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena comes from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is 36 and happily married to Arnold, a cook and are blessed with four children of which two are in high school and the other two are still in the elementary Level. 

A year ago, Rowena decided to open a small general store to augment their income. Although there are other general store around her area she is still glad and thankful with the good turnout of her store as it really helps meet her family's everyday needs and school needs of her children. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her store she is requesting an Php 11000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. She takes the competition as healthy since she is challenged to offer more kinds of food items on her store and thus attract more customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She values her store so much since it is where she gets the funds to support her children's school needs.

Rowena aims to sustain and grow her small store into a big grocery store. Her simple dream is to see all her children go to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna es una mujer laboriosa de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo, ella ha mostrado ser una señora responsable y dedicada a su negocio que es la venta de nacatamales, tortilla y carbón desde hace 10 años, es el doceavo ciclo que solicita crédito en ADIM, con los créditos anteriores logro aumentar la oferta de nacatamales y también logro comprar un equipo de sonido. Uno de sus metas es prosperar en el negocio y  el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, carne, tocino, papa, maíz, hojas de chagüite y leña.
texts.en: Reyna is a hard-working woman, 44 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has shown herself to be a responsible woman, dedicated to her work which is selling Nicaraguan tamales, tortillas and coal for the past 10 years. This is her twelfth loan cycle with ADIM, with the previous loans she managed to increase her sales of Nicaraguan tamales and also managed to purchase a sound system. One of her goals is to prosper in the business and the loan that she is requesting is to purchase rice, meat, bacon, potatoes, corn, banana leaves, and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, bacon, potatoes, corn, banana leaves and firewood.

loans.name: Asaph

texts.en:
Asaph is a repeat client to Ugafode. He is 45 years old,and is married to Jackline and they have five children and two dependents with ages between 3 and 16 years old and all the children go to school.  He is a farmer with a banana plantation and he is a live stock trader. He is a resident of Kabungo,Ruhama,Ntungamo district.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000/= that he will use to buy farm inputs such as manure, mulch and also hire labour to work on his banana plantation. He will use the balance to buy more goats for sale.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his banana plantation and also buy more goats

loans.name: Maria Clementina

texts.es:
María es una mujer ecuatoriana que nació en la cuidad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi. Vive en una zona rural que se caracteriza por un clima frio en donde la población se dedica a diferentes actividades comerciales, con diversas oportunidades de trabajo. María tiene 34 años de edad, es felizmente casada con Javier, con quien tiene 2 hermosos hijos pequeños. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres realizó sus estudios hasta la secundaria, y actualmente se dedica a la producción de leche, negocio que lo aprendió de sus padres y que le permite llevar los recursos necesarios para salir adelante junto a su familia. 
María solicita el crédito para emprender su propio negocio, utilizará su inversión para adquirir 2 vacas lecheras, y mejorar la producción de leche. Espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante y cambiar su estilo de vida. María agradece a Fundación Alternativa y KIVA por hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
María is an Ecuadorian woman who was born in the city of Latacunga, in Cotopaxi province. She lives in a rural zone which is characterized by a cold climate where the population works in different business activities, with many work opportunities. María is 34 years old and is happily married to Javier, with whom she has 2 lovely young children. Thanks to her parents' efforts, she completed her education through secondary school, and currently is working in dairy production, a business she learned from her parents and which allows her to bring in the necessary resources to get ahead with her family.

María asks for the loan to carry out her own business, she will use her investment to get two dairy cows and improve the milk production. She hopes that with this investment, she will be able to improve the income that she needs to get ahead and change her lifestyle. María is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making her dreams come true.

loans.use: to carry out her dairy business and get two dairy cows, with this income she hopes to get ahead.

loans.name: Saliwe

texts.en:
Saliwe is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has three children and lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She sells stockings, shoes, shirts, skirts, shorts, pants, bags, t-shirts, track suits, and dresses. She used her first loan to buy bales of second hand clothes and the profits from the business assisted her to support her family. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Saliwe intends to make bulk clothing purchases, which will reduce her costs and boost her sales and profits. She is looking forward to improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make bulk clothing purchases, which will reduce her costs and boost her sales

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Dania es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el comercio de ganado ovino y porcino. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, optimista, leal, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Batallas’ situada a una altitud de 3735 metros sobre el nivel del mar y a una distancia de 65 kilómetros de la ciudad.
Dania  es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que trabajan en agricultura, Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado ovino y porcino; ella se dedica a la cría y engorde de ganado, se ocupa de las vacunas, de la comida, del agua, etc., “el ganado ovino sólo se utiliza a las terneras, para el consumo de carne, El ganado porcino en cambio está destinado íntegramente para el consumo de la carne de cerdo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su ganado se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ganado para la cría y engorde. Su sueño es ampliar su establo para la mejora de su ganado, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para la cría y engorde. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Dania solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para su cría y engorde y con los beneficios ampliar su establo.
texts.en:
Dania is a 23 year old woman, single, without children. Her business is trading in sheep and pigs. She is enterprising, independent, optimistic, loyal, responsible and hardworking. She started her business in Batallas which is situated at an altitude of 3735 meters above sea level and at a distance of 65 kilometers from the city.

Dania has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair worn braided. She is short with a thin physique. She dresses traditionally (hat, blanket, and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish culturally and for business purposes. 

She shares her life with her parents who work in agriculture. They live in their own house built of adobe, brick, and cement with a corrugated iron roof and a cement floor. They have well water withdrawn by pumping, and electricity.

She is in the business of the trade of sheep and pigs. She breeds and fattens them, taking care of vaccinations, feed, water, etc.” Of the sheep, only the lambs are used for the consumption of meat, while on the other hand all the pigs are intended to be eaten,” she comments. The advantage of her business is that her livestock sells constantly. The disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of livestock for breeding and fattening.

Her dream is to improve the stable for her livestock by expanding it and to buy dairy cattle for breeding and fattening.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the four years since she started this work.

It is for these reasons that Dania is asking for a loan to buy dairy cattle to breed and fatten and she will expand the stable with the profits.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle to breed and fatten and with the profits she will expand the stable.

loans.name: Dúo La Prosperidad Group

texts.es: Dúo la prosperidad: este grupo esta conformado por el señor Juan de 63 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad él esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras para vender, ya que la cantidad que vende es meno y quiere incrementar un poco mas su ventas para generar un poco de ganancias para sustento de su hogar.
texts.en: The La Prosperidad duo: this group includes Juan, 63 years old who has sold vegetables for a number of years, and in this opportunity he is asking for this loan to purchase vegetables to sell, since the quantity that he sells is less and he wants to increase his sales a bit more to earn a bit more to support his household.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kairos Group

texts.en:
Friendship Bridge works primarily with indigenous populations in rural areas in Guatemala where the rate of poverty is the highest.
