The “Microcredit Plus” Program combines small loans with basic education on everyday topics including budgeting, marketing and sales, nutrition and health, women’s rights and self-esteem. “Microcredit Plus” allows for increased productivity, increased sales leading to higher income for the families of the ladies.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Kairos” is made up of eleven women in Chichicastenango. The town is renowned for its large twice weekly market drawing visitors from many parts of the world. Many of the ladies in the Trust Bank sell traditional textiles and handicrafts in the market.

One of the members in the Trust Bank is 42 year old Juana who is married with eight children. Juana has an animal husbandry business and raises cows and bulls. She sells four or five liters of fresh milk every day to her clients. It is a family business and before going to school, her children distribute the milk. The business is successful and for this reason, Juana is requesting a loan to buy vitamins for her cows and to purchase another bull. She will use another part of her loan to buy feed and antiparasitic medicines. She also wants to rent pasture with enough grasses so that her animals can be well fed.

At the monthly meetings, a Facilitator from Friendship Bridge shares useful information with the ladies about the world around them and within them. Using games, role playing and drawings, the women learn about taking better care of themselves and their families as they gain knowledge about nutrition, health, the use of medicinal plants and hygiene. 

The success of Friendship Bridge is based on the growth of these women as individuals and businesswomen to become agents of change in their families and communities. KIVA investors are valuable and much appreciated in funding these much-needed loans. Thank you for your kindsness and generosity!

loans.use: To buy vitamins for her cows and to purchase another bull

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the mama lishe (cafe) stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Thiệu

texts.en:
Mr Thiệu is 47 years old and he is married. He has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years. Thiệu lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable. 

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns his is the latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

This is Thiệu first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Thiệu hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Anna Leah

texts.en:
Anna Leah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a making nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening, fishing, farming rice and vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Anna Leah dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for roofing like nipa leaves, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Osmin

texts.es:
Osmin es albañil, actividad que práctica como negocio desde hace cinco años y lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido, no recibe otro tipo de ingreso. Comparte su vida con su esposa y su hijo de tres años de edad, solo él trabaja para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
El préstamo lo invertirá en palas, pulidoras, cucharas, un taladro y un cepillo, para hacer trabajos de mayor calidad y tener un negocio bien equipado, espera que su negocio tenga mayor popularidad y le genera nuevas ganancias para que su familia tenga menos carencias.
Las aspiraciones que tiene Osmin son administrar bien el crédito y cancelarlo en el plazo acordado.
texts.en:
Osmin is a bricklayer, work that he has done as a business for the past five years and which he learned from his father. He works every day without a set schedule. He doesn't have any other type of income. He shares his life with his wife and his three-year-old child. He is the only one who works to cover the household needs.

The loan will be invested in shovels, polishers, trowels, a drill, and a plane to do better quality work and have a well-equipped business. He hopes that his business is more popular and generates new earnings so that his family lacks fewer things.

Osmin's aspirations are to manage the loan well and pay it off on the agreed-upon schedule.

loans.use: to invest in shovels, polishers, trowels, a drill and a plane to do better quality work.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es: Jose esta casado, el se dedica a trabajar al jornal y tiene el negocio de crianza de ganado, Jose tiene 49 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a trabajar al jornal, Jose tiene 4 hijos de las edades de 2, 14, 21, 23 años.  Jose solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de terneros, el aspira incrementar su negocio para que mejoren sus ingresos y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y sobre todo que sigan estudiando por lo menos hasta cumplir la educación basica.
texts.en: Jose is married, and works as a day laborer and has a business raising cattle. Jose is 49 years old, his wife works as a day laborer. Jose has 4 children, ages 2, 14, 21, and 23. Jose asks for the money from the loan to invest it in the purchase of calves, he wants to expand his business to increase his income and in this way improve his children's quality of life and, above all, that they continue going to school, to at least complete the standard secondary education.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, peppers, yuca, etc. in order to start a business selling local dishes.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 38 years old, is married to Dinah, and supports a family of four children. He has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 14 years earning KES 10,000 per month. 

Festus has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs to use for higher production for more income gain. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 36-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been doing work in agriculture for some years. He grows crops of different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds, insecticides, and pesticides, Riffat has applied for a Murabaha loan of 10,000 PKR for her husband. This would help him to grow more crops, which ultimately would help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, insecticides, and pesticides

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 47 ans, Tchotcho est une femme avec cinq enfants à sa charge. Tchotcho habite à Nyékonakpoè et prépare du jus pour vendre dans son quartier. Tchotcho réalise favorablement son revenu et pour arriver à ses fins, elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des paniers de citrons et quelques ingrédients pour la préparation du jus, Tchotcho demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un bénéfice afin d’aider ses enfants dans leurs éducations.
texts.en: 47-year-old Tchotcho is a married woman with five children living in her care. She lives in Nyékonakpoè and sells juice she makes herself throughout her local area. Tchotcho earns a good income and in order to make ends meet, she gets her supplies once per month from market. She is requesting this loan to purchase baskets of lemons and a few other ingredients so she can earn a profit and assist her children with their educations.

loans.use: to purchase three baskets of lemons and a few ingredients

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is  a 53-year-old Palestinian refugee, a mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in a public school in the region, since currently she can't afford registering them in a private school.
Ibtissam runs her convenience store since 2009, and is working hard to develop it through diversifying the products she displays to customers.

Ibtissam is acquiring her second loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to her house during the summer to avoid winter problems after the hard winter season they faced in their region.

Her previous loan helped her in increasing her business capital and developing it properly.
She proved to be a good standing borrower which makes acquiring another loan from Al Majmoua easier. She hopes to stay capable of supporting her husband and increasing her family's income.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to her house now, to avoid winter problems after the last hard winter season

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man and has 4 children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells Agrovet products. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of Agrovet products. His business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of Agrovet products

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans et  vit à Adidogome pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Ablavi  fait des soins de beauté dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Ablavi  s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Ablavi  sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des vernis et des produits de beauté pour améliorer sa prestation et faire une bonne rentabilité afin de soutenir son mari à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en: Ablavi is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Adidogomé so she can carry out her activities. Ablavi sells beauty products in her local area as a street vendor in order to earn an income. She gets her supplies twice monthly from market. In order to refresh her stock, Ablavi is requesting this loan to purchase nail varnish and beauty products so she can improve her business. By doing this, she will be able to earn a good profit and support her husband in meeting their family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase 15 pots of nail varnish and a few creams

loans.name: Shella May

texts.en:
Shella May is a fourth-year college student at Metro Manila College in Novaliches City. She is 19 years old and is taking up a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education, looking forward to her graduation in March 2016. It’s her dream to be a teacher so as to impart knowledge and good values to the next generation. 

Her hardworking parents are doing everything to provide for their everyday needs, especially for their education, but their income cannot suffice for their growing expenses. Shella feels the sacrifices of her parents; that is why she’s very eager to finish her studies and find a teaching job so she can give back the reward to her parents. By then she can ease their burden by helping with the household expenses and her sibling’s education. 

She’s praying for this financial assistance from lenders who are willing to co-journey with her towards success.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock for rearing and construct a house for them.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alma is 46 years old, and two children of her children are in school.

Alma has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Alma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sidbewendin Group

texts.fr: Mamouna est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle vend des condiments dans son quartier et cela fait 5 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. elle  a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter des condiments et aussi acheter de la farine de blé, de l'huile et les autres ingrédients pour faire des gâteaux aussi pour vendre. Dans le quartier de Mamouna il n'ya pas de marché à coté ce qui fait que la vente de ses ses condiments marche bien et en plus de cela, elle propose des condiments de qualité à ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargne, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités.
texts.en: Mamouna is a married mother to three children. She has been selling food condiments in her local area for the past five years. She needs this loan so she can purchase condiments, as well as wheat flour, oil and other ingredients for making cakes which she will then resell. There is no nearby market in Mamouna's neighbourhood, which is why her condiments sell so well. In addition to this, she also offers her customers quality goods. After selling her stock, she'll have made enough money to put some aside as savings. She'll also be able to look after her family and continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase food condiments, as well as wheat flour to make cakes which will be resold

loans.name: Zakro

texts.en:
Zakro is 47 years old, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. He works as a salesman of tire-covers. Zakro has a daughter, who is temporarily unemployed and also has grandchildren. 

In order to make his work more productive and also make better living condition for his daughter, Zakro decided to be involved in other business also. He seeked for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 
His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $2700 for purchasing a second-hand car and start serving local people as a taxi driver in his free time.

Zakro will generate additional income, tackle his financial difficulties and make a better living for his family members. He is very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand car to start a taxi business for an additional needed income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a variety of medications to allow her to meet the demands from her clients

loans.name: Twekambe Kakindo Group

texts.en:
Vito is a very hardworking member of Twekambe kakindo group, married with 6 children and lives in Hoima Uganda. He has always needed to have a stable source of income, so as to raise incomes to support his family and as a result he ventured into farming mainly growing cassava. 

He is seeking for credit to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.use: to set up a new cassava plantation.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf, who is in his late 30s, is not married. He has been running a grocery store. He has been in his business since 2011. He works from 8 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be one of three loans which Ashraf has taken from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy drinks for his grocery store, and he has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support. He used the profit to improve his life and cover household expenses. 

He will use this loan to open another drink shop and also increase the grocery store's inventory.

loans.use: to open another drink shop and increase his grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Doña Lucia de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 35 años y también posee una pupuseria, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego vender sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y así tener junto con su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lucia, 53 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked growing corn and beans for the past 35 years and also has a pupusa-making business.When the harvest is ready, she stores her products in the granaries which are shown in the photo and later sells her products in the areas near where she lives. She is asking for the loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc. to continue with her crops and, so, have a better quality of life with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 41 años, almacena sus productos en los graneros que muestra la fotografía y luego vende sus productos agrícolas en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como el puede salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas, controles de plagas, entre otros insumos agrícolas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jorge, 56 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has worked growing corn for the past 41 years. He stores his products in the granaries which are shown in the photo and later sells his agricultural products in the different markets that are near his house. With what he earns from his sales, he can get ahead. He is asking for the loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, and other agricultural products to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucía es dueña de un establecimiento en el que vende frutas, verduras, legumbres y otro tipo de productos de uso doméstico, el negocio lo tiene desde hace cinco años, lo aprendió de su madre, con las ganancias ha ido incluyendo otros productos con los que no contaba, su horario es de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, es una persona muy responsable y además cuenta con una cartera de clientes bien establecida. Está acompañada y vive junto a su familia compuesta por su pareja y tres hijos.
Ha solicitado capital de trabajo para comprar uvas manzanas, papayas, pipianes, pepinos, ejotes, etc., tendrá surtido su inventario de productos fresco para que sus clientes continúen visitando su negocio, espera mantenerse trabajando y que las ventas aumenten.
Sus objetivos son expandir su negocio abriendo otro punto de ventas para atender a nuevos clientes y cubrir las necesidades de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Lucía is the owner of an establishment that sells fruits, vegetables, and other sorts of products for household use. She has had the business for five years and learned it from her mother. With the earnings, she has included other products which she hadn't had. Her work schedule is from seven in the morning to five in the afternoon. She is a very responsible person and, in addition, she has a well established customer base. She is partnered and lives with her family made up of her partner and three children. 

She has asked for working capital to purchase grapes, apples, papayas, pipian squash, cucumbers, green beans, etc.; she will have a stocked inventory of fresh products so her customers continue coming to her business. She hopes to continue working and that her sales increase.

Her goals are to expand her business, opening another sales location to serve new customers and cover her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grapes, apples, papayas, pipian squash, cucumbers, green beans, etc.; she will have a stocked inventory of fresh products so her customers continue coming to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation and water.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn, 36 years old, is a married rice farmer with five children who resides in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice to support her family since 2000. Her husband is 41 years old and also a rice farmer. Among her five children, one works in a factory, two work for a food store and the last two are in school. Together, the family can earn around $21 a day. 

Sivorn would like to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell, but she does not have enough funds. That is why she is now applying for a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. With the loan, she will have enough funds to buy a cow and improve her family’s finances when the cow is able to produce calves. 

In the future, Sivorn dreams of having a new house and supporting her last two children in earning higher education.

loans.use: to buy a cow to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y trabaja como jornalero, desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad agrícola, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarla, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, aged 65, lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He cultivates basic grains, and works as a laborer. He has been farming for 15 years, and, when his crop is ready, he will store it in the barns shown in the photograph for later sale. With the profits, he is able to get ahead. 

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, plant food, insecticide, fertilizer, herbicide, etc., in order to increase his earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plant food, insecticide, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesus de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz desde hace 25 años e inicio con capital propio, almacena sus cosechas en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlas y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros insumos agrícolas y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jesus, 45 years old, lives in his won house with his wife. He has worked in agriculture growing corn for the past 25 years and began with his own capital. He stores his harvest in the granaries which are shown in the photo and later sells them and, with what he gets from his sales, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. He is asking for a loan to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and other agricultural supplies and, so, to be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic grains, pastas, vegetables, cheese, pork rinds, etc. to, in this way, grow her business and meet her customers' demand for products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock for rearing and to put up a shed for them.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a widowed woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. Her business is located in a fertile place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Gilda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell for her dried fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия из района Пяндж. Ей 56 лет. На районе она с сыном.  Потому что ее муж сейчас находиться на заработках заграницей. Он не смог найти работу в Пяндже и уехал в Россию. Сын занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Зулфия на земельном участке выращивает кукурузу и помидоры, и все свободное время отдает работе на земле. Ей в работе помогает ее сын. Зулфия как и другие соседи готовиться к обработке урожая минеральными удобрениями. Она просит кредит, и за счет кредита хочет приобрести минеральных удобрений для обработки урожай. Зулфия старается работать еще лучше, чтобы в дальнейшем получить отменный урожай
texts.en: Zulfiya is from the Pyandj district of Tajikistan.  She is 56 years old and lives in her native district with her son.  Her husband is currently working abroad; he couldn't find a job in Pyandj so he left for Russia.  Zulfiya's son works in agriculture.  Zulfiya also grows corn and tomatoes on a plot of land, spending all her free time working the land.  Her son helps her.  Along with her neighbors, Zulfiya is getting ready for the next harvest and she needs to prepare her land with mineral fertilizers.  She is taking a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and get a good harvest.  She does all she can to improve her work and the quality of her future harvests.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to enable him get a better harvest.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 35-year-old single lady who got employed in a company six years ago. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to improve her living conditions, but she is suffering from a limited salary. Nidal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to renovate her house in order to make it a healthier place. She hopes to open her own business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it a healthier place

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a single woman. She describes herself to be risk taker. For four years, she has operated a tailoring business making clothes. Her business is located in a market place, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more tailoring supplies. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy charcoal to sell for her business. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

Nelda successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nelda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Oytosh

texts.ru: Ойтошу 35 года. Она замужем на строителя. У них четверых детей. Сама Ойтош дехканка. Она в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Ойтош выращивает растение. Работу на земле она взяла на свои плечи 15 лет назад. Она на своем земельном участке выращивает овощи, она хочет, чтоб его дети питались здоровой пищей. Ойтошу нужно приобрести минеральных удобрений для обработки урожая, для купли их, ей нужна финансовая поддержка. Ойтошу очень нужно поддержка. Поддержите ее!
texts.en: Oytosh is 35 years old and married to a builder with whom she has four children.  She works in agriculture, growing crops on a mid-size peasant farm in her own district.  She started working the land, on her own, 15 years ago.  On her own plot of land she also grows vegetables in order to give a nutritious diet to her children.  Oystosh needs to buy mineral fertilizers to prepare her soil and get a good harvest, but she needs financial assistance for this purchase.  She relies entirely on your help.  Please support her!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado  cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y también a la crianza de ganado desde hace 7 años, con las ventas que realiza de sus productos agrícolas y con la ayuda de su esposo es como han podido salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas y abono para el cultivo de maíz y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía y así tener una buena cosecha  para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman, age 28, has her face pixelated because she lives in a high risk area.  She has been growing basic grains and raising livestock for seven years.  The sales from he agricultural products and the help from her husband are how she has been able to get ahead.  She lives in her own house with her two children and her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her corn crop and to improve the land that is shown in the photo.  This way she will have a good harvest in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her corn crop and to improve the land.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Tania quien tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 2 años, la cual está ubicada en la calle principal de la colonia. Su sueño es tener un local propio y dejar de pagar renta. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y tienen un bebe. Muchos clientes la están visitando y los líquidos especiales le hacen falta, los estuches de colorantes para tintes también, por eso necesita un préstamo para comprar lo que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Tania manages the Dúo Mujeres de Vista Hermosa (Two Women from Vista Hermosa) group, and has operated a beauty salon for two years. It is located on the town's main street. Her dream is to own business premises and be able to stop paying rent. 

She has the unconditional support of her husband, and has a baby. She has many customers, but doesn't have some special items, including hair-dyeing kits, and for this reason has requested a loan to be able to purchase these items.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Getrude is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour, sugar, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use her KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar, rice, and other items. Her business goal is to be a supplier to other retailers within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar, rice, and other items

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Hoda is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are attending school. Her husband works in a company with the aim to fulfil the family needs and lifestyle. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees, what makes her very happy and optimistic and willing to borrow always via Kiva

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Ma. Celita

texts.en:
Ma. Celita would like you to know that she so appreciates 30,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for raw wood and equipment for cutting wood to sell as lumber. Her earnings enabled her to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 

She trusts that she will again be granted a 40000 loan to buy a new machine for cutting her lumber. It is important that she acquire a new cutting machine to efficiently cut raw wood. Although life is not easy in the province, she as typical of Filipino women perseveres and works hard to give their families a better life. She will be very grateful and is thanking God for your good heart and the financial aid that will be extended her.

Ma.Celita dreams to grow and be more successful in both her lumber and canteen business. She prays for God to bless her family abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw wood and equipment to cut wood to sell as lumber.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Belinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Belinda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more shirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana and her retired mother live in Ijevan town. For many years, this hard working woman has been working in a music school as a piano teacher. 
Now, Svetlana provides individual classes of piano from her house. Because the salary she was earning from the music school wasn't enough even for daily expenses, and Svetlana decided to change her work and opened a clothing store. 

She trades in the store with shoes and clothing and has large number of loyal customers. 

Svetlana has applied for this loan to request new stock of clothing supplies. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The loan is important for Svetlana to have a broader selection of goods which will support her to grow sales and boost the income she needs to support her mother.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing supplies to enlarge the clothing variety and boost sales

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher a father of five children is married, 45 years of age living in Hoima Uganda. He carries out cattle keeping alongside produce, mainly buying and selling of maize and beans. He started his business in order to raise incomes for his family support. 

Christopher Likes seeing himself with a stable income generating business, however, weather variations pose him a big threat. He is requesting for a loan to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing to provide a stable income

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a 51-year-old married mother with two children in her care, who resides in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. She has earned some income from the business of selling fish, vegetables and grocery since 2010. One of her two child is factory worker and one attends school. Her husband is a 52-year-old man and he also earns some income from fish selling. Together, they can earn around $25 each day. 

Chantha would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, she wants to buy more soil to fill the yard around her house and support all her youngest child to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is 30 years old, married to Jane and supports a family of 3 children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 8 years earning KES 8,500 per month. 

Donald has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with his motorcycle, so as to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with his motorcycle so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is aged 58 years old, married to Martha and he supports 7 children. 

He has been a farmer for the the last 29 years and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for adding soil nutrients so as to get better harvest for family use and the surplus produce for sale to clients.

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for adding soil nutrients so as to get better harvest for family use and the surplus produce for sale to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat, eggs, fish ball and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée qui habite dans le quartier de Nyékonakpoè avec quatre enfants. Agée de 43 ans, Akou vend des poissons frits qu’elle vend dans son quartier et sa prestation satisfait grandement ses consommateurs. Akou achète ses provisions deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des cartons de poissons et un bidon d’huile, Akou sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande afin d’avoir plus de revenu et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akou, age 43, is a married mother of four children who lives in the district of  Nyékonakpoè. She sells fried fish in her neighborhood, and her customers are very pleased with her. 

Akou buys her stock of fish at the market twice a month. She is seeking this loan to buy cartons of fish and a jug of oil. She wants to bolster her revenue and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish and one jug of oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates rental houses. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use her KES 100,000 loan to renovate her rental houses. Her business goal is to be a real estate agent within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Juina2 Group

texts.fr: Damata est une femmme battante mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont  garçon et 4 filles tous scolarisés. Damata et son groupe sont à leur 17ème cycle de prêt avec ACFIME et tout ce passe bien. Les remboursements se font à la bonne date. Elle fait le commerce du céréales depuis 1982, soit 33 ans. Elle a besoin  d'un crédit pour acheter plus de céréales pour  vendre . elle aura un bénéfice avec lequel elle pourra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et aussi continuer ses activités.
texts.en:
Damata is a strong woman who is married with five children, four girls and a boy, who all go to school.  

Damata and her group are entering their 17th loan cycle with ACFIME, and all is going well. The repayments are made in a timely manner. 

Damata has been a reseller of cereals for 33 years, having started in 1982. She is seeking this loan to replenish her stock of cereals to sell. Her profits will 
allow her to help with household expenses and to sustain her activity.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of cereals (maize, millet and beans) to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy tiene 41 años de edad,conviviente, vive con su cónyugue y sus tres hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Lucy se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Lucy espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 41, is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband and their three children in a rural area in the Pomahuaca district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.  The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

Lucy raises and sells small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, and ducks, among others.  Her business is located at her house.  She has ten years of experience in the business, and she has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy more animals like guinea pigs, ducks, and turkeys, among others.  She will also buy balanced feed for them.  With this Lucy hopes to offer her customers a better product.  This will allow her to generate better earnings, which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 33 years old, married to Gladys and supports a family of 3 children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 6 years earning KES 7,800 per month. 

Evans has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with has motorcycle so as to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with has motorcycle so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells maize flour, sugar, bread, milk, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a shop with more variety of goods within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business to wholesale.He also runs another business of selling water. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is a married man. He describes himself to be confident. He operates a retail business where he sells fish and prawns and has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy a fridge for fish storage. His business goal is to buy a fishing boat within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a big supplier of fish and prawns. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a fridge for fish storage

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 26 years old, married to Dina and supports a family of 2 children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 5 years earning KES7,000 per month.

Fred has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with his motorcycle so as to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with his motorcycle so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hard-working woman who used the previous loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell. Her businesses are a retail shop of general merchandise and she also sells oils/lubricants and movable spare parts along a busy street. She wanted to support her family thus started up business. She desires to build a house for her family but is challenged by competition that hinders her dream.

She is requesting a loan to buy more oils/lubricants and spare parts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Hoima Uganda. She is a very hardworking lady who loves seeing herself with a stable income generating a activity.

She ventured into selling phone accessories. She intends to grow and expand her business the more only to be limited by inadequate capital. She will use the loan facility to buy more phones for selling.

loans.use: to buy more phones for selling.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank sells soda and beer in addition to farming and butchery in Hoima, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy a car for personal use. He is thirty-nine years old, married with five children and three attend school. He hopes to expand and educate his children. Price fluctuation hinders his business growth and incomes. 

He is acquiring a loan to buy more beers and sodas for selling.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for selling.

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es:
Martin ha tenido una experiencia agradable con el uso de créditos y considera que son de mucha ayuda para realizar los trabajos agrícolas en el tiempo justo, requiere de otro crédito para comprar semilla de maíz mejorada, insecticidas, herbicidas y abono para preparar la tierra y sembrar de inmediato, tiene fe que la cosecha será abundante.
El préstamo anterior le permitió sembrar maíz y obtener una cosecha suficiente para almacenar y alimentar a su familia, también pudo vender a mejor precio otra parte, su familia tiene el mismo núcleo y están saludables.
texts.en:
Martin has had a nice experience using the loans.  He feels that they are a big help in doing his agricultural work at the right time.  

He needs another loan to buy improved corn seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizer in order to prepare the land and to plant immediately.  He has faith that the harvest will be abundant.

The previous loan allowed him to plant corn and to get enough harvest to store and to feed his family.  He was also able to sell another part for a better price.  His family is the same, and they are healthy.

loans.use: to buy improved corn seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizer in order to prepare the land and to plant immediately.

loans.name: Rusnendi

texts.en:
Rusnendi lives in Indramayu, an area in West Java, located about four hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. Together with his wife, they have one cute child. He owns a stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits for his community. 

He joined PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma), Kiva's partner, a year ago. As the business grows, Rusnendi is hoping to get a loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Rusnendi improve his business and his community, which needs access to communication services. Rusnendi's goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. Rusnendi is the one who is seen in the photo. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid mobile phone credit for helping local community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en:
Hiba is a 24-year-old married mother of one child.  She works hard for a year and a half in selling clothes and perfumes from her house to support her beloved husband in covering their family's increasing living needs.  And to take good care of her only child who is enrolled in a public school while she is working hard.  She hopes that one day she will have the chance and can afford private school fees and let him have the opportunity of getting a better level of education.

Hiba is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection to attract customers attention and increase her income.

She is very optimistic about this loan and hopes that in the future she can develop her business to open her own separate clothes and perfumes selling shop for a better income.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection to attract customers' attention and increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients and kitchen equipment

loans.name: Largaespada De Chiquilistagua Group

texts.es: El grupo Largaespada de chiquilistagua está conformado por cinco mujeres laboriosas, coordinado por Emilsa de 23 años de edad, soltera, quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes y ropa desde hace cinco años, solicitan por quinta vez el financiamiento en ADIM, con el crédito anterior logro comprar más mercadería y adquirir nuevos clientes, esta vez solicita el crédito para la compra de blusas, pantalones y blúmeres, la segunda socia es Ana, se dedica a la venta de prendas de acero y plata, la tercer socia es lila de 47 años propietaria de una pulpería, la cuarta socia es Lilly de 42 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y Lesbel de 39 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa para niño.
texts.en:
The Largaespada de Chiquilistagua group is composed of five hard-working women, and is coordinated by Emilsa. 

Emilsa, aged 23 and single, has been selling perfumes and clothing for the last five years. The group is requesting a loan from ADIM for the fifth time. With the last loan, Emilsa was able to buy more merchandise and acquire new customers. With this loan, she will buy blouses, trousers and underwear. 

The other members of the group are: Ana, who sells gold and silver items: Lila, aged 47, who owns a grocery store; Lilly, aged 42, who sells clothing and shoes, and Lesbel, aged 39, who sells children's clothing.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and underwear for men and women.

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a computer services business where he offers printing, browsing and typesetting services. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more printing papers and other stationery. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more printing papers and other stationery

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 46 years old and living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with a responsibility of looking after five of his children. His main business is dealing in transport. His dream is to educate his children and buy another motor vehicle for transport business. Seasonality of customers and increasing fuel prices affect his business growth. 

Simon intends to use the loan to complete payment of his car.

loans.use: to complete payment of his car.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

Her business goal is to be the leading supplier of charcoal in the area within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 45-year-old married woman. She has two children, one of whom attends school. Florence sells crude salt, which she has been doing for more than ten years. She also manages rental units for additional income. She began her business to earn money for school fees for her children. Florence is a hard-working person. Change in weather is a challenge she faces. Florence is asking for a loan to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 32 ans. Célibataire, Adjo est une jeune femme qui œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son progrès. Adjo vend de la bouillie préparée à l’aide du maïs dans son quartier afin d’avoir son revenu. Adjo s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de maïs pour préparer la bouillie, Adjo demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et satisfaire favorablement ses clients.
texts.en: Adjo lives in Adidogomé and is 32 years old. She is single and works very hard to get ahead. Adjo makes a living by selling corn porridge in her neighborhood. She stocks up once a month at the market. In order to buy bowls of corn for her porridge, she is requesting this loan to pay for her ingredients and meet customer demand properly.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn and one bag of sugar.

loans.name: Kansenene United Traders Group

texts.en:
John a member of Kansenene United Traders where members guarantee each other.  He is aged 55 years with 5 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. 

He sells fresh foods and grows potatoes, plus owning a retail shop. He is faced with challenges of bad weather especially heavy rains and price fluctuations that hinder growth of his crops. Besides that, he hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

John has asked for a loan to acquire more land for potato growing.

loans.use: to acquire more land for potato growing.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 34 года, в разводе, есть дочь. Уже 10 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством, мама Асель и ее дочь помогают по хозяйству. В хозяйстве Асель есть 2 коровы, на 0,60 Га земли она выращивает перец, розы для реализации.  Благодаря упорному труду, Асель на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль около 8,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и на полеводство для выращивания и продажи саженцев роз. Доходы от кредита Асель планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Asel is 34 years old, divorced, and she has a daughter.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past ten years already.  Her mom and daughter help her with the farm work.  She currently has two cows on her farm and she also grows peppers and roses for resale on 0.6 hectares of land.  Thanks to her very hard work, she now makes a monthly income of about 8,500 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock and also to grow rose seedlings for resale.  Asel is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and also to grow rose seedlings for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man, with4 children. He operates a taxi business. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good location and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of fuel. 

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to repair his taxi . His business goal is to have more taxis within 5 years. 

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and pay for his children's education

loans.name: Rasha Group

texts.en:
Rasha is the featured borrower for Rasha Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Rasha is a 23-year-old single lady who got employed in a company two years ago to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consist of five members. She is a hard worker who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions, for they are her priority. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her mother's necessary medical treatment expenses. She wishes her mother will get well soon, as she hopes to start her own business of selling clothes in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Rasha is the first lady on the left of the photo. Wafaa is the lady sitting in the middle, and Mirna is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her mother's necessary medical treatment expenses

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman and has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fish (omena fish,a silver cyprinid). She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of dried fish. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Johairah

texts.en:
Johairah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a buy and sell cellphone accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy cellphone accessories to sell for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like cellphone repair shop.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Johairah dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cellphone accessories to sell for her business

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 62 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell bamboo business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to sell.

Socorro has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Socorro would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to sell

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is 45 years old and married with seven children and lives in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in the buying and selling of maize, rice and groundnuts and has been in this business for six years. She faces the challenge of customers not paying on time and having inadequate capital to purchase stock.  

Her business goal is to diversify the business and her personal goals are to educate her children and build them a permanent house.

Doreen is requesting a loan to buy maize, rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 26 лет, не замужем, детей нет, живет с мамой. У нее средне-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Аида занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, у Аиды на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,600 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аида обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Аида планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Aida is 26 years old, single, with no children, and she lives with her mom.  She has a specialized secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes the main source of income for her family.  She started in this business five years ago with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of 10,600 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to grow her business and to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 58 ans, Kossiwa est une femme mère de cinq enfants. Kossiwa habite à  Tokoin et vend des céréales et es produits d’alimentations générales dans le quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire pour leur épanouissement. Pour arriver à ses fins, Kossiwa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois dans un  marché local. Pour commander des bidons d’huile et des sacs de riz, Kossiwa demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et disposer d’un revenu afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 58 years old and married; she has five children. Kossiwa lives in Tokoin and sells grains and general food products in her neighborhood so that she can gain the necessary profit for her children's growth. To reach her goals, Kossiwa resupplies four times per month in a local market. Kossiwa is requesting this loan to make her purchase of oil and rice and to make a revenue that will help her husband in educating their children.

loans.use: to buy 4 bottles of oil and 4 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Sanzhar

texts.ru: Санжар, 31 год, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 2 детей. С 2011 года он занимается торговлей канцелярских принадлежностей, оказывает фото и полиграфические услуги, ремонтирует компьютеры, картриджи. В обороте есть товар на сумму 290,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения своей деятельности, Санжар обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на расширение товарооборота. Санжар  планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее его развитие и благоустройство дома.
texts.en: Sanzhar is 31 years old, married, and raising two children with his wife.  He has been selling stationery items since 2011.  He also provides photo and printing services, he repairs computers and changes ink cartridges.  His inventory is worth 290,000 som (KGS) and he makes a monthly income of 21,000 som (KGS).  In order to expand his activity, Sanzhar has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to increase his turnover.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further develop his business and to perform some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy office supplies for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 29 years old, married to Beatrice and supports a family of 2 children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 5 years earning KES7,000 per month. 

Enock has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with has motorcycle so as to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply with has motorcycle so as to earn more income.

loans.name: Especasion

texts.en:
Escpecasion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming vegetable and raising livestock.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Escpecasion dreams that one day  will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gerrison

texts.en:
Gerrison is a smallholder farmer residing in Kapcherop division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also has cattle, poultry, sheep and tree farming. He is a renowned grower since 1985. His strength as an horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Gerrison needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Gerrison is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Gerrison acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. 
Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Tegras

texts.en: Tegras is a very hard-working married man with 6 children; only 2 attend school, in Hoima, Uagnda. He operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like salt, sugar, and soap, among other items. He ventured into farming sugar cane upon realizing the need to supplement his income. He wishes to grow and expand his business. He will use the loan to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and soap to sell, and hopes not to be limited by stiff competition and high rental fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rina, one of Ruma's agents. Rina lives in Garut, a city located about four hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.

Rina is known by her neighbors as a cheerful and kind woman; that’s why it’s really easy for her to attract customers. As a woman, she began to realize that she needs to help her husband to improve their life by increasing their income. That's why she decided to join Ruma last year. Now, Rina is providing the service that allows her customers to buy mobile phone credits.

Rina knew about Ruma from a Ruma sales executive who came to her house. As the business grows, Rina is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Rina knows about the importance of your loan, which will be very useful to help her improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services.

Rina is the one who is seen in the picture. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her village community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 45 ans, Akossiwa est une femme mariée qui habite à Tokoin. Pour exercer une activité, Akossiwa vend des charbons de bois et trouve son gain favorable. Akossiwa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, Akossiwa nécessite ce prêt pour financer sa commande et réaliser plus de gains pour l’épanouissement de son foyer.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 45 year old married woman who lives in Tokoin. For her business, Akossiwa sells charcoal and makes a decent profit. Akossiwa resupplies once per month at the market. Akossiwa needs this loan to finance her purchase of charcoal and to achieve a greater profit for the growth of her home.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ht Group

texts.en:
Abir is the featured borrower for HT's group. She got together with her other group members to acquire this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they work hard to develop their families’ living and businesses.

Abir is the lady at the center of the picture. She is a 40-year-old married mother of four children; she works hard to provide them with the necessary living needs. She has been working at home selling clothes since November 2011, with nine years of experience, and is working hard through this loan to increase her business capital.

Thus, for this reason, Abir is going to invest her acquired loan in increasing her business merchandise through buying a special summer collection necessary to fulfill her customers’ needs.

As for the other borrowers, Nour is the lady at the right side of the picture. She is a 20-year-old single lady who invested her previous Al Majmoua Kiva loan to start her own beauty and hairdressing salon at home in December 2012, and has been working hard since that time on developing it properly. The current loan will help in purchasing necessary hair colors and towels and an air conditioner necessary for her customers’ relaxation during the hot summer season.

Mona is the lady at the left side of the picture. She has been working as a tutor from her house since 2008, with 26 years of experience in her domain. She will invest her loan in buying a new washing machine necessary for her house.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise through buying a special summer collection necessary  to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes and establish another business of water and juice

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 48-year-old married father of four children. He has worked hard as a private driver since 2007, to provide his children with the necessary living needs and best education for a brighter future.

Imad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his son's university tuition fees. His son is enrolled in a private university where he finished his second year of electronics education with one year left to graduate.  He is putting so much hope on his son's future career.

loans.use: To pay for his son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy dairy feeds for high milk production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Realyn

texts.en:
Realyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children, two of whom in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening and farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

Realyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Dominga works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming flowers.  Dominga is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Dominga has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a 24-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She runs a produce business selling dry beans, peas, groundnuts, and maize. She has been in her business for four years. She supplements her income with farming and motorcycle transport.

Silvia began the businesses to earn a living. She is a hardworking woman wishing to expand her business into a busy center; however, limited capital is a challenge. She intends to use this loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Pole

texts.en: Pole, aged 23, is a very hard-working married man with 2 children; only 1 attends school, in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise like salt, sugar, and soap, among other items. He ventured into motorcycle riding for transport (commonly known as “ bodaboda”) upon realizing the need to supplement his income. He wishes to grow and expand his business. He will use his loan to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and soap to sell, and hopes not to be limited by stiff competition and high rental fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like salt, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and a mother of three.  She started making and selling Turkish ravioli at home but now continues in her own shop.  She helps many women by employing them daily in her shop.  With the help of the loan she is going to buy ravioli products.  She aims to continue with what she is doing but grow her business, to employ more women and help them improve their lives.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Emine Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Evinde başladığı mantı işine dükkanında devam ediyor.  Emine Hanım şu an bir çok kadına günlük iş istihdamı sağlayarak onlara da yardımcı oluyor.  Aldığı kredi ile mantı malzemeleri alacak.  İsinin başında olmak ve bu işi devam ettirmek, işini daha da büyütmek, daha çok kadına iş vermek ve onların hayatlarını iyileştirmek de yardımcı olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to hand make 'Manti', Turkish ravioli products, for sale in her shop and employ more women to help

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Edem est un homme célibataire qui habite à Tokoin. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Edem peint des planches pour l’aménagement des meubles afin de réaliser son revenu. Edem s’approvisionne deux fois par mois chez ses fournisseurs. Pour commander des planches, Edem demande ce fonds pour favoriser son achat et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux subvenir à ses  charges.
texts.en: Thirty years old, Edem is a single man living in Tokin. To encourage the flourishing of his family, Edem paints planks for building apartments in order to make his living.
