Edem resupplies twice a month with his suppliers. Edem is requesting this loan to finance his order of plank wood and to make a profit margin that will help him to fulfill his expenses better.

loans.use: to buy 10 planks of wood.

loans.name: Las Chambiadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario chambiadoras está conformado por tres microempresarias exitosas, coordinado por doña Vivian de 54 años de edad, soltera quien se dedica a la venta de fritanga y ropa desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de carne, aceite, tomate, crema, tortilla y repollo, solicitan por cuarta vez el financiamiento en ADIM, con los créditos anteriores logro aumentar la oferta de comida, la segunda socia es Karen de 28 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y la tercer socia es Rebeca quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de acero.
texts.en:
The Chambiadoras community bank has three members.  The group's coordinator, Doña Vivian, is 54-years old and single.  She has operated a business selling clothing and prepared food for ten years.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--meat, cooking oil, tomatoes, tortillas, etc.--for carrying on her business.  This is her fourth ADIM loan.  She used past loans to grow her business.

The other members of the group are Karen, 28, who operates a cosmetics sales business and Rebeca who operates a clothing sales business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is aged 32 years, married to Damaris, and he supports 3 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 4 years and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer to enable him get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural sector. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer to enable him get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, soap and detergents, rice, cooking seasonings, soda, bags, perfume, lotion and trendy clothes

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 42 years old, married to Verah, and supports a family of 4 children. He has been practicing farming for the last 17 years, earning KES.17,000 per month. 

Benard has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs and a wheelbarrow for transportation to the market for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and a wheelbarrow for transportation to the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Cliff

texts.en:
Cliff is 29 years old, married to Beatrice and supports a family of one child. He has been practicing small scale farming for the last eight years earning KES.5,000 per month. 

Cliff has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm tools and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Şule

texts.en:
Şule is married and has one child.  She is a university graduate.  She worked as an accountant in numerous companies.  She had a problem with with her salary so she had to quit.  She started to keep her mother's books.  Her sister-in-law convinced her to be an Amway representative so that she could have time for her home.  

With the help of her first loan she will buy Amway products.  She is planning to start selling to her friends and neighbours.  Her dream is to open an accounting office on her own and enable her daughter to complete her education.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şule Hanım evli bir çocuk annesi.  Üniversite mezunu.  Okulunu bitirdik den sonra çeşitli firmalarda muhasebeci olarak çalışmış.  Son çalıştığı yerde maaş ile ilgili sorunlar çıkınca işten ayrılmış.  Annesinin muhasebesini tutmaya başlamış. Görümcesinin ısrarı ile Amway işi yapmaya karar vermiş.  Bu şekilde evine de vakit ayırabileceğini söyledi.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile amway ürünleri alıp satacak.  Çevresi ve arkadaşlarıyla başlamayı düşünüyor.  Hayali kendine ait bir muhasebe bürosu açmak ve kızının tahsilini tamamlaması.

loans.use: to buy Amway products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 53, is a smallholder farmer residing in Lamura division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming, but also engages in livestock farming. On his 4-acre farm, he has 4 cows, 50 head of poultry, 20 sheep, 15 goats, and 40 trees. He has been a renowned farmer in his area since the year 2000. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Peter needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with flexible terms from Kiva.

Peter is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers, and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Peter acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Nazan

texts.en:
Nazan is married and a mother of three.  After her husband went to jail she started working in a small restaurant making and selling Turkish ravioli.  

She also sold Amway products thus took care of her children's needs.  Her struggle still continues.  With the help of the second loan from Maya she will buy and sell Amway products.  She and her children are waiting for the day they will reunite with her husband.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nazan Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Eşi hapse girdikten sonra hem mantıcı da çalışmaya başlamış hem de amway ürünleri satarak çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılayarak onlara bakmış.  Bu mücadelesi devam ediyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile amway ürünlerini alıp satacak.  Çocukları ile eşine kavuşacağı günü bekliyorlar.

loans.use: to buy Amway products for selling, to help the family while they await the return of her husband

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. Luzviminda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of food ingredients for her business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Dita

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is one of Ruma agents, Dita. Dita lives in Garut, a city located about four hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Dita owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her village community. She joined Ruma since last month. She knew Ruma from Ruma sales executive who came to her house. As the business grows, Dita is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Dita improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.

Dita is the one who is seen in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind support

loans.use: to give her village community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Jayson is a 17-year-old college student from Novaliches City. He is taking a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education at Metro Manila College and he anticipates finishing his degree in 2018. He sees himself as an excellent teacher a few years from now. It’s his desire to help students learn not only academics, but most especially moral values and good virtues. As of now he gains basic training from his school, being a second year college student, and he already senses the tough time that his parents will go through in providing for his educational expenses. This is the reason why he studies very hard and pursues good grades. It’s his way of repaying his mother's sacrifices. Her name is Canisia and she accompanies Jayson in the picture shown above. He would be very grateful for financial support from generous lenders like you. This will somehow relieve his parents’ burden at this time of financial crisis in their family. He’s really positive that soon enough, his parents will be proud of him as a professional teacher.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Santos Mariano

texts.es:
Santos Mariano tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge no tiene hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío de Pandachi, que pertenece al distrito de Cañaris que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la Costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos Mariano se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Santos Mariano espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Mariano is 45 years old, has no children, and lives with his spouse in their own house of crude materials in the village of Pandachi, which is part of the Cañaris district, located in the Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. Life in this district is calm, and the locals work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Santos Mariano works in agriculture, specifically in coffee cultivation. He has on the order of 10 years of experience, and has very good personal and professional references in the area. He will use the loan that is granted to buy manure and fertilizer in order to carry out sufficient maintenance of his coffee crop, and to hire manual labor in the harvest season. With this Santos Mariano hope to offer his customers higher quality coffee, which will have a positive impact on his income and ultimately improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers in order to carry out sufficient maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su madre en casa propia, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Luis is 33 years old and lives with his mother in their own house. He owns a workshop, where he builds metal structures, door, balconies, bars, and others. He has run this business for 8 years and has much experience, which helps him improve his work every day. He already has many customers, who choose him for the quality of his work and his reasonable prices, but above all because he always does the job the way the customer wishes. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will enable him to buy iron, metal, tools, etc., which will enable him to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 41 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Amalia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds.

Amalia has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 35 años es una apasionada por la estética y la belleza, estudió en una institución de educación Colombiana, especializada en carreras técnicas en donde aprendió el arte de la belleza y el cuidado personal.  Hace cinco años inició su proyecto de negocio, al identificar que en su barrio no existía la oferta por estos servicios; comenzó como manicurista y luego incorporó el servicio de cosmetología. En la actualidad ofrece servicios a domicilio de manicure, pedicure, limpiezas faciales, corte de cabello, tinturaciones y tratamientos capilares. Margarita tiene muchos planes para seguir creciendo por lo cual esta tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en los insumos que requieren los tratamientos;  esmaltes, tintes, cremas faciales, masajes y demás.  Su meta es ampliar su vivienda, organizar su salón de belleza donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a su clientela y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia..
texts.en:
Margarita is 35 years old. She has a passion for aesthetics and beauty. She studied in a Colombian educational institution specializing in technical careers where she learned the art of beauty and personal care. Five years ago she made her business plan identifying that in her neighborhood there was no demand for this service. She started out as a manicurist and then incorporated beauty services. Currently she offer home service for manicures, pedicures, facials, hair cuts, dying and hair treatments.

Margarita has many plans to continue to grow so she is processing her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in the supplies needed for her treatments; nail polish, dyes, facial creams, massage oil, etc. Her goal is to expand her house, organize her beauty salon so she can provide better service to her clientele and increase her income to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the supplies needed for her treatments; nail polish, dyes, facial creams, massage oil, etc.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya has been involved in clothing and cosmetics sales since 2010. Together with her husband she organizes selling process of large variety of clothing and cosmetics supplies from the house. They also time to time take the clothing to nearby villages and sell it or change it with food.
 
Natalya and her husband has four infant children to take care of. Natalya applied for this loan to pay for a car and be able to transport clothing supplies by her own car. She and her husband currently organize transportation using a rented car and would like to have their own car to decrease costs and earn more income for their family. 

Natalya has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a car to transport clothing and food to nearby villages and sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a 31-year-old single man who lives in Kutaisi City. He has a mother, who works as a cook, a pensioner grandmother, and a brother with his wife and children. Davit works at a security service and gets 380 GEL monthly. He has a great desire to be involved in his own business, parallel to his job, and to get additional income. Davit plans to start trading with fruits and vegetables. Now, he needs financial support to purchase a stock of products and to have money for working capital to start running his business. 

Davit has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Davit and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. Davit and his family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to make his own business and trade with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Halime

texts.en:
Halime married and a mother of two.  She was first a Tupperware user but now a representative.  She has a lot of sub groups as a group leader.  With the help of the loan she will buy products in bulk and increase her sales.  She says that all her dreams came true with Tupperware and all women should do things to keep them busy and gain money instead of staying home doing nothing.  

She encourages women around her to become a representative of Tupperware.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Halime Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Kullanıcı olarak başladığı Tupperware ürün satışına devam ediyor.  Grup lideri bir çok alt grupları var.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün çekip satışlarını arttıracak.  Tüm hayallerine Tupperware ile ulaştığını söylüyor.  Hiç bir kadının evde boş durmamasını ve kendilerine bir kazanç ve iş edinmelerini söylüyor.  Çevresinde ki kadınları da Tupperware ürünleri satmaya teşvik ediyor.

loans.use: to buy, in bulk, more new Tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her retail business and buy the supplies she needs to make clothes that she will sell.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is 46 years old and married with six children, three of whom attend school, Emilda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, etc. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future Emilda  would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.en:
43 year old César lives with his wife and daughter in the rural setting of El Carmen de Viboral, where he has been running a business selling livestock since 2013.

With the use of this loan he wishes to repair his scythe and expand his sales potential by purchasing a flock of hens. César believes that this will help him create more jobs whilst growing his clientele base and help him better compete with other farms in the region. 

His dream is to provide a brighter future for his daughter by providing her with a great education, and with your help he can makes this dream a reality!

loans.use: to repair his scythe and purchase a flock of hens

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.en:
Oscar is 34 years old who lives in the rural municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. He makes his living off the earnings of his cattle ranch. 

Oscar learned his trade through his experiences working on other cattle farms. He set up his very own cattle ranch earlier this year. He is extremely hard working and tends to his herd every day. 

Oscar is looking for a loan of $5,000,000 COP to purchase more cattle and t]o pay off the debt for the first herd of cattle he bought. 

He aspires to achieve greater sustainability for his farm and will keep working hard so he can purchase more cows.

Oscar dreams of one day buying a new home so he can live a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and pay off debt.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a farmer based in Nkubu, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He is married and yet to have children. 

Eric relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. On his 1/2 acre farm, you will find two cows, two goats, six rabbits and 50 trees. 

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Eric is seeking a loan to buy one.

Your loan will give him access to markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run. 

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Eric's family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like can goods, egg, soap, etc. Teresita has been business for two years. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like can goods, egg, soap, etc.

loans.name: Aida Judith

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer ecuatoriana, nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi, vive en una zona altamente comercial de la cuidad en casa de sus Padres, donde hay un clima frio. Aida tiene 44 años de edad y está actualmente separada de su pareja, tiene un hermoso hijo. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres estudió hasta la secundaria. Se dedica desde hace 15 años a la confección y bordados de uniformes, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esta actividad le permite llevar los recursos económicos necesarios para el sustento de su familia. 
Aida usará el crédito solicitado para la compra de material y mejorar la calidad de sus confecciones, esperando mejorar sus ingresos y estilo de vida. Aida Agradece a Kiva por ayudarle a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Aida is an Ecuadorian woman. She was born in the city of Latacunga, Cotopaxi province. It has a cold climate. She lives in a highly commercial ;part of the city in the house of her parents. Aida is 44 years old, separated from her partner and has beautiful daughter. Thanks to her parents she studied up to secondary school.

For the past fifteen years she has been working sewing and embroidering uniforms. She is a hard-working woman and this business allows her to obtain the necessary resources to sustain her family. Aida will use the loan to buy raw material and improve the quality of her sewing. She hopes to improve her income and her life style. Aida is grateful to Kiva for helping her fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy raw material and improve the quality of her uniforms.

loans.name: Tembwet Mauche Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Zeddy. She is 43 years old and married with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2013. 

She does farming of maize and potatoes. She has gained knowledge on business management from HiH EA training on Enterprise start-up. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm input such as seeds and fertilizers in order to increase her produce thus meeting the demand for maize and potatoes in the area. This will improve her income, and therefore put her in a position to continue supporting her family's needs such as medical care.

Zeddy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase farm input such as seeds and fertilizers in order to increase her produce, thus meeting the demand for maize and potatoes.

loans.name: Dúo Bendición De San Raymundo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bendición de San Raymundo
Este dúo lo forman doña Maria del Carmen, de 31 años de edad,es casada, tiene 3 hijos pequeños y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, concentrado y artículos de consumo diario en un local de San Raymundo, esta solicitando este crédito porque necesita incrementar de mercadería ya que la venta de concentrados por la temporada de lluvia los animalitos comen mucho y ella necesita tener diversidad de comida. También vende cosméticos y sale a repartir cuando le piden sus clientes, tambien quiere invertir en sus artículos de consumo diario como golosinas, pastas, azúcar, maíz y frijol. Espera que fape le pueda apoyar con esta oportunidad de creser mas en su negocio.
texts.en: Doña Maria del Carmen, 31, is one of two members of the Dúo Bendición de San Raymundo community bank.  She is married and has 3 young children.  She has operated a retail business in San Raymundo for 3 years, selling cosmetics, animal feed and everyday grocery products.  She is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to stock animal feed.  She needs a variety of animal feed to cover the demand that the coming rainy season always brings.  She will also buy cosmetics and grocery products--snacks, pasta, sugar, maize, beans, etc.--to stock her business with merchandise for resale.  She hopes that FAPE might help her continue growing her business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business with cosmetics, animal feed and groceries.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan is from Darbas village and is a father of two sons. His elder son, Armen, serves in the army and his second son attends a local village school. Vahan's wife runs their family farm and Vahan himself is a construction worker. He does home renovation and construction work in his local Syunik region. 

To be able to purchase tools that will support his work, Vahan asks for this loan. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Vahan hopes to receive your support and develop his work as a construction worker.

loans.use: to pay for tools needed for construction work

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 26 year-old single lady who prepares and sells special Mouneh items. Her mother was her only teacher and Khadija is very skilled..

In addition to her Mouneh business, Khadija works hard to educate Illiterate people to help them enjoy studying since they had no chance to get enrolled in school previously.

Khadija is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy Mouneh raw materials. She has been in business since 2010.

Khadija hopes to develop her business and fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for Mouneh items.

loans.name: Jose Ciro

texts.es: Jose de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos,  él se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja como albañil tiene 20 años de dedicarse a ambas actividades y gracias  a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared y encementando el piso pero como no posee de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  cemento, arena, ladrillos, hierro entre otros materiales y asi poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en: Jose is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and his two children. He works in agriculture and also works as a bricklayer. He has twenty years experience in both fields and thanks to his work he is able to get ahead. He wants to make improvements on his house, building a wall and cementing over the floor. As he does not have sufficient capital, he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, bricks and re-bar amongst other material and be able to have a dignified house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and re-bar, amongst other material.

loans.name: Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Aliette is a group leader; aged 32 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 6 years. 

The group is called ABANYAMURAVA means “Hardworking people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells shoes and has been running in a business for 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 49 years old, married to Beatrice and supports a family of five children. He has been practicing farming for the last 16 years earning KES7,000 per month. 

Jacob has applied for his first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm tools and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his agriculture for more income. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and farm input for use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 29 years old, married to Rose and supports a family of two children. He has been practicing farming for the last six years earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Jared has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm tools and farm inputs to use for high production and supply for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his agriculture for more income. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and farm inputs to use for higher production

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 31 years old and from Ginatilan, Cebu. She has two children, ages six and eight. She has been in the business of raising hogs for three years. This is to help augment the income of her husband, who works as a driver. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP10000 to buy feed. She is determined to improve her business profits by looking after her hogs well. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger piggery and other business opportunities for a better profit. Her income will be for her children's healthy diet and education.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.en:
Based in El Carmen de Viboral, Rionegro, 27-year-old Leonardo works selling livestock so that he can provide for the most important people in his life: his wife and one-year-old son. His ranch was passed down to him by his father at the beginning of this year and he now finds himself in charge.

Such is the high cost of livestock that Leonardo would like to take out a loan so that he can buy a flock of hens and chickens for fattening, and therefore become more competitive in the current market.

He hopes that this loan can not only transform his business by creating greater sustainability and increase his inventory, but also help him to achieve his dream of buying a home for his family.

loans.use: to buy a flock of hens and chickens for fattening

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara owns a small cafe in Ijevan town. Her husband and son help her with running a cafe and that is their family business. Tamara, for many years, has been working hard to provide her customers high quality service.

Now, Tamara and her family would like to enlarge their family business and expand the cafe. That's the reason, Tamara has applied for this loan to pay for  new land for the expansion of the cafe,  with chairs and tables for the new part. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Tamara hopes to receive your support and continue her family based business.

loans.use: to pay for new land for the expansion of her cafe, with chairs and tables for the new part

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 29 years old and sells chickens and eggs in the rural town of El Carmen de Viboral, situated in the region of Rionegro, where she has been working tirelessly to help her husband improve their small business.

Monica never takes a day off, but still needs help so that she can take her business to the next level. She would like to use this loan to buy more hens and chickens for her inventory and therefore increase her sales, whilst also establishing a level of sustainability for the long term.

Monica and her husband are incredibly motivated to improve the lives of their two beautiful daughters, ages 9 and 11. They dream of one day being able to provide them with a great education and a better home to live in, and with your help they can make this happen!

loans.use: to buy more hens and chickens

loans.name: Alvaro De Jesus

texts.en:
Alvaro is 44 years old and lives in the rural municipality of El Carmen de Viboral, Rionegro, where he has made a living selling flowers since 2005--a trade he picked up having previously worked on other flower farms. Together with his wife they have two handsome boys aged 14 and 9 years old.

Unfortunately his business has met with tough times in recent years; serious droughts as well as extreme rain have made it difficult for him to achieve the level of production he usually would. He would like to use this loan not only to recover from the damage to his crops, but also to expand his inventory of flowers and establish a high level of sustainability for the future.

Alvaro is a devoted family man and is motivated every day to provide a better future for his children by giving them the education they deserve and great home to live in. Your help can take Alvaro one step closer to this dream!

loans.use: to expand his inventory of flowers

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is from Vinogradovo. He owns 3 greenhouses: two are 4 acres, one is 8 acres. Vladimir grows flowers, cucumbers and tomatoes. His entire family is involved in this family business endeavor. Vladimir owns another lot of land of 19 ares where he has all of his seed beds. Plus he also has a big piece of land which is 3 hectares. Vladimir is married with two children. He is 34 at the moment. 

Vladimir needs additional funding of 80,000 Grivnyas to buy seeds, wood, a heating boiler and fertilizer for the farming season. 

At the moment Vladimir is finishing up construction work on his private house. He would love to move into it by the end of this year which is why he is planning to invest generated income into a construction project on his housing.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, wood and a heating boiler

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de fruta  de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual ha podido salir adelante, Roberto está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y asi seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Roberto is 49 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion. He sells fruit itinerantly in the different markets that are close to his house. He has worked in this business for ten years and it allows him to get ahead. Roberto is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale and doing so continue with his work which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 37-year-old married mother of six children. Almost three years ago, she opened a grocery shop in an attempt to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrifing mother who is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions.

Today, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her mother's medical treatment expenses. This loan is very important to Layla for it will help her mother get well soon. 

Layla hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her mother's medical treatment expenses

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard to support her family. Emelyn is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Emelyn has been in this business for  years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses

In the future, Emelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Daviti

texts.en:
Daviti is 25-year-old young man from Kutaisi city, who lives alone and earns a living working as a helpmeet worker. Daviti does the work of home repairing activities and gets approximately 300 GEL monthly. The income is low of this mentioned activity as Daviti has no tools and equipments of his own. After several unsuccessful attempts, Daviti applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the poor people to start or re-start businesses. Daviti is eager to use the requested amount for purchasing all needed tools and start his own work on a private orders. 

Daviti is very motivated and hardworking person with a great desire to make better living condition and increased income for his welfare. This credit will be a great support for him.

loans.use: To purchase his own tools and start home repairing on his own

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and newborn child. Ararat is involved in fuel sales. He purchases fuel and sells to local farms and big patrol stations. 

This is the only source of income for his family, so it is very important for Ararat to sell more fuel during the month. 

He currently asks lenders to support him with purchasing a new supply of fuel in bulk to sell to his clients. 

Ararat has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will help Ararat a lot, and he hopes for lenders' support. This is Ararat's first cooperation with Kiva and he hopes for the best.

loans.use: to pay for new supply of fuel in bulk to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional product for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional product for her business

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Luis es un ciudadano ecuatoriano que nació en la cuidad de Latacunga, provincia de Cotopaxi. Vive en una zona rural que se caracteriza por un clima frio en donde la población se dedica principalmente a la crianza de animales, lo que genera diversas oportunidades de trabajo. Luis tiene 42 años de edad, es felizmente casado con María, con quien tiene 6 hermosos hijos pequeños. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres realizó sus estudios hasta la primaria, y actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, trabajando muy duro todo el día, este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres y le permite llevar los recursos necesarios para salir adelante junto a su familia. 
Luis solicita el crédito para la compra de toretes y para el mejoramiento de su casa. Espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante. Luis agradece a Fundación Alternativa y KIVA por hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luis, 42, is from Latacunga, a city in Ecuador's Cotopaxi province.  He lives in a rural part of the country now.  The climate here is cold and farming and livestock rearing are common occupations for local people. 

Luis and his wife, María, are happily married and have 6 beautiful children.  Thanks to his parents, Luis was able to finish elementary school.  He has his own business now, raising and selling farm animals.  His parents taught him how to keep farm animals and his earnings from the business provide him with the means to give his family a better quality of life.  

Luis is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to buy young bulls and the rest to make improvements to his house.  He expects the investment to increase his earnings and help him to better provide for his family.  He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and KIVA for helping him to realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy young bulls for his livestock business.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a professional hairdresser. She offers hair extension services  in Melitopol, where she's originally from and in the region. She has been working in this sphere of beauty services for nine years. Her clients have become her loyal customers. Yelena is divorced with two children. 

Yelena is seeking a loan of 35,000 Grivnyas to buy real, not synthetic, hair for encapsulation extension procedures. This method of hair extension of practically harmless. Capsules are basically invisible which gives this method much popularity among women in Ukraine now. 

Yelena is hoping to continue growing her business as the demand continues to grow and more potential customers come to her seeking her professional services.

loans.use: to buy real, not synthetic, hair for encapsulation extension procedures

loans.name: Milana

texts.en:
Milana is from Vinogradovo. She is divorced with two children. Milana works in a local daycare as a caregiver. After she got divorced she got used to relying only on herself. 

Milana is hoping to invest borrowed funds in major repairs of her kitchen. She would love to plasterboard her ceiling, fill low spots of the ceiling and walls with putty and paint them. Milana believes this repair work will help her kitchen get a neat and clean look after all the work is finished. 

She would need 10,000 Grivnyas to implement this project.

loans.use: to do major repairs in her kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy equipment & supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Doña Ernestina de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, quien se dedica de lleno a su negocio, Ella posee una venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años, ubicado en el mercado municipal  que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Ernestina solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor, para tener mejores ingresos económicos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Ernestina is 56 years old. She lives with her immediate family in a house that they own. She is a very hardworking and responsible person who is fully dedicated to her business; she has had a fruit and vegetable sales business for five years. It is located in the municipal market near her place of residence. With the sales she makes, she is able to cover some of her household expenses. 

Doña Ernestina is requesting a loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale so that she can have better economic income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa María es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque, se ha dedicado a la crianza de Cerdos y pollos desde hace más de seis años, y con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante en su negocio y con sus ganancias sigue apoyando a sus hijos para que no les falte nada en la escuela y asi tengan un buen rendimiento. es una señora luchadora y responsable para pagar. Con el crédito comprara cerdos, concentrado y vitaminas. Sus marranos los vende en el mercado de la localidad. Agradece a Fape y Kiva el apoyo que le han brindado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa María is from Martin Jilotepeque. She has been raising pigs and chickens for the last six years. With great effort she has gotten ahead in her business, and with her earnings she continues to support her children so they lack nothing at school and can do well. 

She is a very determined woman, and takes responsibility for making payments.

With the loan she will buy pigs, animal feed and vitamins. She sells her pigs at the local market. She thanks FAPE and Kiva for the support they have given her to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs) for sale.

loans.name: Ruhshona

texts.en:
Ruhshona is a generous woman. She was born in the west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1987 and is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She has been a tailor for almost two years. She sews traditional women dresses for Tajik women. She has a sewing machine and gets orders at home. She has regular clients every week. Each month she earns enough money to feed her family. 

She has a sick daughter whom she wants to see be safe. She appealed to IMON asking financial support from KIVA lenders to treat her child in hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to treat her child in hospital

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport. Juliet is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy equipment/materials for her tailoring business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment/materials to her tailoring business

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a new client to UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD, He is 23 years old, married to Jennifer Kyomugisha. And he is a farmer with a banana plantation and coffee.He is a resident of Rushebea,Rwekiniro,Ruhama,Ntungamo District, and has applied for a loan of 1,000,000/= for a period of 12 months.

Ivan makes a good living every month out of his banana plantains in rural Ntungamo. This is his means of supporting his family. He is able to put his children through school and also educate his siblings.

With the money he had saved up, Ivan purchased a 2-hectare piece of land. Now he wishes to plant more bananas of a good variety so that he can increase his farm's yield. However, Ivan is in need of working capital. He presented his project to UGAFODE Microfinance and has requested a loan of ugx1,000,000 in order to pay for the labor to clear and plow his land and plant seedlings.

Ivan has high hopes that his farm will have a good, high-quality yield.

loans.use: To hire labour and buy farm inputs, to plant bananas on newly bought land

loans.name: Kalumu Women Group

texts.en:
Nelius is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo. She is a member of Kalumu Women Group. She is 34 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

She operates a salon and a general retail shop where she sells foodstuffs such as salt, flour, milk and tea leaves. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more foodstuffs, e.g. flour, tea leaves and salt, hence adding stock to her general retail shop. This will increase her income to enable her meet her family's expenses, e.g. school fees, food and clothing.

Nelius is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs e.g. salt, flour, milk and tea leaves hence adding stock to her general retail shop to enable her pay for family's expenses, eg. school fees, food and clothing.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 31 years old, married, and a mother of one child.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) so as to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development. 

She is mainly engaged in small-scale farming (maize and beans). She also keeps indigenous poultry and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy chicken and also build a better poultry structure for her poultry business. 

With increased sales and income, she will be able to pay school fees and also provide better food. 

Jennifer is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy chicken and build a better poultry structure for her poultry business and with increased income, be able to pay for food and school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lina María

texts.es: Lina es una joven emprendedora de 26 años que por tradición familiar está dedicada al negocio de la belleza; su madre y hermanas son estilistas, ellas se han dedicado a esta actividad durante años.  Con un escaso capital, inició hace 5 años su propio proyecto de negocio ofreciendo a vecinos y amigos los servicios de cortes de cabello, tintes, desrizados, blower y demás tratamientos para el cuidado personal, iniciativa que hoy le permite ganarse la vida, demostrando que el crear empresa sin tener un gran capital es posible, si se tiene perseverancia y dedicación.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza; tintes, aliser y tratamientos capilares, que le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio. Su sueño de prosperidad es poder a largo plazo tener su casa propia y organizar su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Lina is an enterprising 26-year-old young woman who is following her family's tradition of working in the beauty business. Her mother and sisters are stylists; they have worked in this activity for years. With little capital, she started her own business project five years ago, offering neighbors and friends her haircutting, coloring, straightening, and blowout services, among other personal care treatments. Today, that initiative allows her to earn her living, demonstrating that it is possible to start a business without much capital, if one has perseverance and dedication.

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in the purchase of beauty products: dyes, relaxers, and hair treatments. This will allow her to offer a better service. Her long-term dream for prosperity is to be able to have her own house and to set up her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products: dyes, relaxers, and hair treatments

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is married with a son. He and his family live in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. Artur owns a business selling construction supplies and accessories. It was hard to start this business from scratch when Artur launched it. However, he managed to build it up and today he has a good group of loyal clientele. 

This time Artur is in need of 20,000 Grivnyas to take care of his own housing: he needs to change the heating system in his house. All related expenses will cover the purchase and installation of the heating boiler, as well as heat-exchanging pipes.

loans.use: to change the heating system in his house

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en: Nilo is a 56-year-old married man who has been engaged in raising hogs and fishing for 30 years now. He lives with his family in Moalboal, Cebu.  He is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy feed, piglets and fishing nets. With his loan, he hopes that he can maintain and expand his business and make it more profitable. His income will be used for food and reinvestment in the same businesses.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a piggery owner from the municipality of Ronda, Cebu. She is 48 years old and has been raising hogs for 11 years now. From this business, she usually earns 7,000 PHP every four months when it is time to sell her fattened hogs. She works hard for her five dependents, ages 9 to 17. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy feed and school supplies like notebooks, paper, pencils, crayons and bags. Marina hope to make her planned expansion possible with the help of the loan and an abundant feed supply for her hogs. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so she can save for old age and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy feed and school supplies like notebooks, paper, pencils, crayons and bags

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La tienda de Yolanda ha ido creciendo a medida que esta mujer emprendedora fue entregándose con mucho esfuerzo desde hace cuatro años. Esta mujer de 54 años de edad, se siente orgullosa de saber que su negocio va caminando con paso firme, pero principalmente se siente agradecida con todas las personas que la han ayuda, especialmente quienes la apoyaron en el préstamo anterior, con el que compró zapatos de niños, ropa, prendas de plata y otros materiales de venta.  
Actualmente tiene una tienda con mayor variedad, sin embargo, sus deseos por seguir creciendo son fuertes, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar capotes y botas de hule para adultos y niños, además que electrodomésticos que le han solicitado sus clientes. Con esto podrá aprovechar la temporada de lluvia y cumplir con los deseos de sus compradores, de manera que sus ganancias van a seguir incrementando. En sus planes está seguir invirtiendo para expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolanda’s store has kept growing as this enterprising woman has continued to work with great effort for the last four years. This 54-year-old woman is proud to know that her business is on firm footing, but mainly she is grateful to all the people who have helped her, especially those who supported the previous loan. With it, she bought children’s shoes, clothing, silver jewelry and other items to sell.

Currently she has a store with greater variety, nonetheless her wish to grow continues to be strong. This is why she is seeking a loan to buy rain gear and rubber boots for adults and children in addition to the household appliances that her customers are asking for. With this she will be able to take advantage of the rainy season and fulfill her customers’ wishes, so that her earnings can continue to increase. Her plans are to continue to invest in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rain gear, rubber boots and household appliances.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a smallholder farmer residing in Chebiemit division, Kenya. He is mainly into crop farming but also has does livestock farming. His strength as an horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Joel needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements to enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Joel is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help Joel acquire agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. 
Income from this investment will help him to meet his obligations as the head of the family and family business.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as certified seeds and fertilizers to improve his yields

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school, Carina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products.

Carina has been in this business for 36 years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods and personal care products

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Together Group made up of three women who each have gotten ahead thanks to their efforts and undertakings. They are affiliated with ID-Ghana, Teshie branch, and are requesting a ninth loan to continue to stock their businesses.

Matilda, the group leader, is 45 years old and married. She has operated a beverage bar for the past six years. She started this business with the help of her husband, who works selling soft drinks.

With the loan, she will buy assorted soft drinks to sell to customers. This will help her increase her income.

The other members are: Evelyn, 55 years old, who works as a fish seller; and Bortiokor, 57 years old, who has a small grocery on the table top in her home.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 50 years old. He lives with his wife in Zugdidi district. Gela is involved in agricultural activities. I addition, he owns a truck. 

Gela wants to start a taxi business. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to purchase a car. Once the car is purchased, Gela will serve people as a taxi driver and will be able to generate daily income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Mitaboni Kuneena Na Kwika Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Felista. She is 40 years old, married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development. 

She does poultry farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicken and chicken feed to increase poultry production. This will enable her increase her income to meet her family's necessities such as food, clothing and school fees for her children.

Felista is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and chicken feed to increase poultry production.

loans.name: Aisa

texts.en:
Aisa is 54 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Aisa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Aisa has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Aisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, soap, milk, and chips to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling fish and vegetable.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, soap, milk, and chips to sell

loans.name: Manush

texts.en:
Manush is a tailor from Spitak town. 

She lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and little granddaughter. Manush works from her house and receives many customers during the month. She usually sewing different types of shirts, dresses, and skirts for her customers. 

To be able to change her sewing machine with a new one and purchase fabric materials, Manush has applied for this loan. Manush has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for Manush to continue her works with a new sewing machine and satisfy customers' current orders.

loans.use: to pay for fabric materials and sewing machine

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana es una ama de casa, luchadora, comprometida es madre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad (ver foto), por el cual pelea diariamente en las calles de puerto salgar, vendiendo ropa de catálogo por encargo.

Ella trabaja de la siguiente manera, muestra una revista con los productos, anota el pedido y en 15 días se los entrega ofreciéndoles comodidades de pagos para que se animen a comprar, en la foto podemos ver dos cajas de encargos que tiene esta mujer ya vendidos.

Esta forma de trabajar le ha significativo un progreso muy significativo para su hogar y una independencia económica de su pareja.

Diana quiere solicitar un préstamo para cubrir un pedido que tiene vendido, es decir capital de trabajo para cubrir los pedidos de ropa que le hacen, cabe recordar que solicita el préstamo debido a las comodidades en pagos que le da a sus clientes pero ella debe cancelar la deuda contra entrega.
texts.en:
Diana is a stay-at-home-mom, tenacious, committed and the mother of a five-year-old youngster  (see photo) for whom she fights daily in the streets of Puerto Salgar selling clothing through catalogue orders.

She works like this: she shows a magazine with the products, writes down the order and within 15 days she delivers them, offering convenient payment options as incentives. In the photo, two boxes of orders can be seen which this woman has already sold.

Working in this way has meant a very significant improvement for her household as well as financial independence from her partner.

Diana wishes to request a loan to cover an order that she has sold. In other words, to have working capital to cover orders for clothes that her clients make. It is important to remember that she is requesting this loan due to the payment options she gives her clients, but she needs to balance the debt on delivery.

loans.use: to have working capital to cover orders for clothes that her customers make

loans.name: Mwoloto Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Rosalia; a member of Mwoloto Women Group. She is 46 years old, married, and a mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development. 

She operates a secondhand clothes selling business. She is borrowing Kiva to buy more secondhand clothes and add stock. With increased income, she will be able to pay for her son’s college fees and also provide food to her family.

Rosalia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell to gain more income to pay college fees for her son and also provide food to her family.

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Asegelile, who is in his late 30s, is married with two children. He has been running a BBQ business for three years now. He works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Asegelile’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the BBQ business.  He dreams of owning a general store.  

Asegelile will share this loan with his loan group Maendeleo, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the BBQ business

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. She started five years ago working as a tailor to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker who has professional skills in this domain. She succeeded through out the years in gaining her loyal customers.

Mona is an ambitious woman who is always trying hard to develop her business and improve her living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new agriculture business and buy necessary fertilizer to start planting. 

Mona hopes to expand her two businesses more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new agriculture business and buy the necessary fertilizers

loans.name: Erick Jose

texts.es:
Años atrás el taller de Erick era conocido por su buen trabajo, ahora no solo es conocido por eso, sino también por sus materiales de calidad en su taller de soldadura, los cuales obtuvo en su último préstamo con la ayuda de MiCrédito y Kiva. Este emprendedor de 38 años de edad, con más de tres años de experiencia se siente muy agradecido con todas las personas que le ayudaron en ese crédito anterior, pues ha podido sacar adelante a su esposa y a sus dos hijos.
Tras ver el avance que ha tenido con su última inversión, se siente seguro de seguir haciéndolo, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar hierro, casco, guantes, varias para soldadura, entre otros materiales y herramientas que le servirán para seguir ofreciendo un servicio de calidad. Afortunadamente cuenta con el apoyo de sus trabajadores y de su hijo, así que este es un complemento más que le ayudará a seguir creciendo como él lo desea.
texts.en:
Years ago Erick's workshop was known for its good work, and now it's known not only for that but also for the quality welding materials that he obtained with his last loan with the help of MiCredito and Kiva. This 38 year old entrepreneur, with over three years of experience, is very grateful to all of the people that helped him with the previous loan, since it enabled him to support his wife and two children.

After seeing the progress he made with the last investment, he feels confident about doing it again, so he's applying for a new loan to purchase iron, a helmet, gloves, and welding items in addition to other materials and tools that he'll make use of to continue providing quality service. Fortunately he can depend on the support of his workers and his son, so this is another asset that help continue to achieve the growth that he's after.

loans.use: To purchase iron, a helmet, gloves, and items for welding among other things.

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en: Yosam, a resident of Kyenjojo-Uganda, is married with four children. He deals in cattle fattening alongside a retail shop to supplement his incomes. The main reason to start his business was to get income to meet his family’s increasing demands. The loan purpose is to buy cattle for fattening to sell after a short time. His family dream is to educate his children as his business dream is to increase the number of cattle to sell, thus increasing profits. His business challenges include price fluctuations and prolonged droughts leading to lack of water and pastures for his animals.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening to sell after a short time.

loans.name: Cindy Paola

texts.es: Cindy es una joven de 26 años que se inició en la vida comercial hace año y medio, reside en un municipio del Atlántico llamado Baranoa en donde se encuentran la gran mayoría de sus clientes a quienes les oferta una amplia gama de productos cosméticos, perfumes y prendas de vestir los cuales comercializa a través de visitas. Para poder financiar la demanda generada por la proximidad del día del padre  y abastecerse con prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas y ropa interior, está solicitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, inversión con la que aspira le generará un incremento en sus ganancias y le ayudará al crecimiento de su negocio. Uno de los deseos de Cindy  es tener casa propia, organizar su local comercial y que  su negocio prospere para ayudar económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Cindy is a young woman, age 26, who started out in business a year and a half ago.  She lives in the Atlantic community called Baranoa, where a large majority of her customers are found.  She offers them a wide range of products such as cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing, which she sells through visits.  

In order to be able to finance the demand generated by the upcoming Father’s Day and stock herself with clothing such as pants, shirts, and underwear, she is asking for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She hopes this investment will lead to an increase in her earnings and help her to expand her business.  One of Cindy’s desires is to have her own house and establish her own shop.  She also wants her business to prosper in order to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy outfits such as pants, tops, and underwear

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Ella es Zoila, una mujer de 50 años de edad, que quizás en su juventud no pudo estudiar debido a las condiciones de su familia, que quizás sea una persona humilde, pero a esta mujer le sobra corazón y ganas de trabajar para generar un mejor futuro para su familia conformada por 5 hijos.

Zoila trabaja vendiendo ropa juvenil y casual para hombre y mujer y calzado principalmente sandalias que es el más usado en la región, por eso requiere un préstamo que le permita adquirir mayor surtido de ropa y calzado para vender y obtener más ganancias.

Zoila no se rinde ella no quiere que sus hijos vivan lo que ella paso, por ello pondrá todo su empeño en fortalecer su negocio para así generar una esperanza y una vida digna a su familia.

Zoila solo pide una ayuda, quieres que le des la herramienta para que ella pueda poner todos sus esfuerzos en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
She is Zoila a woman 50 years old, who maybe in her youth could not study because of the condition of her family and who maybe is a humble person, but this woman has enough heart and desire to work to generate a better future for her family composed of five children. 

Zoila works selling young people's clothing and casual clothing for men and women and footwear, principally sandals because that is the footwear most used in the region. That’s why she requires a loan that allows her to buy greater assortment of clothes and shoes to sell and increase her profit.

Zoila does not give up. She does not want her children to live the way she did, so she will put all of her effort in building up her business for it generates hope and a worthy life for her family. 

Zoila only requests help, she wants you to give her a tool for which she can put all of her efforts to benefitting her family.

loans.use: to stock up with clothes and shoes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty eight years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development.

She operates a retail shop and is borrowing to buy more foodstuffs e.g. sugar, cooking fat and flour hence add stock. This will increase her income to enable her to provide food and pay school fees for her children. 

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs e.g. sugar, cooking fat and flour to add stock to her retail shop for more income to provide food and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fruit, such as pineapple, watermelon, cantaloupe, papaya, mango, etc. to meet his customers' demands and requests for produce.

loans.name: Maria Berenice

texts.es:
Berenice es una mujer de 53 años de edad que se dedica al negocio de confección a terceros en el cual genera un empleo y está a un paso de generar el segundo, esto se trata de una solicitud de préstamo con el cual comprará una moto que le servirá para entregar mercancía.

Berenice es una mujer que solo tiene su negocio para generar el sustento para su familia, ella comenzó sola su negocio y está muy motivada por la oportunidad de progreso que se presenta ante ella.

Una oportunidad como esta significará progreso y consolidación para Berenice.
texts.en:
Berenice is a 53-year old woman who makes her living as a third-party dress maker.  She has generated employment for one person and is just about to generate another job.  However, it depends on getting a loan, with which Berenice will purchase a motorbike to use for delivering her merchandise. 

Berenice relies solely on her business to support her family.  She herself started her business, and she is very motivated by the opportunity for growth that is being presented to her. 

An opportunity such as this will mean growth and strength for Berenice.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike, which will help her in delivering her merchandise.

loans.name: Katanga Farmers Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Beatrice; a member of Katanga Farmers Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2012 to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development. 

She operates a general retail shop selling soft drinks, biscuits, candles, match boxes, and other household items. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more commodities e.g. sugar, soaps, salt, bread, wheat flour, etc., therefore adding stock to her general retail shop for increased income to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy commodities like sugar, soap, salt, and wheat flour, therefore adding stock to her general retail shop to enable her to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Rafiki Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Judith, a member of Rafiki Self Help Group. She is 26 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014.

Judith sells shoes as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, receiving training in enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her business well. 

Judith is borrowing from Kiva lenders so she can add more inventory of shoes and increase her income. This will allow her to support her family's needs and pay for her children's school fees. 

Judith is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of shoes that will help improve sales and increase income to be used for her family's needs.

loans.name: Alejandro Miguel

texts.es: Alejandro esta casado con Mery desde ya hace mucho tiempo, viven en la localidad rural de Cotahuasi, que esta ubicado en el departamento de Arequipa. Alejandro se dedica a la agricultura orgánica de kiwicha desde hace mucho tiempo, él en su localidad es conocido por dar una kiwicha de calidad. Actualmente solicita el préstamo para poder realizar la cosecha de su cultivo, espera pagar a las personas que le ayuden a realizar la cosecha ademas, usara parte del dinero para el traslado de su cultivo desde su terreno agrícola hasta su pueblo. En el futuro espera poder compartir muchos años mas junto a su amada esposa.
texts.en:
Alejandro has been married to Mery for a long time, and they live in the rural town of Cotahuasi, which is located in the department of Arequipa. Alejandro makes a living farming organic amaranth, which he has done for a long time. In his town, he is known for providing quality amaranth.

Currently he is asking for the loan in order to make the cultivate his crop, as he expects to pay people to help him with the harvest. He will use part of the money for the transfer of the crop from his agricultural land to his town.

In the future he hopes to share many more years with his beloved wife.

loans.use: to be able to harvest his organic amaranth.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer emprendedora de 38 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 1 año y convive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. 

Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operaria de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansada de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su hijo, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección, para lo cual se anima a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de una maquina fileteadora, recubridora e insumos de confección como tela e hilos. 

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado. 

Con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo siempre de la mano de la Corporación Interactuar
texts.en:
Paola is an enterprising woman, age 38.  She is the mother of one child, age 1, and lives with her partner in a common-law relationship.

During her working life, she has worked in various seamstress workshops as a machine operator, so she has experience and knowledge in managing this type of business.  However, being tired of working in other workshops and having a desire to spend more time with her son, she decided to set up her own sewing workshop.  Because of this, she wants to ask for a loan which will be invested in the purchase of a serger sewing machine, an interlock sewing machine, and sewing supplies such as fabric and thread.

This will allow her to put her project into action; she hopes to make a big impact on the sector in this way, in order to generate a favorable profit and so make her dream of being well-positioned in market come true.

With her ambition and drive, she sees herself offering jobs to others in the mid-range future, always working alongside Corporación Interactuar.

loans.use: to buy a serger sewing machine, an interlock sewing machine, and sewing supplies such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Omar Adrian

texts.es:
