Omar un joven de 22 años de edad, la nueva sangre, la nueva era del cultivo de la familia, Omar heredó un cultivo de caña y café, su misión es engrandecer y ampliar estos hermosos terrenos que con mucho esfuerzo y sudor fundaron y cultivaron sus abuelos.
Omar quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos como lo son abonos y fertilización de sus cultivos de café y caña.
Con el préstamo tendrá los insumos necesarios para el mantenimiento esperando ya pronto la cosecha que sea abundante y de calidad.
texts.en:
Omar a 22-year-old new blood, a new era of family crops. Omar inherited a cane and coffee farm and his mission is to enhance and expand these beautiful grounds that his grandparents founded and cultivated with hard work and sweat.
 Omar wants a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and for the fertilization of his crops of coffee and sugar cane.
With the loan, he will have the necessary supplies for the crop maintenance and soon expects the harvest to be abundant and of quality.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and to fertilize his crops of coffee and sugar cane.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de cabezas de chancho.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, optimista, paciente, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad ‘Cullucachi’ que se encuentra a una altura de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, al sureste de Lago Titicaca, próxima al glaciar Huayna Potosí. Allí viven 10 comunidades de origen Aymara. Las principales actividades la constituyen el cultivo de; papas, quinua, habas, cebada y avena, y la crianza de ganado camélido y ovino. La mayor parte de los productos cultivados se destina al autoconsumo, mientras que una parte del ganado se vende en el mercado.
Nancy es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que trabajan en agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica. Su trabajo es la venta de cabezas de chacho; la cabeza de chancho es muy utilizada en la comida tradicional para cocinar diferentes comidas según la región; “mi actividad principal es la venta de cabezas, mi segunda actividad es la lechería…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que cuenta con una amplia experiencia familiar la desventaja es la falta de forraje para que coma el ganado, en época de invierno. Su sueño es ampliar la cantidad de ganado lechero, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para aumentar su producción lechera. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para engordar en invierno y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 26-year-old woman, single, with no children, and her business is selling pig heads. 

She is entrepreneurial, persevering, optimistic, patient, strong, responsible, and very hardworking.  Her business is in the town of Cullucachi, which is at an altitude of 3,900 meters above sea level to the southeast of Lake Titicaca, next to Huayna Potosí Mountain. There are 10 Aymara communities living there.  They mainly grow the following crops: potatoes, quinoa, broad beans, barley, and oats,  and raise llamas and sheep.  Most of the produce they grow is for their own consumption, while part of their livestock is sold at market. 

Nancy has olive skin, dark eyes, long, black hair; she is short, with a slim build, and she dresses stylishly.  Her mother tongue is Aymará, which is spoken in the area, and she speaks Spanish because general education and because of the work she does.  She lives her life with her parents, who work in farming, and they live in their own home made of adobe with a sheet metal roof and cement floor that has electricity and well water that is extracted via an electric pump. Her business is selling pig heads; pig heads are used often in traditional food to make different regional dishes.  "My primary business is selling heads, my secondary business is dairy sales," she tells us.  The advantage of her businesses is that she has extensive family experience; the disadvantage is the lack of fodder for the livestock to eat in winter.  Her dream is to expand her number of dairy cows; she wants to buy a dairy cows to increase her milk production.  This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the four years she has been doing this work on her own. 

For these reasons Nancy is requesting a loan to buy dairy cows to fatten in winter and keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to fatten in winter and keep her business going

loans.name: Sumanta

texts.en:
Sumanta lives in Indramayu, an area in West Java, located about 4 hours from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married, and he owns a stall where he sells snacks, drinks, and mobile airtime credits to his community. 

Sumanta joined PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda (Ruma), Kiva's partner, a year ago. As his business grows, he is hoping to get a loan from Kiva's lenders so he can provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Your loan will be very useful to help Sumanta improve his business and his community, which needs access to communication services. 

Sumanta's goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community using Ruma's latest product called Mapan, so his community can have access to better products with lower prices. 

Sumanta is shown in the photo above. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid mobile phone credit to resell to local community members who need access to communication services.

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William ha sido un hombre muy dedicado, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 13 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposa y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja solo todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productivo como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de celulares, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

William manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
William is a very dedicated man, who has always focussed on taking care of his family, which consists of two children and his wife. He has always enjoyed working as an independent trader. He began to sell goods 13 years ago, as he is financially responsible for the household, together with his wife, and he needs to generate resources to achieve this.

His customers are made up of neighbours, family members, and friends from this commercial area. He works on his own every day in his business, with the advantage of being able to look after his family, whilst at the same time managing to become successful as a salesperson.

He is now asking for a loan to buy wholesale mobile phones, as this time of year represents a great opportunity. This will let him stock up with more variety to meet growing demand, which will in turn allow him to earn more for his family.

William says that his greatest wish is to be able to continue to support his family and provide his children with an education. This will allow him to see them become professionals and be able to have a happy and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy a range of wholesale mobile phones to sell on.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Unas ganas de trabajar y de progresar son las que se respiran en la empresa del joven José, un hombre de 20 años de edad que tiene un negocio de distribución de bebidas.
José trabaja todos los días de la semana 7 horas, el negocio se lo ingenió y aprendió de este gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando informalmente en negocios similares.
Ahora José para abarcar un mayor número de tiendas, hacerse reconocer en otros lugares y seguir su linda labor que ha ayudado enormemente a las mejoras de su hogar y mantener su madre, busca tu ayuda a través de un préstamo que usara para ampliar su capacidad de inventario.
El préstamo será usado en compra de bebidas refrescantes y con este logrará poder atender un mayor número de tiendas que significará un excelente aumento de rentabilidad que apoyara su sueño de comprar uan vivienda propia para obsequiársela a su madre.
texts.en:
Young José, 20 years old, has a drinks distribution business, in which you can feel the desire to work and progress. Jose works every day of the week for 7 hours. He came up with the business and learned from it thanks to the experience he had working in similar enterprises.

His work has helped enormously in improving his home and supporting his mother. In order to supply a larger number of shops, become known in other places and continue his good work, José is seeking your help via a loan, which he will use to enlarge his inventory. The loan will be used to buy refreshments and so reach a larger number of shops, which will mean a significant increase in profitability. This will contribute towards his dream of buying a home to give to his mother.

loans.use: to buy a selection of drinks.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 

Hace aproximadamente 10 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Luis busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materiales para arreglar el techo de su galpón y también para comprar gallinas ponedoras. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Luis tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Luis!
texts.en:
Luis has been faced with many adversities in his life, however he has always had the strength to overcome them and move forward together with his children. 

About 10 years ago Luis began desperately looking for a source of income for his home. This was how he started raising and selling chickens, a business that has earned him an income with which he has been able to pay the household bills.

Luis is looking for a loan that will give him the possibility to purchase materials to fix the roof of his house and also buy laying hens. He knows that he can achieve this with the help of Interactuar.

Luis hopes that this loan will allow him to move forward with his business. As well as this, he hopes that his business will grow and generate more income with which he can offer his children a better quality of life and more opportunities for progress.

With the loan you make today you can improve Luis's business and his life!

loans.use: to buy materials to fix the roof of his house and to buy laying hens

loans.name: Eduar Arbey

texts.es:
Aduar es soltero y padre de un hijo de 4 años de edad; desde hace aproximadamente 1 año se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece productos como bolsos, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor de bolsos, así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.
Aduar, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aduar is single and the father of a four year old son. He started working as an independent retailer approximately one year ago, learning on the job. He began this work out of a need to generate an income to maintain his family. Aduar sells products such as bags and accessories, amongst others, and has the advantage of meeting new people every day to whom he can offer his wares and improve his sales.

At the moment Aduar is applying for help with a loan to buy bags in bulk so that he can stock more variety to satisfy customer demand which is increasing in this season. This will improve his level of income.

Aduar hopes to continue working with effort and dedication to make progress with his business so that in the near future he can set up a store in a local shopping centre where he can sell a wider variety of items. This will give him a profitable income and provide him with good financial stability so that he can give his son an excellent education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bags in bulk so that he can stock more variety to satisfy customer demand

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.es:
Eriberto es un pequeño productor en una comunidad rural de Jinotega, dedicado a la caficultura desde hace más de 15 años. Su finca es de 4.04 Hectáreas, de las cuales 3.52 son de café. Su producción anual promedio en los últimos tres años ha sido de 68.66 quintales de café pergamino. Cuenta con las certificaciones de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

En los ciclos pasados parte de su cosecha se vio comprometida por el ataque de plagas que debilitaron los cafetos; este año ha diseñado un plan de mejoramiento y reforzamiento para sus plantas con lo cual asegurará una mayor calidad y disminuirá las pérdidas durante el procesamiento. Para ello está solicitando un financiamiento a fin de asegurar los insumos que requiere para implementar dicho plan. 

Esta inversión le permitirá a Eriberto incrementar los rendimientos y obtener mayores ingresos para  mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Eriberto is a small-scale producer in the rural community of Jinotega, growing coffee for over 15 years. His plantation is 4.04 hectares, 3.52 of which are for coffee. His average annual production in the last three years has been 68.66 quintales of pergamino coffee. He has certification in Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E practices.

In previous seasons part of his harvest was compromised by pests that weakened the coffee plants; this year he has devised a plan to improve and reinforce his plants, which will ensure higher quality and reduce losses during processing. To this end he's applying for financing with the objective of obtaining the supplies he requires to implement this plan.

This investment will allow Eriberto to increase his yields and earn more income to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Luz Nanci

texts.es:
Con sus manos trabajadoras, Luz ha luchado fuertemente para otorgarles a sus 4 hijos la oportunidad de que puedan estudiar y poder realizarse como personas.

Ella es una mujer amable y tiene un negocio de venta de arepas, desayunos y almuerzos en el municipio de Frontino.

De este negocio dependen sus hijos y su futuro. Es por eta razón que solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos e ingredientes como carne, arroz, verduras, granos, entre otros, además de un molino y una mesa en acero inoxidable para poder trabajar de una mejor manera, así podrá tener una mayor cantidad de insumos disponibles para la preparación de sus alimentos.
Apoya a Luz a sacar adelante su negocio con un préstamo.
texts.en:
With her hard-working hands, Luz has really struggled to give her four children the opportunity to be able to study and to be fulfilled.

She is a friendly woman and she has a store where she sells arepas, breakfasts and lunches in the city of Frontino.

Her children and their futures depend on this business. This is why she is requesting the financial support to buy supplies and ingredients such as meat, rice, vegetables, grains and other things, as well as a grinder and a stainless steel table to be able to work better. This will allow her to have a larger amount of supplies available to prepare the food.

Help Luz get her business off the ground with this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients such as meat, rice, vegetables, grains and other things, in addition to a grinder and a table.

loans.name: Sor Maria

texts.es:
Sor, con 59 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender abarrotes en una tienda en el municipio de Dabeiba; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto lo impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor como mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los clientes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.

Sor manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El confía en el apoyo de la Corporación interactuar y en los prestamistas de Kiva para lograr este objetivo.
texts.en:
Sor, 59 years old, has made a living for many years from selling groceries in a store in the municipality of Dabeiba. In this way, she supplements the income with which she has brought her children out ahead.

Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to work untiringly. She is always looking for the way to succeed. This is what is driving her to request the loan to purchase supplies wholesale, such as pastries, soft drinks, candies, and baked goods, among others. This will allow her to continue with her work and she will have a greater variety of articles to offer to her customers, thus improving sales and her income.

Sor states that her greatest desire is to be able to acquire her own shop located in the center of the city in which to set up her business and be able to make it much more profitable. This will guarantee her an economic stability favorable to providing a greater quality of life to her family.

She has confidence in the support of the Interactuar Corporation and in the Kiva lenders to achieve this objective.

loans.use: to purchase supplies wholesale, such as pastries, soft drinks, candies, and baked goods, among others.

loans.name: Dario Antonio

texts.es:
Darío se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de cerrajería y soldadura de metal, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 
Ya que ha laborado 19 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas solo.

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar la compra de una moto para los domicilios, además de comprar moldes para fabricar llaves de puertas.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio.

Actualmente es casado y vive con su esposa y una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Darío works successfully in his locksmith and soldering business. He is a well-known person in his neighborhood because of his good work and good service.

He has worked for 19 years with the knowledge he acquired through working in a variety of workshops. He has had the opportunity to maintain his job and he has tried to improve his family’s living conditions.

He works by himself, for 8 hours every day.

He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for traveling to residences and to buy molds for making door keys.

With these elements, he can continue working.

He is married and lives with his wife and one of his daughters.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for traveling to residences and to buy molds for making door keys.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development it offers.

She practices mixed farming (poultry and vegetable farming) and also operates a green grocer store. In her green grocer store, she sells mangoes, tomatoes, bananas and onions, among others. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, to increase the stock of her green grocer store and hence meet her customers' demands.

Janet is grateful to Kiva for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, to increase the stock of her green grocer store and hence meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 27 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are both attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development and financial development, that it offers.

She operates a green grocer store, where she sells assorted fruits and vegetables. Besides that, she also works as a casual labourer to supplement her income.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables like water melons, kale, bananas and potatoes to sell in her green grocer business. With increased income, she will be able to meet her family expenses like school fees and clothing.

Elena is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her green grocer store for increased income to pay family expenses like school fees and clothing

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 40 years old, married to Renah and supports a family of two children. He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 18 years, earning KES 12,000 per month.

Charles has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy certified seeds and farm inputs to use for high production and supply for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and farm inputs to use for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amparo es una mujer de 63 años de edad, ella es felizmente casada y junto con su esposo atiende un negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual es el que genera el sustento diario para su hogar.

Durante su juventud tanto ella y su esposo trabajaron con mucho empeño y esfuerzo para criar y levantar a sus 4 hijos y ahora que ellos son mayores de edad y se valen por si mismo quieren trabajar para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y juntar capital para vivir una vejez tranquila y digna.

Amparo quiere solicitar un préstamo ampliar y mejorar el surtido en su negocio, lo invertirá en la compra de un enfriador, refrescos, cerveza, dulcería y galletería.
texts.en:
Amparo is a 63-year old woman.  She is happily married and together with her husband runs a small grocery store.  The store supports their home. 

When she was young, Amparo and her husband worked hard and with a lot of determination to raise and lift up their four children.  Now that their children are grown and take care of themselves, Amparo and her husband want to work to improve the condition of their home and to put together enough capital to live tranquilly and with dignity for the rest of their lives. 

Amparo wants to request a loan to expand and improve her business's stock.  She will invest it in the purchase of a cooler, sodas, beer, sweets and cookies.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business's stock.  She will invest in the purchase of a cooler, sodas, beer, sweets and cookies.

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron, who is 49 years old, is a married man with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His businesses include cattle trade and dairy sales as sources of income. He will use the loan to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

He ventured into business to earn income to look after his family. He has a family goal of educating his children, and his business goal is to buy a car to help him access different markets with ease. He faces hardships of high transport costs, drought, and price fluctuations of his products.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg has been involved in the fruit and vegetable retail business since 2010.

He lives and works in Gyulagarak village of Lori region with his young wife and their seven-year-old son. Gevorg decided to earn his family's living by selling fruits in the market. Usually he drives to Armavir town (which is 161 km away from the village where he lives) and purchases new supplies of fruits and vegetables, which he then brings to nearby villages and sells.

This is Gevorg's everyday working process, and he does his best to earn a high income for sustaining his family's living. Gevorg applied for this loan to pay for renovation of his small truck for transporting supplies to market and also to purchase 700 kg of apricots for resale.

Gevorg has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his small truck for transporting fruits and vegetables to market and also to purchase 700 kg of apricots for resale

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan Francisco es un pequeño productor de café de la zona Norte de Nicaragua. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su finca de 9.15 hectáreas, de las cuales 4.92 son de café. En el último año su producción de café fue de 50 quintales pergamino. Su visión es incrementar los rendimientos productivos de su plantación de café, mediante procesos de mejoramiento nutricional. 

Para este ciclo su meta es enfrentar los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que afectan el café mediante la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento. 

Él está seguro que con la disposición de recursos, su trabajo y el acompañamiento técnico que le brinda la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), podrá alcanzar sus metas, que le permitirán tener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco is a small-scale coffee producer in the area of Northern Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and 3 children on his 9.15 hectar plantation, 4.92 of which are for coffee. Last year his coffee production was 50 quintales of pergamino. His goal is to increase the productive yield of his coffee plantation, through methods of nutritional improvement.

This season his goal is to confront the problems of pests and disease that affects coffee, by applying supplies and fertilizer that his plantation requires, which is why he's applying for a loan.

He's certain that with resources at his disposal, his work, and the technical support that the organization Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) provides he will be able to reach his goals, which would allow him to have a higher income for the welfare of his family,

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizer that his plantation requires for higher yields.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Fatima est une femme mariée  qui vit à Attiégou . Agée de 28 ans, Fatima est tres dynamique et  vend des produits cosmétiques, des mèches et des pommades pour gagner son revenu quotidien. Grâce à cette activité, Fatima arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité. Fatima s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Pour équiper son étagère, Fatima demande ce prêt pour acheter des pommades et des mèches afin de gagner son revenu et atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Fatima is a married woman who lives in Attiégou. Twenty-eight years old, Fatima is very dynamic and she sells cosmetic products, hairnets, and pomades to gain a daily revenue. Because of this business, Fatima has been able to save and make a good profit from her business. Fatima resupplies twice a month at the local market. Fatima is requesting this loan to stock her shelves with pomades and hairnets in order to make a profit and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy eight dozen pomades and sixty boxes of  hairnets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Colombia national team jerseys

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine is 52 years old, married and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming. She is now borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed, hence increasing milk production. This will enable her to earn more income to repair her cowshed and also meet household expenses such as food and clothing.

Cathrine is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed, hence increasing milk production for increased income to enable her to repair her cowshed and meet family expenses such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans et mère de deux enfants. Monique vit à Attiégou pour entreprendre son activité. Monique vend des articles de commerce général pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Monique s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Monique demande ce crédit pour acheter des lampes torches, des moustiquaires et des piles afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Monique is a 39 year old married woman and mother of two children. Monique lives in Attiégou to start doing her business. Monique sells general retail items to earn a living and to help her family. Monique resupplies two times per month at the market. Monique is requesting this loan to buy torch lamps, mosquito nets, and batteries in order to support her husband in the family expenses and to provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen torch lamps, 4 boxes of mosquito nets, and 16 packs of batteries.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jose de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee una sala de belleza donde su esposa le ayuda con el trabajo desde hace 8 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por el buen trabajo y el buen trato que se le da a los clientes, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cremas, maquillajes, secadoras, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose, 40 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. For 8 years, he has had a beauty salon where his wife helps him. His business is located at his house, and he has a lot of customers because of the good work he does and how well he treats his customers.

He is applying for a loan to buy creams, makeup, dryers, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other things that he needs. This will allow him to earn more money that will help him be more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy creams, makeup, dryers, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other things.

loans.name: Fco. Pavon Group

texts.es:
La ubicación de cierta comunidad veracruzana ha permitido el crecimiento su crecimiento económico. Además de la producción de los cultivos agrícolas, hay una fábrica vidriera que brinda empleo a más de mil quinientos empleados, se elaboran sobre todo botellas para la industria cervecera y en promedio cada horno industrial transforma 360 toneladas de vidrio al día.
   Fco. Pavón es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 10 personas responsables, honestas y trabajadoras quienes iniciaron una actividad en esta comunidad. Los miembros son: Janet e Irasema quienes venden ropa; Leónides, Gabriela y Juana, abarrotes; Carmen, zapatos; Tomasa, calzado, recipientes de plástico y cosméticos; Ana, comida; Luis, tacos y Minerva quien maneja una repostería. 
   Doña Leónides es una  mujer trabajadora cuya meta es mantenerse siempre activa, por lo cual, desde joven comenzó a vender ropa de manera ambulante. Posteriormente decidió casarse con Francisco y de la relación nacieron tres hijos. Durante el tiempo que cuidó a sus pequeños, puso pausa a la actividad, sin embargo algo le hacía falta, como ella misma comenta “no aguante mucho tiempo sin producir dinero y fue así como inicie con la venta de abarrotes”.
   Hace ya 15 que Leónides abrió su tienda y siempre busca brindar la mejor atención a sus clientes por lo tanto mantiene un surtido amplio. Con las ganancias obtenidas, además de reinvertir en la compra de producto, apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Esta vez el préstamo lo empleará en la compra de azúcar, arroz, sopa, refresco, dulces y detergente continuando con su objetivo y lema de que “el cliente es primero”.
   Por otra parte Doña Leo, como le conocen mejor, tiene otras metas; “quiero abrir la sala de mi casa y convertirla en tienda, así podré ofrecer aún mayor variedad a mis clientes”. Ella junto con todo el grupo agradece a cada una de las personas que hacen posible la oportunidad del préstamo.

*En la fotografía se aprecia el anaquel donde acomoda y exhibe la mercancía, Doña Leo viste blusa color verde.
texts.en:
The location of this Veracruz community has helped it to grow economically. Besides agricultural production there is also a glass factory that employs more than 1,500 people and mainly makes beer bottles, and whose industrial ovens transform 360 tons of materials into glass every day.

Fco Pavon is the name of the group here. It is made up of 10 responsible, honest and hard working people who have all started a business in this community. The members are Janet and Irasema who sell clothing; Leonides, Gabriela and Juana who sell groceries; Carmen who sells shoes; Tomasa who also sells shoes, plastics, and cosmetics; Ana who sells food; Luis who sells tacos and Minerva who runs a pastry shop.

Mrs Leonides is a hard working woman whose goal is to always be active, and so since she was a young girl she began selling clothing door to door. Later, she decided to get married to Francisco and they had three children. During this time, she raised her children and she put a pause on her economic activity. But she missed working and she herself said "I couldn't take it, so much time not making money, and so I decided to open a business selling groceries."

Leonides opened her store fifteen years ago and she is always looking for new ways to improve her service and keep her store stocked. With the earnings she makes, besides reinvesting in her store, she helps her husband with household expenses.

This loan will be used to purchase sugar, rice, soups, drinks, sweets and detergents so she can make good on her slogan "The Customer Always Comes First"

But Mrs Leonides has other goals as well: "I want to expand the living room of my home and turn it into a store, and be able to offer an even wider variety of products to my customers." She, along with the group, thank every one of the individuals who make their loan opportunity possible.

* In the photo, Mrs. Leonides is the woman in the green blouse.

loans.use: purchase sugar, rice, soup, drinks, sweets and detergents.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es:
En una de las colonias de la ciudad conocida como "La novia del sol" se ha formado el grupo "Luna", los integrantes y sus actividades son: Gloria quien vende sillones tejidos; Guillermina, ropa y cosméticos; Juan quien maneja un taller de motos e Iván, un taller mecánico.

Después de terminar la preparatoria, Juan comenzó a trabajar como chofer de un taxi para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares. Sin embargo, siempre tuvo la meta de tener su propio negocio y hace 5 años finalmente lo logró abriendo su taller de motocicletas, esta vez, para proveer a su propia familia: su esposa Teresa y sus dos pequeñas.“No hay nada mejor que tener mi propia actividad y ser mi propio patrón”. 

La pasión por las motos fue lo que llevó a Juan a elegir su actividad. Aprendió a reparar motos simplemente arreglando la propia y poco a poco aprendiendo un poco más. El taller, se ubica cerca de un instituto tecnológico lo que le favorece pues la mayoría de los estudiantes e incluso de los habitantes de la ciudad, tienen una moto. Además el empeño de Juan también le ha ayudado a tener un negocio estable. Ofrece su servicio desde las 7 de la mañana y hasta las 8 de la noche, por lo general, aunque también atiende casos especiales. "Si algún cliente necesita servicio después de las 8 de la noche, acudo a brindarlo".

Con las ganancias de la actividad, Juan cubre los gastos del hogar, paga la renta del local donde tiene el taller y reinvierte en material y herramientas como aceite, bujías, cámaras y focos ya que son las piezas que con mayor frecuencia cambia. El nuevo préstamo lo utilizará para comprar llaves, aceite, calibrador y espejos para continuar con su actividad.Entre sus metas está dar empleo a un ayudante y abrir otro taller.

El grupo "Luna" se mantiene fuerte y unido a pesar de los obstáculos que atravesaron hace algunos ciclos. Todos agradecen el apoyo que han recibido a través de los préstamos.

*La fotografía se capturó en casa de la señora Gloria quien se dedica a elaborar sillones tejidos y se observan algunos de sus productos. Juan es quien viste playera color negro.
texts.en:
In one of the neighborhoods of the city, known as "La novia del sol" (The Bride of the Sun), the Luna group was formed. The members and their businesses are: Gloria, who sells woven chairs; Guillermina, clothing and cosmetics; Juan, who runs a motorcycle workshop; and iván, a workshop mechanic. 

After finishing high school, Juan began to work as a taxi driver to help his parents with the family expenses. Nevertheless, he always had the goal of having his own business, and five years ago he finally achieved this, opening his motorcycle workshop, this time to provide for his own family: his wife Teresa and their two little ones. "There is nothing better than having my own business and being my own boss."

His passion for motorcycles was what brought Juan to choose this business. He learned to repair motorcycles simply by adjusting his own, and little by little learning a little more. The workshop is located near a technical institute, which gives him an advantage, since the majority of the students and even the residents of the city have motorcycles. In addition, Juan's efforts have also helped him to have a stable business. He offers his services from 7 in the morning until 8 at night, in general, although he also services special cases. "If some customer needs service after 8 at night, I come to his aid to offer it."

With the earnings from the business, Juan covers the household expenses, pays the rent of the space where he has the workshop, and reinvests in materials and tools such as oil, spark plugs, tubes, and headlights, since these are the parts that he changes with greatest frequency. He will use the new loan to purchase keys, oil, a gauge, and mirrors to continue with his business. Among his goals are to employ an assistant and to open another workshop.

The Luna group remains strong and united, in spite of the obstacles they experienced several loan cycles ago. They are all grateful for the support that they have received through the loans.

The photograph was taken at the house of Señora Gloria, who makes woven chairs, and some of her products can be seen. Juan is the one wearing a black t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy keys, oil, a gauge, and mirrors

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a smallholder farmer residing in Sinon division, Kenya. He is mainly involved in crop farming, but he also earns income from raising livestock. His strength as a horticultural farmer lies in his ability to predict changing weather patterns.

Richard needs external financing to buy agricultural inputs and implements so he can enhance his farm’s productivity. The main challenge he is facing is the lack of financial products tailored for his kind of business. However, through Juhudi Kilimo, he is now able to access loans with suitable and flexible terms from Kiva.

Richard is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers, and other important inputs such as pesticides and herbicides. Your loan will help him acquire the agricultural inputs necessary for a successful harvest and quality yields. 

Income from this investment will help Richard to meet his obligations as the head of his family and family business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 years old, married to Monicah, and supports a family of four children. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last 13 years, earning KES 16,000 per month. 

James has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy dairy feeds for his animals for more milk production and supply, which would enable him to earn more income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds for his animals for more milk production and supply, which would enable him to earn more income.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 29 years old, married to Hyline, and supports two children. 

He has been a farmer for the last three years, and the business earns him 11,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers in order to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

He plans to use the profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural business. 

His hope is to be financially stable and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 41 years old and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She is involved in selling maize, second-hand clothes, and electronics. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more second-hand clothes and maize for resale in order to meet her customers' demands. This will increase her income and enable her to pay rent and school fees.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes and maize for resale

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old and married, living with his wife and his two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

His economic activity is farming, specifically potatoes. He also operates a curio shop to supplement his income. He is borrowing a loan to buy more stock for his curio shop, hence meeting his customer needs as well as increasing his income. With the increased income, he plans to buy a dairy cow and also renovate his family house.

David is happy and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his curio shop to meet customer needs and for increased income to buy a dairy cow and renovate his family house.

loans.name: Emilio Jose

texts.es:
Emilio es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 33 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente posee cultivos de plátano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidando de sus cultivos y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta.

Emilio manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.

El cultivo de Emilio Podrá mantenerse y salir adelante con tu ayuda!
texts.en:
Emilio is 33 years old and is a humble and hard-working farmer. At a young age, he learned everything about working in the fields from his father.

He now owns plots of plantain and the crops are harvested and sold in the local market where he lives. This generates enough income to pay for everyday household expenses and his wife's basic needs.

He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale farm inputs such as manure, pesticides and fertilizers. This will allow him to continue caring for his crops and improve productivity for the next harvest, which will increase the income he receives for each sale.

Emilio states that his greatest wish is to keep fighting to generate economic stability and provide his family with comfort and better living conditions.

With your help Emilio will be able to keep going and get ahead with his farming.

loans.use: to buy wholesale farm inputs such as manure, pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Joyce, 30 years old, with five children. She is married and lives with her family. Joyce farms beans and potatoes. She is grateful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise management training she received which equipped her with the knowledge to run her enterprise profitably. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer to boost her potato farming business. She intends to use the anticipated profit to provide food for the family and pay school fees.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will help boost farming to improve her supply and thus income.

loans.name: Maria Maura

texts.es: Maria de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, también se dedica a la venta de frutas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de jugos, huevos, granos básicos, leche, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 31 years old, lives in her own house with her parents. For the past 3 years, she has had a small store located in her house. She has a lot of customers, especially her neighbors. She also sells fruits. With what she gets from her sales, she is able to cover some household expenses.

She is applying for a loan to buy juices, eggs, staple foods, milk, sweet breads, etc., in order to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy juices, eggs, staple foods, milk, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme mariée et  âgée  de 30 ans. Avec ses quatre enfants, Dédé vit à Hédzranawoé pour vendre du riz préparé accompagné du spaghetti dans le quartier. Ce commerce lui procure le bénéfice et Dédé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dédé sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de riz, un carton de spaghetti et un bidon d’huile afin d’améliorer sa restauration et avoir un profit considérable pour faire face à ses préoccupations.
texts.en: Dédé is a 30 year old married woman, living in Hédzranawoé with her four children. Dédé sells cooked rice and spaghetti in the neighborhood. This business provides her with a profit and she resupplies twice a month at the market. Dédé is requesting this loan to buy a sack of rice, a box of spaghetti, and a bottle of oil in order to improve her cooking and to make a considerable profit to cope with her concerns.

loans.use: to buy one sack of rice, one box of spaghetti and one bottle of oil.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans, Améyo est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec ses deux enfants. Améyo travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Améyo vend des produits d’alimentations générales à la devanture de sa maison afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Améyo achète ses provisions quatre fois par mois sur un marché local. Améyo demande ce crédit pour commander des paniers de tomates fraiches, des épices et des bols de poissons fumés pour vendre et maximiser son bénéfice.
texts.en: Thirty three years old, Améyo is a married woman who lives in Baguida with her two children. Améyo actively works for the growth of her children. To attain her goals, Améyo sells general food products in front of her house in order to gain a profit. Améyo buys her provisions four times per month at a local market. Améyo is requesting this loan to buy baskets of fresh tomatoes, spices, and smoked fish to sell and maximize her profit.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of fresh tomatoes, three heaps of spices, and three bowls of smoked fish.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 30 years old, married to Judith, and supports a family of three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last five years, earning KES 6,700 per month. 

Vincent has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy spare parts for maintaining his motorcycle for efficient service and to gain more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start a retail shop. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintaining his motorcycle for efficient service and to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more maize for milling

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old, married and living with her husband and child who is still in primary school. She joined hand in hand in 2013 to benefit from the trainings, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

She is involved in poultry, dairy and pig farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more poultry for increased egg production. This increased production will enable her to meet her customer demand and hence earn more income to pay school fees for her child.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more poultry for increased egg production, hence meeting customer demand and earning more income to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children who are still in school. She joined Hand in Hand in 2011 to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development and financial management.

She practices mixed farming and mostly dairy and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fodder for her dairy, hence increasing milk production. With the increased income, she will be able to easily pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows, hence increasing milk production for increased income to easily pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose tiene 33 Años, está acompañado con la Señora María de 26 Años, con quien tiene una hija de 6 años. El Sr. Jose se dedica a la venta ambulante, y comenta que empezó en el  negocio hace aproximadamente 8 años.
Recorre por varias zonas ofreciendo sus productos y de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar y otros productos para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose is 33 years old and is accompanied by Maria who is 26 years old and with whom he has a 6 year old daughter.

Jose is a street vendor and says he started the business about 8 years ago. He goes throughout various areas offering his products and in this way makes an honest and dignified living. He is a hardworking and enterprising person.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy shoes, clothing, bazaar items, and other products so he can continue his work.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, bazaar items, and other products to sell as a street vendor

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee un negocio de venta de cereales y granos básicos desde hace 3 años su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor  para surtir el negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 21 years old and lives in a high risk area.  She has owned a business selling cereals and basic grains for three years.  Her business is located at the municipal market and has many customers.  She lives at home with her family.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise at wholesale to stock her business so she can have more income and more stable finances.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and basic grains at wholesale.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Melanie earns more income from food vending and motorcycle transport. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this new loan to further build her businesses.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Karen Azucena

texts.es:
Karen, vive actualmente con su esposo y su hija de tres años de edad, ella se dedica  a vender ropa para apoyar económicamente a su esposo y juntos poder cubrir las necesidades primordiales del hogar, desarrolla está actividad desde hace más de 2 años, el oficio lo heredo de su mamá, únicamente vende los días lunes, martes, viernes y sábado, sin horario establecido, es un negocio que puede mantener con actividad sin descuidar a su familia.
El negocio promueve productos que constantemente se renuevan los estilos, ella requiere de un crédito para comprar pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas entre otras prendas de vestir que están de moda y que sus clientes demandan, pretende tener un inventario más surtido para ir atrayendo nuevos clientes y aumentar las ventas.
Su objetivo es tener más ingresos para cancelar la deuda lo antes posible y mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Karen currently lives with her husband and three year old daughter. Her job is selling clothes to financially support her husband and together they cover their household's most essential needs. She's been in this line of work for over 2 years, a trade that she inherited from her mother. Mondays, Tuesdays, Fridays, and Saturdays are the only days she sells, and not on a fixed schedule. 

It's a business that she can work on without neglecting her family. The business sells products that are constantly being updated with changing styles, and she requires a loan to purchase pants, skirts, shirts, and blouses amongst other trendy garments that her customers want. She hopes to have a more varied inventory so that she can keep attracting new customers and increase her sales.

Her objective is to increase her income to pay off the loan as soon as possible and improve she and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pants, skirts, shirts, amongst other trendy garments that her customers want.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon es un señor de 49 años de edad, proveniente de Medellín, que se dedica a la carpintería junto con su esposa.

Su sueño es mejorar la condición de su vivienda, pues esta no se encuentra en buen estado.

Con el préstamo el abastecerá su negocio comprando madera y asi poder ofrecer empleo, generar más productos y más adelante abrir nuevos negocios.

Ayuda a que el sueño de Jhon se cumpla, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 49-year-old man, from Medellin, dedicated to carpentry along with his wife. His dream is to improve the condition of his house since it is not in a good shape. 

With the loan, he will supply his business by buying wood in order to be able to offer employment, generate more products, and later, open new businesses. Help make Jhon´s dream come true. Make a contribution.

loans.use: to buy wood to supply his business

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two infant grandchildren. She has been involved in farming activities for more than 25 years. Over those difficult years, Hranush, due to her tireless work on the farm, was able to sustain her family's living with the income from farming. She currently keeps cattle (five calves) and 25 hens. Hranush and her son also cultivate wheat, potatoes and onions in the family yard near the house. Hranush plans to use the requested loan to renovate the barn and also purchase forage for the cattle. It is vital for Hranush to receive your support and improve her farm, to which she has devoted most of her life.

Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Hranush's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and purchase forage for feeding the cattle

loans.name: Jairo Andres

texts.es:
Jairo un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, no cuenta con el apoyo de familiares y se encuentra desempleado; esto llevo a buscar opciones para salir adelante y desea montar su propio negocio de comidas en Medellín.
Su mayor sueño es tener casa propia y así tener algo más estable.

Solicita un crédito para realizar la compra de los alimentos que le permita trabajar en este como los panes, salchichas, salsas y desechables.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Jairo a continuar con su proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Jairo, a 26-year-old single man, does not have the support of family members and finds himself unemployed. This led him to look for options to get ahead and he wishes to start his own food business in Medellín.

His greatest dream is to have his own home and in that way have something more stable. He requests a loan to buy food, which will allow him to work in this way, such as bread, sausages, sauces, and disposable items.

With a loan you will be able to support Jairo in continuing with his life plan.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, sauces, and disposable items.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Agée de 40 ans, Adjo est une femme mariée qui vit avec six enfants à Baguida. Pour favoriser l’épanouissement de sa famille, Adjo vend des poupées pour bébés qu’elle expose au marché et dans le quartier. Adjo réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des poupées, Adjo demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille
texts.en: Forty years old, Adjo is a married woman who lives with six children in Baguida. To encourage the growth of her family, Adjo sells dolls for babies that she shows at the market and in her neighborhood. Adjo is achieving a profit because of this business and resupplies three times per month at the market. Adjo is requesting this loan to finance her order of plush toys and to have a profit margin that will help her to contribute more to the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 70 plush toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase energy-saving stoves and solar lights at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jitahidi Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Anah. She is fifty-three years old, married and the mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.

She does maize, potato and bean farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, which has assisted her in budgeting and record keeping. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer and seeds so that she can increase her output. This will assist her to cater for the family needs and to pay school fees for the children.

Anah is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer and seeds that will improve output and thus provide for family needs such as school fees.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 24 years old, married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from the trainings, especially in enterprise development.

She is involved in poultry farming and has a carpentry workshop. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed so as to increase egg production. This will enable her to meet customer demands and also earn more income to pay for her child’s tuition fees.

Mercy is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for increased egg production to meet customer demands and earn more income to pay for her child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 30 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, domicilio en el distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.

Julio se dedica a brindar servicio de peluquerpia, hace 10 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, con muy buenas referencias de parte de sus clientes. Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de espejos, muebles, tintes para cabello, entre otros, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversiónon, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes, generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is 30 years old and single, no children. He lives in his family home in the district of Oyotun, a rural zone in the province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

He has worked for ten years offering hair salon services. His business is located in his domicile, and he has very good references from his clients.

He's requesting this loan for working capital use. He will buy mirrors, furniture, hair tints and more. The loan will help him upgrade his services and expand the business in order to meet his clients' needs, thereby earning more income and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mirrors, furniture, hair tints and more for his hair salon.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, él se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar y maíz desde hace 30 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 65 years old and lives in a house he owns with his life partner.  He has worked growing sugarcane and corn for 30 years.  He sells his products at different markets located close to his home.  The money he earns from his sales is able to meet some of his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and manure to continue with his work and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, 35, is a smallholder farmer based in Nyamira, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He is married and has five children. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. On his 1.5-acre farm, you will find 1 dairy cow, 18 heads of poultry, 3 sheep, 150 trees, and a small-scale tea plantation. 

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Andrew is seeking a loan to buy one of those. Your loan will enable him to access formal markets in new geographic and economic regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run. 

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Andrew's family since the newly acquired asset will create new markets for their produce and facilitate interactions among them and others in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Like other people, what Marilyn just dreams for her family is to get out from the breadline and have a more affordable kind of living someday. Aiming to fast track this, Marilyn manages her current business (sari-sari store) with a lot of passion and diligence. Recently, she availed herself of a loan that was faithfully paid back. With the given amount of PHP 10,000, she was able to supply her store with a sufficient-enough supply of grocery items that she sold for a source of income.

To continue the improvement in her current inventory, she would like to request again a loan amounting to PHP 22,000 that she will use to buy more stock and supplies of merchandise products. If granted, this will be a wide-open opportunity for her to gain a better income profit then. If this happens, it will greatly soothe her family's expenditures.

For now, she would like to give you her sincerest thanks.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock and supplies of merchandise products.

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married and has a child. She sells Tupperware products.  Even though they don't financially need her money, she wants to keep herself busy and earn her own money. With the help of this job she had made lots of friends and neighborhood and she says that it made her feel very good.  Her dream is to raise her daughter and enable her to have a good education in the best way she can. With the help of her loan she is buying Tupperware products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Özlem hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Tupperware ürünleri satıyor. Eşinin maddi imkanlarından dolayı bu işe ihtiyacı olmasa da kendisi boş durmayı sevmediğinden ve kendi kazancının olmasını istediğinden bu işi yaptığını söylüyor. Arkadaşlarının ve çevresinin çoğaldığını bu işin kendisine çok iyi geldiğini söylüyor. Hayali kızını büyütmek ve eğitimini en iyi şekilde tamamlamasını sağlamak. Aldığı krediler ile tupperware ürünleri alıyor.

loans.use: to buy Tupperware products

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman is married and a mother of three. She started with the Amway products as a user and she was very satisfied with their products so she started promoting them to her neighborhood.  She got lots of demands so she started selling.  At first people found these products expensive but she overcame this by making more promotions. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy the products and make sales. She wants to make more money out of this and become a group leader. She wants to go on the pilgrimage to Mecca.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Asuman Hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Kullanıcısı olarak başladığı Amway ürünlerinden memnun kalınca çevresine de tanıtıp yapmaya başlamış.  Gelen talepler doğrultusunda satmaya başlamış.  İlk başlarda ürün insanlara pahalı gelmiş, satış da biraz sıkıntı çekse de tanıtımlarla bu zorlukları aşmış.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün alıp satış yapacak.  Bu iş den daha çok gelir elde etmek ve grup lideri olmak istiyor.  Umreye gitmek hayali.

loans.use: to buy Amway products

loans.name: Antonio José

texts.es: Antonio es un joven de 29 años que en compañía de su cónyuge, iniciaron unas confecciones de prendas de vestir hace cuatro años.  Aprovecharon el saber hacer de la familia de su novia que mientras ella estudiaba diseño de modas y hacia los diseños, los entregaba a su mamá para su confección y posteriormente los comercializaban.  Con las utilidades de esta actividad poco a poco fue adquiriendo las máquinas de coser  y actualmente tiene 3 empleados para atender contratos de maquila que consiste en el servicio de confección o ensamblaje de productos con piezas elaboradas por terceros.  Antonio tiene en su cabeza una cantidad de ideas novedosas para dejar de maquilar y realizar su propios diseños de tal manera que en el mes de febrero de éste años hicieron una prueba piloto; diseñaron y confeccionaron camisas de carnaval con gran éxito y un buen margen de utilidad, por eso está aplicando para su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario santo Domingo para invertir en la compra de telas e insumos que requiere para confeccionar sus propios diseños y vender directamente a los almacenes. Su meta es tener un local propio, posicionar su línea de ropa y a largo plazo adquirir una vivienda.
texts.en:
Antonio is 29 years old.  Together with his wife, he started sewing clothing four years ago.  They took advantage of her family's knowledge, and while she studied fashion design and designed clothing, her mother sewed the clothing and they later sold it.  With the profits from this activity, they slowly began acquiring sewing machines, and they now have three employees who work on contracts to assemble clothing either by sewing or assembling products with pieces made by third parties.  

Antonio has a lot of new ideas in his head so they can stop taking assembly work and start making their own designs.  In February of this year, they started a pilot program: they successfully designed and sewed shirts for Carnival and made a good profit.  For this reason, they are requesting their first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of fabrics and supplies that they need to sew their own designs and sell them directly to stores.  His goal is to have his own shop, build his clothing line, and in the long-term, buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and supplies that he needs to sew his own designs and sell them directly to stores.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 63 year old, married mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from the training, particularly in enterprise development.

Mary practices mixed farming. She farms kale, cabbages, potatoes, maize and also has rabbits, poultry, goats and does dairy farming. She also sells footwear to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer to increase her vegetable production. She believes this will add to her stock hence allowing her to meet her customers' demands. She also plans to use the profits to add stock to her footwear shop.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizers and hence add stock to her vegetable farm to meet customers' demands. She will use the profits to add stock to her footwear shop.

loans.name: Mukuru Wa Karanjee Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Hannah. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of six children. Two of her children are still in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2013 to benefit from the training, especially in enterprise development.

Hannah practices mixed farming i.e. poultry, dairy, goats, potatoes and maize farming. She is also involved in the second hand clothes selling business to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more second hand clothes to add stock and hence meet her customers' demands.

She is very happy and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes for sale and add stock to enable her to meet customers' demands.

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en:
Nunung lives in Garut, a city located about four hour’s drive from Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her two three daughters. Nunung works as a teacher in one public school Garut. She joined Ruma last year because she really wants to become an entrepreneur. She knew Ruma from a Ruma sales executive who came to her house. Now, Nunung is providing the services that allow her customers to buy mobile phone credits.

As the business grows, Nunung is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Nunung improve her business and accordingly, her village community who needs access to such services.

Nunung is the one who is seen in the photo. She is very thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her village community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Cyndy Edith

texts.es:
CYNDY EDITH TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIVIENTE, VIVE CON ESPOSO E HIJOS, EN CASA PROPIA, EN UNA COMUNIDAD GRANDE EN LA ZONA URBANA DEL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE PREPARACION Y VENTA DE CHAMPUS Y CACAHANGAS, DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD,EN EL MISMO DISTRITO DE CAYALTI. SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MESA Y SILLAS Y RENOVAR UTENCILIOS DE COCINA PARA LA PREPARACION DE LOS ALIMENTOS QUE VENDE, DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Cyndy Edith, age 27, is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband and children in her own house.  She lives in a big community in an urban area in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Her business activity is preparing and selling ‘champus’ [a warm drink made with corn and fruit] and ‘cacahangas’ [fried dough].  She has been doing this for three years at the corner of Paseo La Reforma Avenue and Jr. El Progreso in the Cayalti district.

She is requesting a loan to buy a table and chairs and to replace kitchen utensils she uses to prepare the food she sells.  This way she will make her business grow, get more income, and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a table and chairs and to replace kitchen utensils she uses to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is the mother of three children (two sons and a daughter). Her elder son, who is 21 years old, and her husband work as migrant laborers in Russia and time by time support the family. Marine, together with her two other children, is involved in farming. The farm includes two cows, two calves and two piglets. The family also cultivates potatoes and cabbage in their own yard near the house. Everyone in the family has his own task with the farm: Marine's son is responsible for taking the cattle to the pasture, and her daughter helps with the household and land cultivation. 

Marine and her kids ask lenders to support their farm. They need to purchase nine piglets, fertilizer, pesticides, forage for the cattle, and fuel for land cultivation. This is very important investment for the farm and Marine hopes for lenders' support. Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Marine's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region, to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for nine piglets, fertilizer, pesticides, forage for the cattle, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Turgunai

texts.ru: Тургунай, 25 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. Тургунай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 3 года назад. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день у нее есть корова, 10 овец, также она выращивает на собственном участке мерою 0,06 ГА кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет от 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тургунай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 овец для откорма и продажи . Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Turgunai is 25 years old, married, and has two sons. Turgunai rears animals and grows crops as the main source of income for her family, having started three years ago. Thanks to her hard work, today she has a cow and ten sheep, and she also grows corn on a 0.06 plot of her own land. Her monthly income is from 9,000 som (KGS).
