In order to develop her business further, Turgunai has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy five sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy five sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives with her husband and son in Hovit village in Shirak region. 

This family owns a beautiful and successful farm where they keep cattle (4 cows, 7 calves, 30 sheep, a pig, and 20 hens). On the family yard, Alvard and her husband also cultivate wheat and sell it in the market. 

The loan is very important for Alvard to purchase a land mower needed for the farm to improve land cultivation works. Because the region where their village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Alvard's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

This hardworking woman, with many years of experience in farming beyond her, hopes to receive your support and improve her farm.

loans.use: to purchase a land mower needed for the farm to improve land cultivation works

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa, delantales, gabachas y manteles tiene 8 años de experiencia en la costura su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes que la buscan por su buen trabajo, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de telas por mayor para poder seguir produciendo mas mercadería y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
This young lady, who's face has been blurred as she is aged 29 and living in a high-risk area, makes and sells clothing, aprons, smocks and tablecloths.
 
She has eight years of experience sewing. She runs her business from home, and has many customers who seek her out for her good work. She lives in her own home together with her spouse. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fabrics wholesale so that she can continue producing goods and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabric wholesale

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат, 57 лет, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. На протяжении 30 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы с 2 телятами, 5 овец, 4 лошади. На 3,20 Га земли она выращивает перец, фасоль, клевер для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саламат решила обратиться в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Саламат намерена свои доходы вкладывать в увеличение поголовья скота и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Salamat is 57 years old and married. Her children are grown up and independent. She has been rearing animals and growing crops for 30 years. She has two dairy cows with two calves, five sheep, and four horses. She grows peppers, beans, and clover for sale and for use on her farm on 3.20 hectares of land. In order to develop her business further, Salamat has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers for fattening and resale. Salamat intends to invest her proceeds in increasing the size of her herd and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Nor Kharberd village of Ararat region, where she lives with her husband and two children. Near the house, the family owns a yard where they cultivate haricots, potatoes, tomatoes, and greens. They also grow mushrooms. They are already specialized in mushroom production and have loyal clients who purchase mushrooms from them.
 
Ruzanna asks for this loan to purchase and install a ventilation system for their mushroom-growing area. This is important for the mushroom production especially in hot weather, because there is a special required temperature for mushrooms.
 
As this is Ruzanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative almost 500 borrowers like Ruzanna get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses.

loans.use: to pay for and install a ventilation system for growing mushrooms

loans.name: Consuelo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario  Consuelo está conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas coordinado por doña Brunilda de 60 años, soltera madre de dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes, ella es una señora luchadora quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla y frijoles cocidos desde hace cinco años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de maiz, leña, frijoles y ajo. La segunda socia es Judith de 38 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y la tercer socia es Lidia de 37 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The Consuelo group is made up of three hardworking women and is coordinated by Brunilda, a 60 year-old single mother of two adult, independent children. She is a determined woman who has been selling tortillas and cooked beans for five years. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase corn, firewood, beans and garlic. 

The second member is Judith who is 38 years old and sells clothing. The third member is Lidia who is 37 years old and sells clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, beans and garlic.

loans.name: Zhyldyzai

texts.ru: Жылдызай, 33 года, замужем, есть 2 детей-школьников. У нее высшее образование, занимается торговлей одеждой и обувью. У Жылдызай есть товар в обороте на сумму 315,100 сом (KGS). Жылдызай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды и обуви для продажи. Доходы от ведения бизнеса она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Zhyldyzai is 33 years old, married, and has two school-age children. She has a higher education and sells clothing and shoes. Zhyldyzai has goods in stock worth 315,100 som (KGS). Zhyldyzai has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy clothing and shoes for sale. She plans to invest the income from running her business in further developing the business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Gabrieli

texts.en:
Gabrieli is 41 years old from the village of Gomi. He lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law. Gabrieli is busy with a small-scale agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the monthly income from their agricultural business. They have a vineyard and a plot of land where nut trees and maize are grown. They sell nuts and maize at the local open market. Gabrieli sometimes works as an artisan on a private orders. The average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL. It is hardly enough for food for a four member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Gabrieli's loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Gabrieli will purchase cattle and after several months the family will start producing dairy products for local selling. 

This credit will be a great support for the family. Gabrieli is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and expand the agribusiness

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
Emelia is fifty years old, married and lives in Teshie, a urban town in Accra. For more than fifteen years she has sold fish and slippers to earn an income. She is also the leader of this three-member group.

The main hardship Emelia faces in her endeavors is a lack of capital to build her businesses. Her family is a low-income household in the city; moreover, the market need is low in this region. She has nothing substantial enough to serve as collateral to get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

In 2008 Emelia joined Kiva's field partner ID-Ghana to improve her business. She successfully repaid seven prior loans and now is applying for a 4,500 GHS loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her share to buy more slippers and fish to resell.

Emelia hopes her profits will help her keep her family healthy and happy and her business prosperous.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and fish to resell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en: Ines has a kiosk. To improve her kiosk, she is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to buy needed items to keep in her kiosk. She opened her kiosk in 2013. She lives in her simple house with her family. She hopes to build a good house and make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: To buy eggs, soft drinks, instant noodles, toothpaste, and others

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Paraguarí, está en su ciclo número 23 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, se unieron para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Alicia, es una persona muy trabajadora que está luchando para poder mejorar sus condicione de vida y la de su familia.   Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos, ya que tiene una mercería que con mucho esfuerzo monto y que hoy día ya tiene mucha clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe a través del programa de comités.
texts.en:
San Roque is a group formed in the city of Paraguarí, currently in its 23rd cycle of the Women's Committee Program, in which everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. They have come together to be able to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is Alicia, a very hard working person who is fighting to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions. She works selling all kinds of products, she has a store which she set up with much hard work, and which now has many customers.

She is requesting this loan to buy various articles of clothing, shoes and housewares, among other things. This way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving through this Committee Program.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing, shoes, housewares and other things.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra Maria vive con su marido y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Itá, tiene una despensa bien surtida con clientela ya formada que siempre compra de ella todo lo que vende.
Maria comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero hoy día ya ha crecido mucho gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas, y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and two children in the city of Itá. She has a well-stocked store with established clientele who always buys everything she sells. 

Maria says that in the beginning it was very difficult for her, but today her business has grown a lot thanks to her effort and sacrifice. She is putting everything she has into it in order to be able to grow and improve. 

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase items for her store, such as vegetables, fruits, meat, drinks and more. With the loan she can continue with her sales and continue striving to improve.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, drinks and more.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru:
Ситоре 32 лет. Она уроженка района Пяндж. Ситора замужем и имеет двоих детей. Его муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Ситора очень ответственная и целеустремленная женщина с большими планами на жизнь. 3 года назад Ситора решила начать торговую деятельность. Она начала заниматься продажей помидоры и арбуз, и по сей день Ситора продвигает данную деятельность. В работе ей нравится общаться с людьми и продавать овощи. 
   Ситора в районе живет свекровью, мужем и детьми. Она хотела купить кондиционер для дома, потому что сейчас в Пяндже очень жарко, без кондиционера дома сидеть не возможно, и ее дети, еще маленькие им очень жарко будет. Ситора очень хочет купить кондиционер, но у нее нет такая сумма денег. По этой причине она просит кредит. Она видит выход из положения только в получении кредита. Ситора надеется на Вашу помощь. Поддержите ее!
texts.en:
Sitora is 32 years old. She is a native of the Pyandj region. Sitora is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Sitora is a very responsible and ambitious woman with big plans for life. Three years ago Sitora decided to start a trading business. She began selling tomatoes and watermelon, and to this day she continues this business. What she likes about the work is communicating with people and selling vegatables.

Sitora lives in the area with her mother-in-law, husband and children. She would like to buy an air conditioner for her home because it is very hot now in Pyandj. It is not possible to stay home without an air conditioner, and her children are still small and they will get very hot. Sitora really wants to buy an air conditioner, but she does not have such a sum of money. For this reason she is asking for a loan. She sees a way out of the situation only through receiving a loan. Sitora hopes for your help. Please support her!

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner for her home.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. She has a business of tailoring and designing plus rearing chicken that gives her more income. She faces challenges of defaulters that hinder expansion of her business, making it hard for her to pay school fees on time. Enid has asked for another loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata, 35, is married and has two children aged nineteen and six years. In 2000, she started her fabric business. Her sales site is located in the city center, and her main customers are women. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month.

Fatmata is applying for a 5,000,000 SLL loan through Kiva's field partner ARD to buy more rolls of fabric, including lace, waxed cotton and silk, to sell. She hopes that this loan will help her to buy inventory that customers frequently ask for.

Fatmata plans to expand her business, educate her children and buy a piece of land. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of fabric, including lace, waxed cotton and silk, to sell.

loans.name: Gelard

texts.en:
Gelard is a hardworking married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children to higher levels. He has been a farmer for 10 years. He grows and sells matooke and his main hardships are price fluctuations and seasonal weather. Gelard has a vision of having a better standard of living.

He needs a loan to buy more matooke to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy more matooke (bananas) to add to his business.

loans.name: Dalersho

texts.ru:
Далершо мужчина в самом рассвете сил. Ему 39 лет. Она прекрасный муж и ответственный отец. У Далершо большая семья. Вместе с его женой и детьми живет его брат со своей семьей. Далершо имеет грузовую машину и продает в нем каменный уголь. 
  Далершо решил начать новую деятельность в сфере торговли, но совсем в другом направлении. Он будет заниматься продажей арбузов. В Шахритусе (где он живет) растут самые сладкие арбузы в Республике. Многие приезжают сюда, чтобы приобрести арбузов. Уже начался сезон арбузов и дыни, и Далершо хочет за счет кредита приобрести арбузов начать бизнес.
texts.en:
Dalersho is a man at the peak of his powers. He is 39 years old. He is a wonderful husband and responsible father. Dalersho has a large family. He, his wife and children live together with his brother and his family. Dalersho has a truck and sells coal from it.

Dalersho has decided to start a new business in the field of trading, but in an entirely different direction. He will sell watermelon. The most sweet watermelon in the Republic grow in Shahrituz (where he lives). Many people go there to buy watermelon. The season for watermelon and melons has already begun, and Dalersho wnats to buy watermelon to start his business with a loan.

loans.use: to start a new business selling watermelon.

loans.name: Kasusu Twekambe Group

texts.en: Oliver is a member of Kasusu Twekambe Group where members guarantee each other. She is a widow living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells second hand clothes and at the same time she sells beer to earn more income. She started these businesses with the hope of earning a living. She has asked for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Kasambara Sweet Potatoes Growers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Miriam, a member of Kasambara Sweet Potatoes Growers Self Help Group. She is 46 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in June 2014.

Miriam does maize, dairy, and poultry farming. Having gone through enterprise training provided by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she is now able to manage a business venture and steer it to profitability. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to start a dry cereals shop where she would sell maize, beans, and millet to capitalize on the demand from the surrounding community. She hopes to obtain more income to supplement her farming business. This will enable her to support her children’s education and provide other family needs.

She is happy with Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and millet to help boost income and thus provide for family needs with ease

loans.name: Astry De Lourdes

texts.es:
Astry es una joven de 24 años de edad es soltera vive junto a sus queridos padres en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá.
Astry para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como agente de negocios en una institución privada ella tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor, pero ella es una joven con muchos propósitos en la vida es por ello que para  mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica al cultivo de tomate, Astry tiene la fortuna de vivir en una zona que es muy productiva  por tal razón ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar una cuerda de terreno donde ella pudiera seguir incrementado su cultivo de tomate y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Astry tiene el anhelo de conseguir el crédito para poder comprar el terreno.
texts.en:
Astry is a 24 year old young woman, who is single and lives with her dear parents in a community in the Sololá department.

To obtain an income and provide for her family Astry works as a business agent for a private company. She has been doing this for five years, but she is a youngster with many goals in life, so to improve her income she also grows tomatoes. Astry is lucky enough to live in a very productive area, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land where she can continue increasing her tomato crops and thus increase her income.

Astry wishes to obtain this loan so that she can buy the land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Эту милую и общительную женщину зовут Гулнора. Она жительница города Куляба. Она замечательная жена и хорошая мать. Гулнора с мужем занимается продажей фруктов на рынке. Благодаря её отзывчивости доброжелательности, клиенты всегда покупают у неё.  Она всегда с улыбкой встречает их. Так как Хумо поддерживает женщин и предлагает им более выгодные условия кредитования, Гулнора решила с помощью заёмных средств расширить свой бизнес. Она хочет приобрести фрукты и овощи и продать их с наценкой. Гулнора очень надеется в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: This sweet and social woman is called Gulnora. She is a resident of the town of Kulob. She is a wonderful wife and a good mother. Gulnora and her husband sell fruits at the market. Thanks to her kind-heartedness and good will, clients always buy from her. She always meets them with a smile. Since Humo supports women and offers them more favorable loan conditions, Gulnora has decided to expand her business with the help of borrowed funds. She wants to acquire fruits and vegetables and to sell them at a premium. Gulnora very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and to expand her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina  is a 34-year-old resident of Ronda, Cebu, in the Philippines. She raises hogs in order to make a living for her family. She also owned a general store. However, at this time the income from her business is not enough to sustain all of her family’s needs since she is also supporting a nine-year-old daughter.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI to purchase hog feed, seasoning, condiments, toiletries, and canned food. Feed is needed to ensure that they will grow to a sufficient size that will bring in a good price when sold. This will help her expand her business and give her the opportunity to continue reinvesting in it.

The additional income Catalina  will make from the increased hog sales will be used for her family’s daily consumption. When her business becomes self-sustainable, Catalina would also like to look at other business options to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, seasoning, condiments, toiletries, and canned food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and school supplies.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 47-year-old married woman with 2 children who are 16 and 19 years old. They  live in Ronda, Cebu. Gemma has raised pigs for six  years. 

She needs a loan to buy  feed and school supplies (June is the start of the school year). She will buy bags, paper, pencils and a ruler.  In the future, Gemma wants the best of her children, especially  a good education.

loans.use: to buy feed, bags, paper, pencils, and a ruler.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 39 years old, from the town of Moaboal, Cebu. She is married with five children, aged between 7 and 20. She has had a hog raising business and food vending business for seven years now, earning her 10,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, sugar, cooking oil, noodles and seasoning for these businesses. 

The income that Marivic generates from her businesses help her meet basic household needs like food and school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy feed, sugar, cooking oil, noodles and seasoning for her businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugar and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and maintain work tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 46 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices mixed farming as her economic activity. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy tree seedlings and fertilizer to expand her farming by starting a tree nursery business. This will increase her income to enable her pay for quality health care services and renovate her family house. 

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and her lender for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy tree seedlings and fertilizer to expand her farming to a tree nursery business for increased income to pay for quality health care services and renovate her family house.

loans.name: Wendani Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Mary. She is 58 years old, married and a mother to eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She practices dairy farming and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy quality dairy feed. This will increase milk production to meet customers' demands and earn more income. With the increased income, she will be able to provide a quality education to her children and also provide better clothing to them.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality dairy feed to increase milk production, and hence, earn more income to pay for her children's school fees and better clothing.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 47 years old, married, and living with her husband and 3 children, one of whom is still in primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from their training, especially in enterprise development.

Lucy is involved in dairy, poultry, and pig farming. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy more poultry and poultry feed which will enable her to increase egg production. With increased stock, she will be able to meet her customers' demands, earn more income, and pay her child's tuition fees.

Lucy is happy and grateful to Kiva's lenders for their financial support. She promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy poultry and poultry feed which will increase her income so she can pay her child's school fees.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas lives in Liquica. She is applying for a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a clothes shop and she also sells at the market. She has requested this loan because she wants to add it to her working capital to buy more clothes such as T-shirts, trousers and other clothes to sell. 

Domingas has been involved in business activities since 2002, she started with her own working capital of $10. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because many people like to buy them, so she is still happy to do her business.  With the profits from her loan she hopes to increase her business with a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes to resell to the public.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
For a year now, Moises has been raising hogs. He lives in Badian, Cebu with his family. He has two children to support, aged two and six. He is asking for a loan to invest more in his business. He will use it to buy feed for the hogs and school supplies for his children such as bags, paper, pencils and notebooks. 

Moises is hopeful that with the additional capital he will have a better profit that will continue to support his basic household needs. In the future, Moises hopes to have a bigger business and a more sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy feed for the hogs and school supplies for his children such as bags, paper, pencils and notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of canned goods, chips, eggs and noodles etc.

Lourdes has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, chips, eggs and noodles etc.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Isata. She is married and has four children aged 20, 18, 14 and 10. She has three additional dependents, who live with her and assist in the business.  

In 2005, Isata established her school, travel and ladies bags business. She inherited the business from her mother and since she was not fortunate enough to go to school, Isata decided to use the business as her own career.   

Isata's business is located in at the city center and her main customers are men and women. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1030000 every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5000000 to buy bales of used school and travel bags for resale. She hopes that this loan will increase her business capital and profit. 

In the future, Isata plans to travel to neighboring countries to buy her stock and to buy a piece of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of used school and travel bags.

loans.name: Raechel

texts.en:
Raechel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Raechel has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa and rice.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a smallholder farmer based in Siongiroi, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. His major challenge is marketing and distribution.
 
Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, like Wesley, reasonably-priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Wesley is seeking a loan to buy such a motorcycle. Your loan will enable him access to formal markets in a new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run. 

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Wesley's family since the newly acquired asset will create new markets for their produce and facilitate interactions among them and other actors in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add capital in her cocoa business by buying more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina would like  to borrow  $600.00 to improve her business which she started in 2006. She lives in Liquica and sells cows. 

She wants  loan to buy more animals and have working capital.  She also raised buffalo, cows, pigs, and goats.

loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds for resale.

loans.name: Zenabou

texts.fr: Zenabou est âgée de 45 ans et vit à Baguida. Mariée, Zenabou travaille dynamiquement pour aider son mari pour leur épanouissement. Zenabou vend des céréales et des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier afin de trouver son gain quotidien. Zenabou s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile Zenabou demande ce prêt pour réaliser son objectif et gagner un profit pour contribuer à l’avancement de la famille.
texts.en: Zenabou is 45 years old and lives in Baguida. Married, Zenabou works energetically to help her husband with their growth. Zenabou sells grains and general food products in her neighborhood in order to make a daily profit. Zenabou resupplies five times per month at the market. Zenabou is requesting this loan to buy sacks of rice and some bottles of oil so she can reach her goals and make a profit to contribute to her family's advancement.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and two bottles of oil.

loans.name: Mua Family Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Josephine, a member of Mua Family SHG Group. She is 54 years old, married and a mother of nine children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from the training, in particular in enterprise development. 

Josephine is keeps indigenous poultry as her main source of income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more indigenous chicks, chicken feed, vaccines and also to put up a good poultry structure for the chicken in an effort to increase the poultry production.  This will increase her income and enable her to pay for family expenses such as food, health care services and school fees.

Josephine is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, chicken feed, vaccines and to build a poultry structure to improve their poultry production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as experienced. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea for resale

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en: Anderson is a  Kiva borrower. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are locals. He describes his challenge to be lack of enough clean water for his household. Anderson will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank, gutters and iron sheets to enable him harvest rain water for domestic use. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank, gutters and iron sheets

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a married mother of one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a photography business. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy materials to improve her bathroom. This is Peninah's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her bathroom

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he grows tea. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Patrick will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His orevious loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor sewerage. Charity will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy materials to improve her toilet. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her toilet

loans.name: Edith Del Rosario

texts.es: Edith de 62 años es una mujer con enorme capacidad para superar obstáculos y alcanzar las metas que se propone a base de esfuerzo y trabajando con responsabilidad, honestidad y sobre todo con sensibilidad para hacer más amable la vida de quienes le rodean. Se siente orgullosa de sus 51 años de experiencia en la venta de ropa, calzado y artículos para el hogar y que lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es el contacto con la gente, escucharla y sobre todo estar siempre al pendiente del más mínimo detalle; cualidad que la ha llevado a mantenerse activa en los negocios, pues además del punto de venta en su casa, ella sale a realizar las entregas personalmente. Edith está aspirando a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de invertir en la compra de mecedoras, juegos de comedor, adornos y sillas, mercancía que demanda su clientela y con la cual aspira a incrementar sus utilidades. Edith afirma que el entusiasmo por asumir nuevos retos no decae con la edad, por lo tanto sueña con reunir los recursos suficientes para adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edith, aged 62, is a woman with an enormous capacity to overcome obstacles and reach the goals she aims for, using strength and working with responsibility, integrity and above all sensitivity to better the lives of those around her. 

She is proud of her 51 years experience selling clothing, shoes and household articles. What she likes most about her work is the contact with other people, listening to them and above all being constantly listening out for every detail. This is a quality which has allowed her to stay active in business, because as well as her store within her home, she also carries out deliveries herself. 

With her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Edith is hoping to buy rocking chairs, dining sets, ornaments and chairs, goods which her customers are requesting and with which she hopes to increase her usefulness. Edith confirms that her enthusiasm for taking on new challenges does not diminish with age, so she is dreaming of gaining the sufficient resources to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy rocking chairs, dining sets, ornaments and chairs.

loans.name: Anatelia

texts.es: Hace 20 años Anatelia se incorporó a la vida comercia gracia a la recomendación de una amiga, quien le ofreció la oportunidad vender productos por catálogo, obtuvo buenos resultados y decidió incorporarse como consultora; ella está satisfecha con los  resultados generados en esta actividad, pues le ha permitido obtener ingresos y  apoyar a la economía familiar pues considera que una mujer emprendedora no sólo beneficia su desarrollo personal, sino que también contribuye a una mejor calidad de vida de quienes están bajo su responsabilidad.  Ella ofrece los productos de la oferta como calzado, ropa, productos cosméticos los cuáles promociona mediante visitas a sus clientes ubicados en el barrio y barrios aledaños a su residencia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en calzado, prendas de vestir y demás artículos ofrecidos en la revista.  Con esta  inversión espera un incremento en sus ventas y unas mejores utilidades y aspira en el futuro adquirir unas vitrinas donde exhibir sus productos, tener su casa propia y brindarle  una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Twenty years ago Anatelia joined the business world thanks to the recommendation of a friend who offered her the opportunity to sell catalogue products. She had good results and decided to join as a sales representative. She is satisfied with the results she gets in this business. It has allowed her to earn income and support her family economically, as an enterprising woman not only benefits her own personal development, but also contributes to a better quality of life for those who live under her responsibility.

She offers products such as footwear, clothing, and cosmetics, which she promotes through visits to clients in her neighborhood and in neighborhoods surrounding her residence. 

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which is the first loan she has applied for with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in footwear, articles of clothing and other items offered in the catalogue. With this investment she hopes to increase her sales and have higher profits. In the future she aspires to acquire a showcase to display her products, to have a home of her own, and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to invest in footwear, articles of clothing, and other items offered in the catalogue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip aged 49 is a hardworking married man with four children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. 

His main business is produce buying and selling in addition to commercial farming and retail trading for extra income. 

After realizing that his family demands were increasing, Philip got involved in business and plans to expand his business into new market areas by opening up other outlet stores in the neighboring centers for easy access by his customers. 

Philip's hardships include inadequate capital for trade during the peak season and price fluctuations of produce. 

He will use the loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He relies on livestock and crop farming to provide for the needs of his family. Over the years, his major challenge has been transportation of his produce, given that few vehicles have access to his village due to poor road conditions.   

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Nathan is seeking a loan to buy one of those. Your loan will enable him to access formal markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run. 

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Nathan's family, since the newly acquired asset will create new markets for their produce and facilitate interactions among them and other actors in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa.

loans.name: L'aide De Dieu Group

texts.fr:
M. HAMIDOU est responsable du groupe  L’AIDE DE DIEU. Marié il père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 02 an. 02 des enfants vont à l’école et il a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis 40 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 04 sacs d’engrais et 10 boites d’insecticides. 
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Il compte aussi s’occuper de sa famille et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou is the head of the group "L'Aide de Dieu" (God's Help). He is married and a father to six children. The eldest child is 14  and the youngest is 2 years old. Two of the children are in school and he takes care of 9 people. 

Mr. Hamidou has been farming and raising livestock for 40 years. He resupplies in the surrounding villages. 

With his loan, he plans to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer and 10 boxes of insecticide. Mr. Hamidou wants to use his profits to support his business. He also plans to take care of his family and to pay for his children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizer and 10 boxes of insecticides.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena lives in Liquica and her business is restaurant food. She lives near many people, so she had an idea to open her restaurant for everybody to come eat in her restaurant. She is earning a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant so she is very happy with her business. Now she is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future.

She opened her restaurant in 2010 with her own working capital of $160. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more food such as rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and other materials for the restaurant. She hopes that with this loan, her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: to increase her capital.

loans.name: Kamunyu-Ini Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Esther. She is 47 years old, married and a mother of six children of which two are still in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 so as to benefit from the trainings and especially enterprise development. 
She is involved in mixed farming i.e. dairy,  and crop farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds so as to increase milk production. This will enable her earn more income to pay school fees and buy reading materials for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to increase milk production for more income to pay school fees and buy reading material for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Las Vencedras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Vencedoras tiene 21 integrantes, ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y luchadoras que ponen lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y ayudar a sus seres queridos. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar cada día.
 La Sra. Sonia quien integra este grupo, se dedica a la venta de prendas nuevas y usadas, tiene mucha variedad de ellas, es por eso que le está yendo muy bien, y tiene ya mucha clientela. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que está poniendo su esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia. 
Sonia es una mujer sacrificada que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar y formar parte de las capacitaciones, ella pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas como remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Las Vencedoras [Winning Ladies] group has 21 members, all of whom are self-sacrificing, determined women who put their best efforts into growing and helping their loved ones. They are in this poverty elimination program, struggling to improve every day. 

Sonia, who is a member of this group, works selling new and used clothing. She has great variety and for this reason is doing well since she has a lot of clients. She is a very hardworking, tenacious woman who is putting her effort into being able to grow and get ahead in order to help her family. 

Sonia is a self-sacrificing woman who is trying her best to be able to improve and be part of the trainings. She is asking for this loan to purchase garments such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, and more in order to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, blouses and other garments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fátima está en su ciclo número 22º del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo antiguo que viene trabajando de manera unida para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo. Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente.
La Sra. Pelagia, integrante de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de mercería, ella está muy contenta porque por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Es una persona muy sacrificada que con trabajo y lucha viene mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para que por medio de sus ventas pueda seguir trabajando, quiere comprar prendas, calzados, sabanas, edredones y otros productos para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Está contenta por esta oportunidad que todas reciben.
En la foto aparecen 17 mujeres, pero solo 16 piden este préstamo y la persona restante solo integra el comité.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima group is in its 22nd cycle of the Women's Committee Program, and is a group working together to help their loved ones through their work. They all actively participate in the activities proposed by the group, and they help each other mutually.

Pelagia, a member of this group, sells all sorts of products, she is very happy as through her work she is able to help her loved ones. She is a very selfless person who with effort and hard work has been improving her own, and her loved ones' living conditions.

She is requesting this loan so that she can continue with her sales, she wishes to buy articles of clothing, shoes, sheets, quilts and other products so she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is happy for the opportunity that they are all receiving.

In this photo there are 17 women, but only 16 are requesting the loan and the other person is only a member of the committee.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing, shoes, sheets, quilts and other products.

loans.name: Dúo Donai Group

texts.es: Dúo Danai: doña Leona es casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella lo ayuda, tiene dos hijos a su cargo aun, ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones por las tardes en el mercado municipal de Santiago, vende tostadas, atoles, panes con frijoles, pollo y otros, diferentes tipos de atol, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de insumos para elaborar sus atoles y tostadas para vender.
texts.en: Dúo Danai: Leona is married. Her husband makes a living in agriculture and she helps him. She has two children who are still in her care. Leona makes a living selling snacks in the afternoons at the municipal market in Santiago. She sells tostadas (fried tortillas with toppings), atoles (hot corn and masa based beverages), breads with beans, chicken, and other types of atol. She is requesting this loan to buy consumable goods in order to prepare and sell her atoles and tostadas.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods for the preparation of snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and  school supplies for her children.
